loans.name: Rahmat

texts.ru:
Рахмат житель села Куруш Спетаменского района. Ему 55 лет.  Он женат и имеет детей. Его дети взрослые и уже обзавелись своими семьями.  Жена домохозяйка,занимается воспитанием внуков но и в свободное время помогает мужу. Сам   Рахмат очень любит природу, животных. С детства разводил животных разного вида. Любил наблюдать за ними. Повзрослев Рахмат начал откармливать скотов. Со временем перешел на более серьезное и ответственное дело, увлекся разведением крупно рогатых скатов. Животноводство само по себе занятие не легкое, оно требует не мало усилия. Но не смотря на это Рахмат с удовольствием занимается животноводством. 

Он откармливает скот на продажу. Рахмат имеет пару поголовье крупно рогатых скатов. К весне Рахмат хотел бы прикупить еще одного скота для откармливания, но ему немножко не хватает денежных средств. В надежде получить в короткий срок нужную сумму Рахмат подал заявку на кредит в МДО "Арванд". Рахмат благодарит организации за поддержку и за доверие.
texts.en: Rahmat lives in a village in the Kurush Spetamenskogo region. He is 55 years old. He is married and has children. His children are adults and have started their own families. His wife is a homemaker, who is raising their grandchildren and helping her husband in her spare time. Rahmat loves nature and animals. Since childhood, he has raised various species of animals. He has loved caring for them. Later, Rahmat began to fatten cattle. As time passed, he has turned to more serious and responsible work, such as raising large cattle. Raising livestock is no easy task; it requires a lot of effort. But despite this, Rahmat gladly raises livestock. He fattens cattle for resale. Rahmat has a pair of large horned cattle. By spring, Rahmat would like to buy one more head cattle for fattening, he does not have enough money. Hoping to get the sum in a short period of time, Rahmat has applied for a loan with MDO " Arvand ". Rahmat thanks the organizations for their support and trust.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Murodullo

texts.en:
Murodullo was born in 1967. He is a kind man who has been involved in agriculture for five years and feeds mainly cows. He sells his cows in a local market. With the profits he earns from sales, he helps cover family expenses. He lives with his family in his own home. 

He is asking for a loan of 1,500 USD to buy cows for increasing working capital. This loan will help him to develop business and maximize profit. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy cows for increasing working capital

loans.name: Turdububu

texts.ru: Турдубубу 47 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 6 детей. Двое старших детей работают помогают родителям материально, остальные школьного возраста помогают родителям по хозяйству. У Турдубубу - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Турдубубу занимается животноводством, стартовав 10 лет назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Турдубубу, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 2 лошади, 10 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). За счет доходов от животноводства Турдубубу смогла накопить деньги и купить земельный участок. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Турдубубу обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом - на покупку кобыл для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Турдубубу планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на строительство нового дома на купленном участке для сына.
texts.en:
Turdububu is 47 and married with six children. The two oldest children work and help out their parents financially, and the others are in school and help around the house. Turdububu has a high school education and works in animal husbandry as the primary source of income for her family, a business she began 10 years ago with the purchase of livestock for 10,000 KGS. Thanks to her hard work Turdububu now has two milking cows, two horses and 10 sheep, with a monthly income of 15,000 KGS. 

With the income from her farm, Turdububu has been able to save money and purchase a piece of land. With the goal of further developing her business, she has turned to bank Bai Tushum for a loan to buy mares and increase her head count. She plans to invest profits from the loan into further augmentation of her quantity of livestock, and to save toward building a new house for her son on the land she bought.

loans.use: to buy mares for her animal husbandry business

loans.name: Nurila

texts.ru: Нуриле 47 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 2 детей. Старший сын учится в университете, дочь -школьница. Супруг находится на заработках в России, высылает часть своей зарплаты семье в Кыргызстан. У Нурилы - высшее образование, работает бухгалтером, сельчане отзываются о ней, как об ответственном и пунктуальном человеке. В качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи Нурила занимается животноводством, стартовав 14 лет назад, с покупки скота на 15,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Нурилы, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 1 лошадь, 4 козы и 20 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Нурила обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом - на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Нурила планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее обучение детей.
texts.en: Nurila is 47 years old and married.  She and her husband are raising two children. Their eldest son is studying at university and their daughter is a schoolgirl. Her husband is working in Russia and sends part of his wages home to Kyrgyzstan. Nurila has a higher education.  She works as an an accountant. Other villagers regard her as a responsible and punctual person. To provide additional income for her family, Nurila raises livestock. She had started 14 years ago with the purchase of cattle for 15,000 KGS. Through her hard work, today Nurila's household has 2 dairy cows, 1 horse, 4 goats and 20 sheep. She receives a monthly income of 10,000 som (KGS). In order to further grow her business, Nurila has turned to to the Bank "Bai - Tushum" for a loan for the purchase of sheep for breeding. She plans to use the loan income to further increase the amount of domestic animals, and plans to save enough money for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: Eden Group

texts.fr: La cliente Teso est une brave commerçante, vice présidente  et membre du groupe  d’affaires « EDEN », âgée de 36 ans,  mère de 8 enfants qui tous scolarisés. Cette cliente est petit commissionnaire de divers articles (second hand). Son conjoint est un commerçant de divers produits. Elle a sollicité un crédit auprès de Hekima pour augmenter son chiffre d’affaire. Elle commença avec ses fonds propre reçu de son mari. Dans l’avenir elle souhaite acheter une parcelle, construire une maison, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux petits entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Teso is a courageous entrepreneur and the Vice-President of Eden Group. She's 36 years old and a mother of eight children, all of whom attend school. She trades in a variety second-hand products, while her spouse is also a trader of various products. 

She applied for a loan from Hekima to increase the capacity of her business, which she started with funds received from her husband. In the future, Teso dreams of buying a plot of land, building a house, and continuing to educate and feed her children. She is thankful for Hekima and its support of small entrepreneurs who lack access to traditional banking loans.

loans.use: to purchase various second-hand products

loans.name: Kayumbe Jonas

texts.fr: Kayumbwe est travailleur à un établissement universitaire.Intéressé par le crédit éducation offert par  Hekima, il  sollicite ce credit  pour  payer  les frais académique de son fils  pour qu’il soit régulier aux cours  durant toute l’année académique  2013-2014. Ce parent rêve un avenir meilleur pour son  fils. Ainsi, il salut grandement l’initiative spéciale de Hekima.
texts.en:
Kayumbwe works at a university. He was very interested in Hekima's educational lending program. He is seeking a loan to help pay his son's academic expenses so that his son can attend courses during the 2013-2014 academic year. 

Kayumbwe dreams of a better future for his son. He is very grateful for Hekima's support on this special initiative.

loans.use: to pay his son's tuition fees.

loans.name: Mbulanga Titus

texts.fr: Monsieur Mbulanga, employé dans un établissement universitaire sollicite un prêt pour son fils étudiant de 1ere année de  graduat.  Ce prêt lui permettra de payer anticipativement la totalité des frais académiques de l’année 2013-2014. Ce parent manifeste le souci de voir son fils finir ses études et  devenir  professeur d’université comme lui.  Ainsi   il loue ce grand projet  de Hekima.
texts.en: Mbulanga works at a university and is seeking a loan for his son, who is studying in his first year of graduate school. This loan will allow Mbulanga to pay in advance all of the costs for the 2013-2014 academic year. He would very much like to see his son finish his studies and become a university professor just like him. As a result, he partnered with Hakima for this loan.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees

loans.name: Jacques Quentin

texts.fr: jacques est un jeune Camerounais âgé de 24 ans, fiancée et père de 02 enfants âgés de 01 et 05 ans. l'un d'eux va déjà à l'école. Comme activité, il gère un centre d'appel téléphonique communément appelé "call box" depuis quelques années dans un quartier de la capitale. ceci dit il bénéficie d'une bonne expérience dans le domaine, ce qui lui a permit de constituer un portefeuille clientèle considérable et fidèle. il voudrait avec ce crédit acheter en gros les crédits de communication pour éviter des ruptures afin de pouvoir satisfaire sa clientèle à tout moment. les revenus générés lui permettront de mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille et aussi d'agrandir son activité.
texts.en:
Jacques is a young, 24-year-old Cameroonian. He is an engaged father of two children, a one-year-old and a five-year-old. The eldest is already going to school. For several years now Jacques has operated a call center commonly known as a "call box" in a district of the capital. This has been a good learning experience for him, and it has allowed him to build a strong and loyal customer base. 

Jacques plans to use this loan to buy wholesale phone credits so that his customers will always be satisfied. The income generated from this loan will enable him to better meet the needs of his family and also to expand his business.

loans.use: to increase his inventory of phone credits

loans.name: Jameel

texts.en:
Jameel is 22 years old. He lives with his wife in Jinen. He has a bakery and he works hard to support his family and provide good living conditions.
Jameel is asking Ryada for this youth loan to buy a knead machine and electronic generator. This will increase his stock and increase the number of clients and income, which will help him to improve the financial conditions for his family.  
Jameel is very grateful to everyone who helps him to achieve success in his business with this loan.

loans.use: to buy a knead machine and electronic generator.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cosmetics wholesale such as perfumes, powders and lotions, among other items.

loans.name: Makau

texts.en:
Makau is 40 years old and married. Together with his spouse, they have four children who are 22, 16, 15 and 14 years old, respectively. He is a farmer with a monthly income of KES 15,500. 

This is his first loan with VisionFund Kenya and he plans to add a number of domestic animals such as cows and goats. 

This, in return, will increase his earnings and enable him to improve the living standards of his family. He hopes to be a milk and meat supplier in supermarkets and succeed in life.

loans.use: To purchase additional cows and goats

loans.name: Nazik

texts.en:
Nazik is from Arevadasht village in the Armavir region. She lives with her son and husband who is agronomist. They run a farm. It includes 10 cows, 4 calves and arable land where they cultivate eggplant and forage for the livestock.

Nazik also keeps an orchard where she grows 20 apricot trees. Nazik's husband sells the gathered agricultural harvest in the local open markets and the family is able to sustain its living.

Nazik has now applied for this loan to be able to purchase a cow, fertilizer and forage for feeding the livestock. The loan is very important for these hardworking farmers to enlarge their agribusiness and sustain their living.

loans.use: to pay for a cow, fertilizer and forage

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cereals to sell

loans.name: Felista

texts.en:
Felista is 35 years old, married and has two children together with her husband. She has been running a green grocery business for the last two years, earning KES 25,000 per month. 

This is Felista’s first loan and she plans to improve her business by adding more stock to be able to educate her children with the anticipated profits. She hopes to grow her business to a level where she can be a vegetable supplier to schools, institutions and supermarkets

loans.use: To purchase additional stock for her green grocery store

loans.name: Greda 2 Group

texts.en: These ladies are part of the group called 'Greda 2'. They are beginning their fifth cycle with ID-Ghana. The group is made up of three members and has a representative named Felicia. They are into a variety of businesses including selling soft kenkey and fish, selling detergent, and running a food joint (chop bar). This loan will benefit their small micro-businesses and Felicia's too. She says that she has been with ID-Ghana for two and a half years now, through the invitation of a credit officer who is a worker at the institution. She currently has a business selling a variety of cooked food (rice and stew, fufu and soup, yam and stew, plantain and stew, cassava and stew). She began this business 10 years ago and now can boast plenty of customers who come to her joint to eat. The loan is for an increase in capital so that she can buy plenty of foodstuffs and vegetables to cook and sell to customers. She is standing on the left holding cassava. This work allows her to generate what income she can for her household, since she is a single mother with children to take care of. When she was asked what she likes about ID-Ghana, she responded that she likes the medical consultations and the assistance that the institution offers to them. The group will need a total amount of GHS 3,500 to sustain their businesses.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs and vegetables to cook and sell to customers.

loans.name: Amani Matata

texts.fr: Monsieur  Matata  est employé à un établissement universitaire. Il est parent de 4 élèves inscrits respectivement dans des écoles secondaires et universitaires de la place. Il a été informé de l’opportunité  du crédit éducation qu’offre l’IMF Hekima pour financer anticipativement les frais de scolarité. Ainsi, il a sollicité ce nouveau prêt pour payer les frais académiques et scolaires  de ses enfants  pour leurs permettre de suivre régulièrement  les cours durant toute l’année sans être exclus. Ce parent rêve voir ses enfants  devenir des docteurs, ingénieurs, professeurs d’université, …….. Ainsi, il remercie  grandement  Hekima de disponibilité ce produit qui répond aux attentes des plusieurs parents.
texts.en:
Monsieur Matata is a university employee. He is the father of four students enrolled in local high schools and universities. He was informed of IMF Hekima's educational loan opportunities, which help to pay school fees in advance. 

He has therefore requested a new loan to pay for his children's school and university fees. This will allow them to take classes all year long without being excluded. This parent dreams of seeing his children become doctors, engineers, university professors, etc. He would like to thank Hekima for the availability of this product, which responds to the needs of numerous parents.

loans.use: pay for school and university fees.

loans.name: Baraa'

texts.en:
Baraa' is 21 years old. She lives with her family in Gaza where they live a simple life. They help each other to insure they have good life conditions and avoid asking help from anyone. Baraa' helps her family by tutoring the students in the area where she lives.
Baraa' works hard to support her family so she wants to use one room from her family’s house to tutor the students and she needs to buy tools like a blackboard, chalk, and five chairs, so she applied for Ryada for a youth loan.
Baraa' is very grateful to everyone who helps her achieve success.

loans.use: to buy tools like a blackboard, chalk, and five chairs.

loans.name: Régine

texts.fr: Régine est une jeune dame mariée âgée de 34 ans mère de 4 enfants dont l'âge varie entre 3 et 8 ans. Elle a un bar qu'elle gère dans un quartier de la capitale depuis six ans. c'est grâce à cette activité qu'elle subvient aux besoins de sa famille. grâce à son savoir vivre, elle a développer une clientèle qui s'accroit au fil du temps et là, elle ne parvient plus à la satisfaire à cause gde la petitesse de son capital, d'où la nécessité de ce crédit dans son activité car il lui permettra non seulement d'augmenter ses casiers de boissons mais aussi sa marge bénéficiaire. Bénéfice qui sera en partie réinvesti dans son activité pour l'agrandir et le reste l'aidera pour sa famille.
texts.en: Regine is a 34-year old married woman and the mother of four children ranging from three to eight years of age. She has a bar she has been running for six years in one of the capital city's neighborhoods.   This business allows her  to supports her family.  Thanks to her skill she has grown a loyal customer following.  Over time, customer demand has increased and she is no longer able to meet it due to the small size of her capital. This is why she needs this loan for her business as it will allow her   to increase not only her stock of cases of beverages but also her revenue margin. Part of her revenue will be reinvested in her business for more growth, and the rest will help with family expenses.

loans.use: to increase her stock of beverages.

loans.name: Dismus

texts.en: Dismus is 33 years old. He is married to Miriam and they are blessed with two children. He runs a printing, cybercafe and photocopy business with cosmetics as a rider business, which earns him 25,000 KShs per month in total. This is his third loan with VisionFund Kenya and he intends to restock his shop with additional beauty products, printing papers and toners. He intends to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan as well as to buy an incubator. He hopes and dreams of operating a chain of businesses.

loans.use: To restock his printing and cosmetics shop

loans.name: Munir

texts.en:
Munir is 45 years old and an active borrower with Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. He is a father of four children. He has been running his own general store for many years. Munir wants to expand his business by including different kinds of commodities and other merchandise for reselling purpose. But due to financial constraints, he is not in position to buy above these merchandises. Therefore he has applied for a Kiva SEP loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, he can easily expand his business and earn a more profitable income.

Munir is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy additional products to sell

loans.name: Suzanna

texts.en:
Suzanna is from Hovtashen village where she lives with her husband and two little daughters (ages 5 and 3-years-old). Her husband and Suzanna have been engaged in agriculture for 10 years. They keep a mother pig, 18 piglets and 30 chickens. Suzanna also grows peach, apricot and pear trees. The couple work hard as agriculture is the main source of their family's income. They also own greenhouse which is too old and they are unable to organize cultivation there. So now, Suzanna applied for this loan to renovate the greenhouse and also purchase a pig, forage for feeding the livestock and potato seeds. The loan will be a huge support for their farm.

As this is Suzanna's first loan, has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products in the past because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to pay for a pig, forage for pigs, potato seeds and renovation of the greenhouse

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cosmetics

loans.name: Eqerem

texts.en:
Eqerem is married and has two children. He wants to buy onion and potato seeds. Agriculture is his main activity and he’s got some sheep too. The region where he lives is well known for the largest production of white potatoes and red onions and of the best quality. 

A bit about Eqrem’s village: it is a field area and according to the archeologist, it dates 6000 years back before Christ era. There have been discovered tools made of bones, stones and flint. There have been discovered also dishes made of clay and ceramic. It is believed that this village is the oldest habitat in Albania. Some of the most common veggies grown here are wheat, corn, tomatoes, potatoes, onions, lettuce and animal fodder.

loans.use: to buy potato and onion seeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw for his son to transport goods to the local traders

loans.name: Raed

texts.en:
Raed is a 39-year-old married man from Deir el Balah city. He lives with his wife and four kids: three sons and one daughter, all of whom are school students. Raed works in his own store where he sells coal. This store has been open for the past three years. He buys it from local factories and resells it in the city. 

Raed took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more coal for his store to resell. By taking this loan, Raed will be able to improve his business and meet the high demand for coal in winter.

Raed appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more coal for his store to resell.

loans.name: Beyoglan

texts.en:
Beyoglan is 24 years old. He is single. Beyoglan lives with his family at Mahmudlu-2 village. His family is an IDP (Internally Displaced Persons) family from Fuzuli city. 

Previously, he took a loan from the Kiva organization and successfully paid it off. Now he rents a store, and in this store, sells food products. As shown in the picture, his store is not full and he wants to buy more products for sale. Therefore, Beyoglan has applied to Komak Company for a loan in the amount of 1,900 AZN (Azerbaijani new manat). He says he is thankful for all loans from the Kiva organization and lenders.

loans.use: to buy more products for sale

loans.name: Bigaga Leopold

texts.fr: Monsieur  Bigaga, employé à un etablissement universitaire de la place,est parent de 2 étudiants.  Ayant été sensibilisé sur le nouveau  produit credit éducation, il sollicite ce crédit pour payer les frais académiques de ces 2 enfants.  Ce parent souhaite voir ses enfants devenir des licenciés dans différents domaines de la vie.  Sur ceux, il loue ce grand projet initié par Hekima qui lui permet de garantir la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Bigaga works at a local university, and is the father of two students.  He was informed about the new education loans being offered by the field partner, Hekima, and has requested this loan in order to pay the academic fees of his two children. 

Bigaga wants to see both his children become graduates, and work in different fields.  This is why he is working with Hekima to guarantee their education.

loans.use: to pay higher education fees for his 2 children.

loans.name: Philomaine

texts.fr: Philomène est une jeune femme de 41 ans célibataire mère d'un enfant âgé de 5 ans qui va déjà à l'école. Elle a ouvert et gère un bar-restaurant depuis 5 ans dans un quartier de la place. Son ancienneté et sa forte expérience dans ce domaine lui ont permis d’acquérir une clientèle fidèle. Mais son petit capital ne lui permet de bien gérer toute cette clientèle à cause des ruptures permanentes de stocks parce qu'elle achète en petites quantité. ce crédit lui permettra d'acheter plusieurs casiers de boissons hygiéniques  et un stock important de denrées alimentaires. Elle épargnera une partie du bénéfice qu'elle aura pour agrandir son activité en achetant plus de boisson et le reste l'aidera à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Philomène is forty-one years old, single and mother to a five-year-old child who already attends school.  Five years ago she opened and started to run a bar-restaurant in a local neighbourhood.  Her time in this business and her significant experience have allowed her to build up a loyal customer base.  However, her small amount of capital does not allow her to fully satisfy all her customers due to frequent shortages of stock, because she can only buy supplies in small quantities.

This loan will allow her to buy several crates of soft drinks and a good supply of food products.

Philomène will save part of her earnings, which she will use to expand her business by buying further supplies of drinks, and the rest will be used to provide for her family.

loans.use: To buy several crates of drinks.

loans.name: Ekome Feemo 6 Group

texts.en:
This group is made up of two ladies who are part of the general group called 'Ekome Feemo 6. They are Jemima and Lydia. They are into the sale of African fabric, scarves, beads, cosmetics, plastic items and foodstuff.

Jemima, aged about 43 years and is the group representative. Her family is comprised of four members including herself, her husband and two daughters aged 14 and 16. The member standing on the left and close to African fabric is Jemima. 

Jemima is a very active lady who wants some extra income from her own efforts. She has been selling African fabric with the support of her husband for the last 10 years. To improve her living conditions and to earn some extra income, she wants to access a loan. Being Jemima's forth loan cycle with ID-Ghana, she needs a loan to expand her business since demand has become high. From the loan she will purchase African fabric, scarves and beads to sell to customers. 

She has a dream: to purchase a vehicle to work as commercial vehicle from town to town so that she can make more profit.

loans.use: To purchase African fabric, scarves  and beads and sell to customers.

loans.name: Brenda Lizeth

texts.es:
La señora Brenda es una persona muy honesta y trabajadora vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a su esposo y su hijo. Su negocio es una mini pulpería desde hace 1 año.
Doña Brenda su negocio es muy frecuentado por los vecinos de su comunidad.  Está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de más producto como refrescos, churros, salsas, leche, café, agua, pan, arroz, manteca, etc. 
Doña Brenda espera que el préstamo le sirva de mucho ya que no cuenta con los productos necesarios para cubrir la demanda que le hacen sus clientes a diario y con esto poder incrementar sus ventas.
Doña Brenda desea mejorar un poco su estilo de vida y el de su familia y también hacer que su negocio crezca y  así seguir apoyando a su hijo en sus estudios para que tengan mayores oportunidades en la vida.



Choluteca, Honduras – Enero 2014
texts.en:
Brenda is a very honest and hard-working person. She lives in a community in the southern part of Honduras with her husband and son. Her business is a mini grocery store, which she has had for one year. 

Brenda’s business is frequented by her neighbours. She is requesting the loan in order to purchase more products, such as soft drinks, doughnuts, sauces, milk, coffee, water, bread, rice, and butter. 

Brenda hopes that the loan will help her a lot, since at the moment she does not have the products necessary to meet the daily demands of her customers, and enable her to increase her sales.

Brenda wants to improve her lifestyle a bit, as well as that of her family, and make her business grow so that she can continue supporting her son in his studies and he can have better opportunities in life.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, doughnuts, sauces, milk, coffee, water, bread, rice, butter, and other products for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to help her husband to buy more used machines for his store to repair them and resell in the local market

loans.name: Panorama Group

texts.es:
Marcelo es un hombre casado de 36 años de edad, vive junto a sus cuatro hijos de los cuales son: un hombre y tres mujeres, ambos aun están estudiando y viven en el Departamento de Sololá. El se encuentra en la parte derecha de la fotografía.
El es un hombre que aspira a nuevos horizontes en la vida. Comenta que se dedica a la producción y comercialización de verduras en el mercado local de su comunidad. Decidió elegir esta actividad porque su padre le enseño esta labor, que es bastante productiva y rentable en cuanto a la generación de ingresos y ganancias. Ahora cuenta con quince años de experiencia en esta actividad que le ha ayudado a mejorar la economía de su familia.
Marcelo ha tomado la decisión de formar un grupo, con el objetivo de mejorar las condiciones de vida de las familias de los miembros del grupo, esto se puede lograr a través de la labor que realizan. El préstamo lo utilizaran para la compra de cuerdas de cebolla, ya que en esta temporada es cuando más se aprecia la cosecha.
Uno de sus sueños es apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Marcelo is a married man of 36 years of age. He lives with his four children: one man and three women. They are still studying and they live in the department of Sololá. He is on the right in the photograph.

He is a man who aspires to new horizons in life. He says that he makes a living by growing vegetables and selling them at the local market in his community. He decided on this work because his father taught him how to do it and because it is quite fruitful and profitable in terms of generating revenue and profits. He now has fifteen years of experience in this line of work, which has helped him to improve his family’s finances.

Marcelo has made the decision to form a group with the goal of improving the living conditions of the members’ families through the work that they do. They will use the loan to purchase acres of land planted with onions, since this is the season when the harvested crops are at their highest value.

One of his dreams is to support his children in their studies and improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase acres of land planted with onions

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr:
Afi est une femme âgée de 36 ans. Elle est mariée et mère d'un enfant. Elle tient un magasin de vente des produits de premières nécessités dans son quartier depuis 2008. Elle a une fois bénéficié d'un crédit pour aménager son magasin afin d'attirer plus de clients. Dans son magasin on peut trouver les produits tels que les détergents, les boites de conserve, les eaux minérales, le riz... ; Elle s'approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé.

Elle sollicite ce crédit pour associer à son activité la vente des produits congelés tels que: le poulet, le poisson, les saucisses...

Avec le revenu de son activité, elle pourra mieux prendre soin de sa famille car son activité constitue la seule source de revenu de sa famille.
texts.en:
Afi is thirty-six years old, married and mother to one child.  She has been running a food shop in her neighbourhood since 2008.  She has previously used a loan to set up her shop to attract more customers.

Afi's shop sells products such as detergents, canned foods, mineral water, rice, etc.  She buys her stock at the main market in Lomé.

This loan will be used to expand her range of products and start selling frozen goods such as chicken, fish and sausages.  The profits from her business will allow her to take better care of her family as they are the sole source of income for the household.

loans.use: to buy 3 boxes of frozen chickens for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to paint his house and repair the ceiling to prevent flowing rainwater, and to change the electronic plugs.

loans.name: Artsrun

texts.en:
Artsrun lives with his family in Armavir. He has a required retirement pension and his wife works at local clinic.

Artsrun's daughter is 19 years old and studies at university, and his son is only 13 years old and attends school.

His wife’s salary and his pension are hardly enough for covering the family's basic costs. So, Artsrun has now applied for this loan to be able to pay for his daughter's university tuition. He will be very grateful to lenders for their support.

loans.use: to pay for his daughter's university tuition

loans.name: Thomson

texts.en:
Thomson lives in Mombasa, Kenya. He is 48 years old, and he is married with six children. He is also a businessman, and he has been in business for the last 15 years. His business has grown ever since he started it. 

He knew of Milango through friends who asked him to join them so that he could access credit for his business. He now seeks a loan to buy kerosene, milk and other retail products for his shop. He hopes that in the next five years, his business will grow to become a wholesale one. The challenges that he faces in the business are price fluctuations and lack of capital for expansion. The extra income that he will raise will improve his standards of living.

loans.use: to buy kerosene, milk and other retail products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy grocery stock such as maize, beans, rice and cooking fat.

loans.name: Akram

texts.en:
Akram is a 31-year-old married man from Deir el Balah city. He is a father of two sons and one daughter. For the past five years, Akram has been working on his land as a farmer. He plants fruits and vegetables using greenhouses. Akram would like to improve his business. 
        
Akram took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy fertilizers for his crops to insure a good quality. By taking this loan, Akram will be able to increase his productivity and also his income. 

Akram appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his crops to insure a good quality

loans.name: Sandrine

texts.fr: Sandrine est une femme de 26 ans commerçante, mère d'un enfant. elle fait la vente en détail des vivres frais (maniocs, plantains, macabos noix de palmes et fruits) en fonction des saisons dans un marché de la place depuis 3 ans. Elle a une bonne connaissance des fournisseurs, et surtout de sa clientèle qu'elle a acquise au fil du temps grâce à son expérience dans ce domaine et souhaiterai acheter un camion des régimes de plantains pour avoir un bon stock ce qui permettra de mieux satisfaire la demande constante de sa clientèle et d'éviter les ruptures de stocks. Elle économisera son bénéfice pour non seulement agrandir son activité mais aussi subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Sandrine is a 26-year-old woman who works as a merchant and is the mother of one child. For three years, she has been retailing seasonal fresh foods (cassava, plantains, cocoyams, palm nuts, and fruits) in the local market place. She has a good knowledge of her suppliers, and especially of her clientele, which she has acquired over time thanks to her experience in her field.

Sandrine would like to buy a truck load of bunches of plantains so that she will have a good stock of merchandise. This will allow her to better meet the constant demand of her customers and to avoid stockouts. Sandrine plans to save her income not only to expand her business, but also to provide for her family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase a truck load of plantains for resale.

loans.name: Ngolo

texts.fr: Ngolo est une femme  de 55 ans mariée mère de 5 enfants dont l'âge varie entre 21 et 33 ans. elle commerçante fait la vente en détail des vivres frais (maniocs, plantains, noix de palmes et légumes) en fonction des saisons dans un marché de la place depuis 2 ans. Il a une bonne connaissance des fournisseurs, et surtout de sa clientèle qu'elle a acquise au fil du temps grâce à son expérience dans ce domaine et souhaiterai augmenter son stock de marchandises afin de mieux satisfaire la demande constante de sa clientèle et d'éviter les ruptures de stocks. Elle économisera son bénéfice pour non seulement agrandir son activité mais aussi subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ngolo is a 55-year-old, married, mother of five children.  Her youngest child is twenty-one years old, and the eldest is thirty-three years old.  She has been selling seasonal produce (cassava, plantains. palm nuts and vegetables) at a local market, for two years.  She has a good knowledge of both her suppliers and her customers.  This customer base has been built up over time thanks to her long experience in her business.

Ngolo would like to increase her stocks of produce to meet the steady demand of her customers, and avoid running out of stock.

She will save her profits and use them to expand her business and provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: to increase her stock of merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Moulikatou Abiketou's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de cinq personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, nommée Moulikatou Abiketou (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 54 ans, a fréquenté l’école jusqu’au niveau secondaire. Moulikatou Abiketou est veuve avec deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à sa charge.  Moulikatou Abiketou vit seule avec ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par Moulikatou Abiketou. C’est pour cette raison que dame Moulikatou Abiketou, vend du charbon de bois et des condiments à son domicile depuis vingt cinq ans, ce qui lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté aux besoins de sa famille. Moulikatou Abiketou s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer le niveau de son activité et de satisfaire sa clientèle, Moulikatou Abiketou ensemble avec les autres membres de son groupe sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le prêt antérieur a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
This group is made up of five people who live in the same district. The representative of the group, named Moulikatou Abiketou (shown in the photo with her hand raised) is 54 years old, and attended school to the secondary level. Moulikatou Abiketou is a widow with two children, both of whom are in school and are her dependents. Moulikatou Abiketou lives alone with her children. The various family expenses are borne by Moulikatou Abiketou.

For this reason, Moulikatou Abiketou has been selling charcoal and vegetable-based sauces (called "condiments") from her home for twenty five years, allowing her to support the needs of her family without much difficulty. Moulikatou Abiketou purchases her merchandise from a market in Benin. In order to increase her level of business, and to satisfy her clientele, Moulikatou Abiketou, together with the other members of her group, is requesting a second loan from ALIDé. Their previous loan has been repaid in full.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal and vegetable-based sauces (called "condiments") for resale.

loans.name: Sabreen

texts.en:
Sabreen is a 21-year-old single young lady from a small village near Nablus City. She lives with her mother and eight sisters in a small simple house. Sabreen would like to open a small beauty salon in her village. She took her experience from her previous job. This is a good project and can earn a good income.

Sabreen took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to open a small beauty salon and buy all the needed materials and tools for her business. By applying for this loan, she will be able to help her family with part of their expenses. Sabreen dreams of opening a beauty center in the future.
Sabreen appears in the photo while she was working

loans.use: to open a small beauty salon and buy all the needed materials and tools for her business

loans.name: Suzanne Honorine

texts.fr: Suzanne est une femme de 53 ans mariée mère de 5 enfants dont l'âge varie entre 12 et 35 ans. Elle a aussi 2 autres personnes à sa charge. Elle est commerçante et fait la vente en détail des vivres frais (maniocs, plantains, noix de palmes et fruits) en fonction des saisons dans un marché de la place depuis 18 ans. Elle a une bonne connaissance des fournisseurs, et surtout de sa clientèle qu'elle a acquise au fil du temps grâce à son expérience dans ce domaine. Mais elle se retrouve constamment en rupture de stock parce qu'elle est obligée de faire écouler tous le stock pour pouvoir s'en procurer à nouveau ceci à cause de la petitesse de son capital. Elle souhaitera acheter un pick up des régimes de plantains pour avoir un bon stock ce qui permettra de mieux satisfaire la demande constante de sa clientèle et d'éviter les ruptures de stocks. Elle économisera son bénéfice pour non seulement agrandir son activité mais aussi subvenir aux besoins de sa famille
texts.en:
Suzanne is a 53-year-old married woman, and the mother of five children between the ages of 12 and 35 years old. She also has two additional dependents. For 18 years, she has been selling seasonal fresh foods (cassava, plantains, palm nuts, and fruits) in the local market place. She has a good knowledge of her suppliers, and especially of her clientele, which she has acquired over time thanks to her experience in her field.

However, she finds herself constantly out of stock because she forced to sell all of her stock in order to procure more merchandise, as her capital is so small. Suzanne would like to buy a truck load of bunches of plantains so that she will have a good stock of merchandise. This will allow her to better meet the constant demand of her customers and to avoid stockouts. Suzanne plans to save her income not only to expand her business, but also to provide for her family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase a truck load of plantains for resale.

loans.name: Eugénie's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, nommée Eugénie(celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 46 ans n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Eugénie est veuve avec deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à sa charge. Eugénie vit seule avec ses enfants. Les charges de la famille sont supportées par Eugénie. Pour ce faire, Eugénie vend divers produits (pâtes alimentaires, des boîtes de conserves…) à son domicile depuis une quinzaine d’années ce qui lui permet de subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants et à ses propres besoins. Eugénie s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer le niveau de son activité et de satisfaire sa clientèle, Eugénie ensemble avec les autres membres de son groupe sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le prêt antérieur a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three people who live in the same district. The representative of the group, named Eugénie (shown in the photo with her hand raised) is 46 years old, and never attended school. Eugénie is a widow with two children, both of whom are in school and are her dependents. Eugénie lives alone with her children. The various family expenses are borne by Eugénie.

For this reason, Eugénie has been selling food products (pasta, canned foods...) from her home for the past 15 years, allowing her to support the needs of herself and her family. Eugénie purchases her supplies from a market in Benin. In order to increase her level of business, and to satisfy her clientele, Eugénie, together with the other members of her group, is requesting a second loan from ALIDé. Their previous loan has been repaid in full.

loans.use: to purchase food products (pasta, canned foods...)

loans.name: Patrice

texts.fr: Patrice est un homme de 41 ans marié et père de famille. il est commerçant et fait dans la vente du porc braisé dans un quartier de la capitale depuis 5 ans. son activité fonctionne bien grâce à son savoir faire dans ce domaine et ses bonne relations avec son voisinage, il a conquis et fidélisé une clientèle au fil du temps. il n'arrive plus à la satisfaire à cause de la petitesse de son capital qu'i l'empêche de s'acheter un bon four. C'est pourcela qu'il sollicite ce crédit qui lui ^permettra non seulement d'augmenter ses ventes, mais aussi sa marge bénéficiaire. Bénéfice qui sera réinvesti en parti dans son activité pour l'agrandir et le reste lui permettra de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Patrice is a 41-year-old man, married, and a father of a family. He has been selling braised pork in a neighborhood in the capital for five years. This business works well thanks to his know-how and good relations with his neighbors. He has won a group of loyal customers.

Patrice can no longer satisfy his customers, because his small business capital prevents him from buying a good oven. It is for this reason that he is seeking a loan. An oven will not only allow him to increase his sales, but also his profit margins.

Part of his earnings wil be reinvested to expand his business, while the other part will allow him to support the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy an oven

loans.name: Yolande Vanina

texts.fr: Yolande est une jeune femme agée de 27 ans, célibataire sans enfants. Elle a 03 personne en charge qui vont à l'école. Elle est commerçante dans un quartier de la capitale où elle vend des téléphones portables et accessoires depuis 2 ans. Son dynamisme et son acceuil chaleureux lui ont valu une clientèle considérable quelle a du mal a satisfaire à cause de la rupture permanante des stocks. Elle sollicite un crédit pour augmenter son stock de marchandises afin de satisfaire sa nombreuse clientèle. Les bénéfices générés lui permettront d'étendre son activité et subvenir aux besoins et à l'éducation de sa famille.
texts.en:
Yolande is a young women, 27 years old, single, and has no children. She takes care of three [additional] people who go to school. 

Yolande is a merchant in a neighborhood of the capital, where she has been selling mobile phones and accessories for two years. Her energy and warm character has earned her a considerable number of customers, whom she cannot serve because of stock shortages. She is seeking a loan in order to increase her stock of merchandise in order to serve her numerous customers.

Earnings will allow her to expand her business and support her family's needs and education.

loans.use: to buy telephones and accessories

loans.name: Odile

texts.fr:
Odile est une femme qui a ouvert un magasin de vente des produits de premières nécessités dans son quartier à Tokoin. Elle est mariée et mère d'un enfant. Elle a démarré son activité depuis 2006 et a beaucoup de clients fidèles composé des ménages du quartier. Elle s'approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé au près d'un grossiste des boîtes e conserve.
Ce second crédit qu'elle sollicite lui permettra d'acheter 1 carton de détergent et 4 cartons de boisson en cannette. Avec l'augmentation de son stock, elle pourra mieux vendre et gagner beaucoup de revenus
texts.en:
Odile is a married woman with one child. She opened a store selling basic goods in her neighborhood in Tokoin. She has been doing this since 2006 and she has many loyal customers, who live in the area. She procures her goods in the Lomé Grand Market from wholesalers selling canned goods.

This second loan that she seeks will allow her to buy one box of detergent and four boxes of canned drinks. With this increase in stock, she can sell more and earn more profits.

loans.use: to buy one carton of detergent and four cartons of canned drinks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy tables, chairs and ingredients to make food.

loans.name: La Nueva Esperanza De Corcona Group

texts.es: Modesta tiene 31 años es casada con 02 hijos educando. Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza a través de catálogos. Ella compra productos en oferta para expenderlos  a un precio que le genere buenas ganancias. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de bloqueadores solares perfumes. Modesta en el grupo “LA NUEVA ESPERANZA DE CORCONA” cumple la función de tesorera. . El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo brindado. Modesta es la tercera del lado izquierdo viste jeans. Y de la misma manera se encuentra adherida la foto de Maria Luisa en la parte superior izquierda que no pudo estar presente en la reunión por motivos laborales.
texts.en:
Modesta, 31, is married and has two children.  She earns a living selling beauty products by catalogue.  She buys the products on sale and then sells them for a profit.  She plans to use the loan to buy sunscreens and perfumes.  

Modesta is a member of the communal bank "LA NUEVA ESPERANZA DE CORONA" and is the treasurer.  The group is grateful to KIVA lenders for the loan.  In the group photo, Modesta is third from the left wearing jeans.  Maria Luisa is the member shown in the individual photo because she could not be present for the group photo because of work.

loans.use: To buy sunscreens and perfumes.

loans.name: Fredys Armando

texts.es:
El Señor Fredys es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a su esposa y su hijo.
Don Fredys su negocio es una pulpería negocio que tiene desde hace 1 año y el cual es muy conocida y visitada por los vecinos de su comunidad. 
Don Fredys el está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de más producto como refrescos, pan, churros, café, agua, arroz, frijoles, manteca,  etc. los cuales necesita para surtir más su negocio.  El espera que el préstamo le sirva de mucho ya que gracias a contara con el producto suficiente para cubrir las demandas y pedidos de los clientes.
Don Fredys con esto espera incrementar sus ventas y hacer que su negocio crezca para  así seguir apoyando a su familia para que puedan cumplir las metas y sueños de los mismos y vivir de una manera mejor.



Choluteca, Honduras – Enero 2014
texts.en:
Fredys is a very hard working, responsible man who lives in a community in southern Honduras with his wife and son.  He has been running a grocery store for a year now and is very well known and visited by the neighbors of the community.

Fredys is requesting a loan to buy goods such as soft drinks, bread, doughnuts, coffee, water, rice, beans, shortening, etc. which he needs to stock his store.  He believes the loan will be of great help because he will have enough stock to meet the demands of his customers.

Fredys hopes to increase sales and expand his business so he can continue supporting his family to meet their goals and dreams so they have a better lifestyle.


Choluteca, Honduras - January, 2014

loans.use: To buy goods such as soft drinks, bread, doughnuts, coffee, water, rice, beans, shortening, etc. for his business.

loans.name: Cecibel Marina

texts.es:
Marina vive en Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas ciudad de la región costa, con un clima agradable. Es una ciudad muy comercial la misma que es considerada puerto terrestre que une a la sierra y a la costa. Marina tiene 32 años, vive en unión libre con Carlos, fruto de este amor tienen dos hijos, un hijo de 14 años y un niño de 9, ambos estudian cerca de casa. Marina trabaja en las tardes vendiendo cosméticos, ella recorre y visita a su clientela fija, cuenta ya con tres años de experiencia, la conocen mucho en el sector. 
Su esposo Carlos se dedica a la venta de mariscos, su fuerte es la venta de camarón, trabaja todos los días de la semana, su esposa Marina en sus días libres le ayuda en el negocio, ambos se han dado la mano siempre y ha podido sacar adelante a su familia. Con el apoyo de los dos ahora cuentan con una pequeña casa, que han podido construirla poco a  poco con las ganancias de sus negocios.
Marina está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mercadería, con ello podrá comprar perfumes, cosméticos, desodorantes; ya que este mes es muy comercial y por ende bueno para sus ventas.
Acudió a Fundación Alternativa por referencias del sector, quién pudo ayudar a Marina con este pequeño crédito, se siente muy agradecida con la Institución y con Kiva porque con este dinero ella podrá crecer en su negocio y a mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Marina lives in Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas, a city in the coastal region which enjoys a nice climate.  It is very commercial since it is an access point between the mountain range and the coast.  Marina is 32 and lives with her common-law husband, Carlos, and their two children, a 14-year-old daughter and a nine-year-old son who attend school near their home.

Marina works in the afternoons selling cosmetics.  She goes out to visit her fixed customers and has been in business for three years, so is quite knowledgeable in the field.  Her husband, Carlos, sells seafood, especially shrimp, and works every day of the week.  Marina helps him when she has free time, so they help each other support the family.  Between the two of them they have been able to build a small house little by little with their income.

Marina is requesting a loan to buy merchandise such as perfumes, cosmetics and deodorants since this is a very commercial month and good for sales.  She is requesting the loan through Fundación Alternative which she learned about though sector references.  She is very grateful to the institution and Kiva because the money will help grow her business and improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy new merchandes.

loans.name: Sara

texts.fr: Sara est une femme de 40 ans mariée, mère de famille. Elle commerçante et vend du pain avec du haricots et autres sauces en matinée depuis 3 ans dans un quartier de la capitale.Son savoir faire dans ce domaine et les prix pratiqués lui ont permis d’acquérir et fidéliser une clientèle qui s'accroît au jour le jour.Ce qui l'amène à vouloir ce crédit parce que son capital ne lui permet plus de satisfaire pleinement sa clientèle.Grâce à lui,elle pourra augmenter son stock en achetant (1 sac de haricot, et un carton de poisson) .Les bénéfices que lui apportera ce crédit seront en partie réinvesti dans son activité et le reste sera économisé pour la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en: Sara is a 40-year old married woman, who is the mother of a family. She has been a trader, selling bread with beans and other sauces in the mornings, for the past three years in one of the capital's districts. Her knowledge in this field as well as her prices have helped her to get and keep a customer base, which is increasing day by day. This has led her to seek this loan, as her capital is no longer sufficient to fully meet customer demand. With the help of the loan, she will increase her stock by purchasing one bag of beans and one box of fish. The profits generated from this loan will be partly invested in the business, and she will save the rest for her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase a sack of beans and a box of fish.

loans.name: Houefavi Inès' Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, nommée Houefavi Inès (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 39 ans a fréquenté l’école jusqu’au niveau primaire. Houefavi Inès est mariée à un frigoriste du nom de Antoine. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à sa charge. Houefavi Inès vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les différentes charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. C’est pour cette raison que, Houefavi Inès vend de la nourriture à son domicile depuis environ dix huit ans. De façon secondaire, Houefavi Inès exerce comme activité la couture. Houefavi Inès s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de son activité et de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Houefavi Inès ensemble avec les autres membres de son groupe sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé afin de renforcer le niveau de leur activité. Le prêt antérieur a été bien remboursé.
texts.en: This group is made up of three people who live in the same district. The representative of the group, whose name is Houefavi Inès (she is the one with her hand raised in the photo), is 39 years old and attended school up to primary level. Houefavi Inès is married to a refridgeration technician called Antoine. The couple has four children, all dependants and at school. Houefavi Inès lives with her husband and children, and the couple cover the various household expenses between them. For this reason Houefavi Inès has been selling food from home for around 18 years. As a secondary activity she has a sewing business. She gets her supplies in a Benin market. With a view to increasing her business volume and satisfying customer demand, Houefavi Inès, together with the other members of her group, is requesting a second loan from Alidé, which will be used to boost their businesses. The previous loan was repaid in full.

loans.use: to buy fresh food and haberdashery products

loans.name: Yaoska

texts.es: Es una mujer alegre, originaria de Puerto Cabezas, tiene 29 años de edad, casada con tres hijos, en edad escolar. Con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingresos, desde hace 10 años inicio el negocio de venta de  bisuterías y accesorios para mujeres en un tramo que alquilaba en el mercado municipal, con las ganancias percibidas y gracias a los dos préstamos anteriores otorgado por PANA PANA, le ha permitido mantener el negocio surtido y comprar el tramo. Hace 3 años su esposo quedo desempleado, con el objetivo que su pareja contara con una fuente de ingresos con su liquidación conformaron hace 3 años el negocio de reparación y venta de accesorios para celulares, el cual también es administrado por Doña Yaoska. Actualmente solicita su tercer financiamiento para comprar mercadería en Managua para ambos negocios: perfumes, cremas para mujeres y hombres, prensa pelos, ropa interior para mujeres y hombres, pulseras, cadenas, anillos de acero, anteojos, relojes, protectores y auriculares para celulares y controles para televisores. Su sueño es que sus negocios vayan creciendo y construir el muro de concreto de su vivienda.
texts.en:
This is a happy lady from Puerto Cabezas.  She is 29 years old, married, and has three school-aged children.  Ten years ago she started a costume jewelry and ladies’ accessory business from a rented stall in the local market, so she could have an income of her own. With her income and thanks to her two previous loans though Pana Pana, she has been able to maintain her business and buy the stall.

Three years ago her husband became unemployed and they started a cell phone repair and accessories business, which Yaoska manages.  She is asking for this third loan to buy merchandise for both businesses, such as perfumes, ladies’ and men’s creams, hair irons, undergarments, bracelets, chains, steel rings, snacks, cell phone protectors headsets, and TV remote in Managua. Her dream is for her businesses to grow and to build a concrete wall around her house.

loans.use: to buy inventory.

loans.name: José Osmín

texts.es:
José  de 43 años de edad, estudió hasta 2º grado debido a la situación económica en que vivía su familia, está acompañado y su pareja le ayuda en el trabajo agrícola, tiene  3 hijos, uno está casado, el otro terminó el bachillerato y el último aun está estudiando y nadie más vive con ellos.

José, toda su vida se ha dedicado a la agricultura, recuerda que desde muy pequeño su papá lo llevaba a trabajar, pero manifiesta que le agradece porque le ha servido para sacar a su familia adelante, él cultiva maíz, maicillo, pipian, chile, tomate, sandía,  su vida es un poco agitada, se levanta a las 5:00 A.M. para llegar temprano a su trabajo, sus  días laborales son variados, cuando tiene bastante trabajo labora de 8 a 10 horas, para llegar a su trabajo camina 25 minutos aproximadamente y su familia es la que le ayuda en el trabajo.


El préstamo será invertido en la compra y cultivo de 5,000 plantas de chile. Su sueño es que sus hijos sigan estudiando y se preparen en una carrera universitaria, comprar un vehículo para  comercializar su producto y pagar el crédito para tener las puertas abiertas.
texts.en:
Jose is 43 years old and has a second grade education because of the financial situation that his family faced.  He is married and his wife helps with the farm work.  He has three children, one is married, another completed his bachelor’s degree, and the third one is still in school.  No one else lives with them.

Jose is a farmer and remembers that his father used to take him to work when he was very young, but he says that he appreciates it because it has helped him get his family ahead.  He raises corn, sorghum, pipian, peppers, tomatoes, and watermelon.  His life is a bit hectic and he rises at 5:00 am to arrive at work early.  He walks for about 25 minutes and his family helps him with his work.

He will use the money from this loan to buy and raise 5,000 pepper plants.  His dream is for his children to continue studying and prepare themselves for university.  He also wants to buy a vehicle so he can sell his products and pay off the loan so he can keep his doors open.

loans.use: to buy pepper plants.

loans.name: Abele Hounwanou's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, nommée Abele Hounwanou (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 37 ans a très peu fréquenté l’école. Abele Hounwanou est mariée à un menuisier du nommé Augustin. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à sa charge. Abele Hounwanou vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les différentes charges de ménage sont supportées par Abele Hounwanou et son mari. Pour cette raison, Abele Hounwanou vend des habits et du fromage à base de soja à son domicile depuis quinze ans environ. Abele Hounwanou s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but d’augmenter leur fond de roulement, et de renforcer le niveau de son activité afin de satisfaire mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, Abele Hounwanou ensemble avec les autres membres de son groupe sollicite un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three people who live in the same neighborhood. The representative of the group, Abele Houwanou (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 37 years old. She has had a little schooling. She is married to a carpenter named Augustin. The couple has two children who are under their care and who go to school. The family lives together, and Abele Hounwanou and her husband together take care of the family's everyday expenses.

For this reason, Abele Hounwanou has been selling clothing and soy-based cheese from her home for about 15 years. She procures her goods from a market in Benin. 

With the goal of increasing their business cash flow and strengthening their businesses in order to better satisfy customer demand, Abele Hounwanou together with the other members of the group are seeking their first loan with Alide.

loans.use: to buy clothing and soy-based cheese

loans.name: Brigitte

texts.fr: Brigitte est une femme de 43 ans mariée et mère de 07 enfants dont l'âge vari entre 30 et 17 ans. Parmi ses enfants, cinq vont encore à l'école. Elle détient un hangar de vente d'huile de palm et de vivre frais dans un marchée de la cité capital depuis 11 ans déjà. Dans son quartier, Brigitte  est la seule à exercer cette activité qui se déroule dans de très bonnes conditions. Cependant, la demande de sa clientèle ne cesse de s'accroitre de jour en jour vu qu'elle est la seule à exercer cette activité dans son quartier. Pour résoudre ce problème, elle sollicite un crédit afin d'acquérir une nouvelle machine à écraser. Elle économisera son bénéfice pour agrandir son activité d'une part et le reste servira à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Brigitte is a 43-year old woman who is married and mother to seven children, whose ages range from 17 to 30 years old. Five of her children still go to school. She has a hangar in one of the capital's markets, where she has been selling palm oil and fresh foods for 11 years now. Brigitte is the only person in her neighborhood to exercise this activity and it is doing very well. However, customer demand is growing day-by-day because she is the only one to have such a business in her neighborhood. In order to resolve this problem, she is requesting a loan so that she can get a new crushing machine. She will save part of her profit to expand her business and use the rest to provide for her family's needs.

loans.use: to increase her stock of goods.

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr:
Akouvi est âgée de 47 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Elle a démarré le commerce de poissons fumés depuis plus de 26 ans. Son activité consiste à acheter le poisson frais au port de pêche de Lomé et le fumer à son domicile. Elle a des grossistes privilégiés qui lui proposent des prix intéressants afin de lui permettre de gagner une marge de bénéfice importante. Elle utilise de bois de chauffe et de l'écorce de bois utilisé par les menuisiers dans leur atelier pour fumer ses poissons.
Ce crédit qu'elle sollicite lui permettra d'acheter 3 cartons de poissons frais et de bénéficier d’une ristourne.
texts.en:
Akouvi is 47 years old, married and mother to two children. She started buying and selling smoked fish more than 26 years ago. Her activity is buying fresh fish at the fishing port in Lomé and smoking it at her home. She has access to privileged wholesalers who offer her interesting prices so that she make a significant profit margin. She uses firewood and bark used by carpenters in their workshops to smoke her fish.

This loan which she is requesting will enable her to buy three boxes of fresh fish and to benefit from a discount.

loans.use: to buy three boxes of fresh fish.

loans.name: Ruhamanyi

texts.fr: Monsieur Ruhamanyi est travailleur dans un établissement  universitaire. Ayant pris connaissance du crédit éducation disponible à l’IMF HEKIMA, il a pris la décision de solliciter un prêt  pour payer les frais scolaires de ses 3 enfants. Il remercie grandement Hekima qui lui permet de résoudre le problème de scolarité de sa famille et offrir un avenir à ses enfants.
texts.en: Ruhamanyi works in a university. Having learnt of the loans available for education purposes from IMF Hekima, he has decided to request a loan to pay his three children's school fees. He is extremely grateful to Hekima, which has allowed him to resolve the problem of his family's education and offer a future to his children.

loans.use: to pay his three children's school fees.

loans.name: Émilie's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, nommée Émilie (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 50 ans n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Émilie est mariée à un certain Antoine. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à sa charge. Émilie vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les charges de la famille sont supportées par Émilie et son mari. Pour ce faire, Émilie vend des tissus, des chaussures et des fruits dans sa région depuis trente deux ans environ. Émilie s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de son activité et de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Émilie ensemble avec les autres membres de son groupe sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le prêt antérieur a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three people who live in the same area. The representative of the group, Emilie (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 50 years old. She did not go to school. She is married to a certain Antoine. The couple has four children, who are all under their care and go to school. The family lives together, and Emilie and her husband take care of the family expenses.

To do this, Emilie has been selling fabrics, shoes, and fruit in her area for about 32 years. She procures her goods from a market in Benin. 

In order to increase business and to satisfy customers, Emilie, together with the other members of her group, are seeking their second loan with Alide. Their previous loan has been repaid correctly.

loans.use: to buy fabric, shoes, and fruit

loans.name: Mama

texts.fr:
Mama est une jeune femme célibataire âgée de 31 ans. Après sa formation en couture, elle a ouvert un atelier en 2012 qui n'a pas bien marché. Ne pouvant pas rester à la maison sans rien faire, elle s'est lancée dans la vente des pagnes et dans la restauration notamment en igname frit (appelé Koliko) dans son quartier à Tokoin. Elle s'organise de telle sorte qu'elle vend les pagnes de façon ambulante le matin et dans l'après midi elle vend les ignames frits.
Pour son micro restaurant, elle s'approvisionne en Igname au marché de Gbossimé. 
Pour faire de bonnes affaires, elle sollicite ce crédit pour acheter 30 tubercules d'ignames et 5 pièces de pagne.
texts.en:
Mama is a young single woman who is 31 years old. After being trained in tailoring, she opened a shop in 2012. But it was not successful. 

Not being able to stay at home without doing anything, she started selling pagnes [bright colorful fabric] and and fried yams (called Koliko) in an area in Tokoin. 

She organizes her day so that she sells pagne by traveling around in the morning and then sells her fried yams in the afternoon. For this mini-restaurant, she procures her yams from a market in Gbossime. For her business, she is seeking a loan to buy 30 yams and five lengths of pagne.

loans.use: to buy 30 yams and 5 lengths of pagne [bright colorful fabric]

loans.name: Carlos Ariel

texts.es: Carlos Ariel tiene 29 años de edad. Es originario de la ciudad de León. Es un joven soltero, estudia en una de las universidades de la ciudad. Él siempre ha estado comprometido con sus estudios y familia. Solicita el crédito para poder pagar sus módulos de finalización de estudios. Su plan futuro es adquirir un empleo en donde pueda aplicar sus conocimientos adquiridos ya que desea prosperar y ayudar mucho a su familia.
texts.en:
Carlos Ariel, 29, is from the city of León.  He's a single young man who studies in one of the universities in the city.  He has always been committed to his studies and his family.

Carlos Ariel's requesting this loan to be able to pay for the costs associated with finishing his degree.

His plan for the future is to get a job in which he can apply his knowledge, because he wants to prosper and help his family a lot.

loans.use: to pay for finishing his degree requirements

loans.name: Kahasha Consolata

texts.fr: Madame  Kahasha est employé dans un établissement universitaire. Elle est parent d’un étudiant régulier à l’université. Elle a été informée du crédit éducation qu’offre l’IMF Hekima pour financer les frais de scolarité. Ainsi, ce prêt lui servira de payer les frais académiques de son enfant pour qu’il soit régulier  aux  cours durant toute l’année academinique 2013-2014. Ce parent rêve un avenir meilleur pour son fils et souhaite le voir devenir médecin. Ainsi, elle salut grandement l’initiative spéciale de Hekima.
texts.en:
Kahasha works at a university. She is the mother of a student at the university. She learned about the education loans offered by the micro-finance institution Hekima to help finance tuition costs. Thus, this loan will serve to pay the tuition fees for her child, so that he can attend class for the whole 2013-2014 academic year. 

This parent dreams for a better future for her son and wishes to seem him become a medical doctor. 

She greatly thanks this special initiative by Hekima.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees

loans.name: Naim

texts.en:
Naim is 47 years old, and a married father of five children.  He lives in a mountain village with all members of his immediate family, and of course his mother, as per Albanian tradition that is followed mostly in the rural area. 

He works in communal maintenance, in addition to the agricultural activity that he and his wife pursue. 

Traditional food is stuffed peppers with cottage cheese that in Albanian is called “gjize”, pickles and grilled meat. 

Naim has two dairy cows, ten sheep, one horse, and also fruit trees such as plums & apples. 

He wants to use this loan to make some home repairs.

loans.use: to make repairs to their family home of eight

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn, lime, firewood, meat, potatoes, cabbage, paper plates, condiments, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase supplies for the grocery store

loans.name: Silvestra

texts.en:
Silvestra is a 67-year-old fruit vendor from Tagbilaran, Bohol. She is married with two adult children. 

Even at her age, Silvestra works hard to earn a living. For ten years now, she has been selling fruit like oranges, mangos and apples. She is asking for a loan to buy more fruit like apples, watermelons, grapes, pineapples and more apples. 

She hope to continue having this business so she can provide for herself and her husband.

Her income will be for savings and reinvestment in the same business.

loans.use: to buy more fruit like apples, watermelons, grapes, pineapples and more apples

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 57 years old, married, and has children. She sells smoked fish, which she supplies to her customers. 

This is her seventh loan with the institution, and Grace is going to use it to purchase GHS 3,000 worth of fish.  She will smoke the fish and supply it to customers in different locations, as at this time of year she has a great deal of demand. 

Grace is growing her business, thereby thought it wise to approach ID-Ghana for financial assistance. 

She is going to use the profits to continue buying merchandise, and this way increase her working capital and be able to have her family well taken care of. 

She is happy and grateful for this opportunity that she is being offered.

loans.use: to purchase fish to smoke.

loans.name: Chichicastecos Group

texts.es:
Juan Carlos es un hombre soltero de 25 años de edad, vive junto a sus padres y hermanos en el Departamento de Sololá. El se encuentra a la par del primer integrante,  del lado derecho en la fotografía.
El es una persona que le gusta vivir la vida, aprendiendo nuevas cosas cada día. Actualmente se dedica a la venta de escudillas (soperas fabricado con barro). Eligió esta actividad porque su madre se dedicaba a lo mismo, y es como de esta manera el fue adquiriendo conocimiento en esta labor desde hace cinco años, el ha podido ayudar a su familia con los gastos de su casa por medio de los ingresos y ganancias que le genera su trabajo.
 Ahora se ha dado cuenta que la labor que realiza es bastante rentable, por lo que ha tomado la decisión de formar un grupo, en la cual puedan realizar diversas actividades con el fin de mejorar la economía de sus familias. El préstamo lo utilizaran para la compra de utensilios de cocina y otros materiales, para poder ofrecerles un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
 Su mayor sueño es tener un local en donde pueda incrementar su negocio con distintos utensilios de cocina y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos is a single 25-year-old man, he lives together with his parents and brothers in the department of Sololá. He is next to the first member of the group, on the right-hand side of the photograph. He is a person who loves living life, learning new things every day. He is currently making his living selling bowls (soup tureens manufactured in the neighborhood). He chose this activity because his mother made her living in this area, and it was in this manner that he has been acquiring knowledge of this field for the last five years. He has been able to help his family with the household expenditure through the turnover and profits that his work creates.

He has now realized that the work he is performing is reasonably profitable, which is why he made the decision to form a group, in when they can perform a variety of activities with the aim of improving their families' finances. The loan that they will use is to buy cooking utensils and other materials to offer their customers a better service.

His greatest dream is to have premises where he can grow the business with different cooking utensils and therein improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy cooking utensils and other materials.

loans.name: Gantsetseg

texts.en:
Gantsetseg, 25, lives with her husband and son in a house in Dornogobi Province, Mongolia. Her son is five years old. He attends local kindergarten.

Gantsetseg has been providing tailoring services at a rental place since 2011. She is a hardworking, optimistic and intelligent woman who has dream of owning a tailoring business in the future. She is now requesting a loan of 2,000,000 Mongolian Tugriks to purchase tailoring inventory and a sewing machine for her business.

loans.use: to purchase tailoring inventory and a sewing machine for her business

loans.name: Justus

texts.en:
Justus was born in Nyeri, a county in Kenya, but spent most of his childhood life in Nairobi. He is a church minister and has a wife and two children. He is also a landlord and sells powdered soap to retailers. 

Justus recently learned about the Fresh Life Initiative, and gained an interest in being part of the fight against poor sanitation in the local urban settlements. Being an active member of the community, he easily spotted the need for provision of proper sanitation services. After careful consideration and comparison of the advantages offered by the Fresh Life model, he decided to invest in one Fresh Life toilet. 

He seeks a loan to help him purchase and run this toilet. 

He hopes to purchase more toilets in the future, to create a wider impact to the standards of sanitation in the community.

loans.use: To purchase and run one Fresh Life Toilet

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela, 41, is a wife and a mother who has been tirelessly striving to get ahead. 

She has been selling banku (cooked maize paste) for eight years. Little by little, she has been able to achieve her eighth loan cycle with ID Ghana, which has helped her improve her business tremendously. She will use this loan to purchase more corn dough and cassava dough to prepare plenty of banku to sell on the roadside in Teshie. 

Angela wants to improve her banku business, sustain her family and help her husband with household finances. This loan will provide her family with a better quality of life and improve their well-being.

loans.use: to purchase more corn dough and cassava dough to prepare plenty of banku to sell on the roadside in Teshie.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en: Imelda is widowed with six children, none of whom goes to school. She takes care of additional family members (grandchildren). She has had a business for 30 years. She has applied for a loan of 2,500,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy more foodstuffs like bunches of green bananas, beef, rice, and sweet and Irish potatoes. She generates additional income from rental houses and selling fresh food. She works from home seven days out of every week and sells on both a retail and wholesale basis.
