Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She is aspiring to build more rental houses for her old age. She resides in the family house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include paying for utility bills and feeding the family

loans.use: to buy more bunches of green bananas, beef, rice, and sweet and Irish potatoes.

loans.name: José Baudilio

texts.es:
José es un hombre casado de 73 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y sus cinco hijos, ambos mayores de edad quienes viven en el Departamento de Sololá.
Don José es una persona que ha perseverado a través de los años, contribuyendo al desarrollo de su familia. Actualmente se dedica a  la carpintería ya que donde vive no hay una carpintería, es por ello que tomo la decisión de emprender este nuevo negocio que lleva ya 43 años, el es un carpintero reconocido por el trabajo que realiza. A través de esta actividad obtiene buenos ingresos y ganancias que le han servido para sufragar los gastos de su familia.
El ahora está solicitando un préstamo de Q 4,000.00 para la compra de herramientas y materiales que les servirán para la elaboración de muebles, con el propósito de incrementar sus ganancias y ofrecerles un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
Uno de sus sueños es tener  otra carpintería para poder incrementar sus ganancias y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
José is 73 years old and married.  He lives with his wife and their five children.  They are both elderly, and they live in the Sololá department.  José is a person who has persevered through the years, contributing to his family’s growth.  

He currently devotes himself to carpentry because there is no carpentry business where he lives.  That is why he made the decision to undertake this new business, which he has had for 43 years.  He is a well-known as a carpenter for the work that he does.  It is through this business activity that he gets good profits and income.  These have served to cover the family’s expenses.

He is now requesting a loan for 4,000 GTQ to buy tools and materials to make furniture.  His intention is to increase his earnings and to provide better service to his customers.

One of his dreams is to have another carpenter’s shop in order to be able to increase his earnings.  This way he will improve his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy tools and materials to make furniture.

loans.name: Maritza Elizabeth

texts.es:
Doña Maritza es una persona honesta responsable y trabajadora vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a su esposo y sus 2 hijos. Su negocio es la venta y elaboración de golosinas desde hace 6 años.
Doña Maritza su negocio lo realiza de manera ambulante en su comunidad y zonas aledañas, el préstamo lo necesita  para la compra de más materia prima como ser: maíz, manteca, papas, repollo, carne, tomate, cebolla, chile, platos desechables, etc.
Doña Maritza necesita el préstamo para la elaboración de las comidas y espera  que el préstamo la beneficie mucho y así  poder contar con los insumos necesarios y con esto ganar más ingresos que beneficien el estilo de vida de la familia en el hogar. 
Doña Maritza espera hacer crecer sus negocio y así poder seguir apoyando a su familia y que sus hijos continúen con los estudios para que se conviertan en personas de bien y con mayores oportunidades en el futuro. 


Choluteca, Honduras – Enero  2014
texts.en:
Maritza is an honest, responsible and hardworking person who lives in a community in the south of Honduras together with her husband and their two children. Her business for the last six years has been in the sale and manufacture of sweets.

Maritza carries out her business in the streets of her community and neighboring areas. She needs the loan to buy more bulk material such as corn, butter, potatoes, cabbage, meat, tomatoes, onion, chilies, disposable plates and so on.

Maritza needs the loan to make food and she hopes that the loan will help her a lot and therein have the necessary supplies and with this she will earn more income that will promote the family's lifestyle.

Maritza hopes to grow her business and continue supporting her family and that her children continue with their studies to become upstanding people with better opportunities in the future.

loans.use: to buy corn, butter, potatoes, cabbage, meat, tomatoes, onions, chilies, disposable plates and so on for her business.

loans.name: Reyna Suyapa

texts.es:
La señora Reyna es una persona muy trabajadora y Responsable vive en  una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto con ella viven su esposo y sus padres. Su negocio es la elaboración y venta de tortillas el cual realiza desde su casa de habitación. 
Doña Reyna necesita el  préstamo para la compra de más materia prima como ser: maíz, cal, leña, etc. los cuales necesita para elaborar su producto, espera que el préstamo la ayude mucho ya que contara con los insumos suficientes  para  seguir elaborando sus producto de forma continua y así satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.
Doña Reyna desea poder con esta inversión cubrir la demanda de sus clientes y de igual manera que sus ventas tengan un aumento y gracias a esto ganar más ingresos que mejoren un poco su estilo de vida y el de su familia.
Doña Reyna espera aumentar su negocio y que esta se convierta en el más grande y conocido de su comunidad y así  seguir apoyando a su familia para vivir de una manera mejor que un mejor porvenir. 


Choluteca, Honduras –Enero 2014
texts.en:
Reyna is a very hardworking and responsible person. She lives in a community in southern Honduras and her husband and parents live with her. Her business is making and selling tortillas. She does this from her home. 

Reyna needs the loan to buy more raw materials such as corn, lime, firewood, etc., which she needs to make her product. She hopes that the loan will help her a lot because she will have enough materials to keep making her product continuously and satisfy the needs of her customers.

With this investment, Reyna wants to cover her customers' demand and increase her sales. With this, she will earn more income and improve her and her  family's quality of life a little. Reyna hopes to grow her business and for it to become the biggest and best known in her community. This way, she can keep supporting her family so they can live better for a better future. 


Choluteca, Honduras –January, 2014

loans.use: to buy corn, lime, firewood, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul was born in Kitui, a district in Kenya, but was raised in Nairobi. He recently completed his high school education and likes taking part in social events in the community.

While taking part in these community events, it made him realise that the present day community faces two major challenges which are poor sanitation and youth unemployment. He also learned about the Fresh Life Initiative and thought that being part of the movement will enable him to tackle these challenges at the same time and offer affordable sanitation services to the community as well as create a job opportunity for Paul who is currently unemployed. 

Paul intends to grow his franchise in the future and create more job opportunities for the youth. The franchise will also go a long way in ensuring that all can access quality sanitation services easily.

loans.use: To purchase and run two Fresh Life Toilets

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en: This wonderful, kind and very appreciative Egyptian Albanian family made up of Hasan and his wife, Irma, and their only child are back again. They want to buy second-hand clothes to resell.

loans.use: to purchasesecond-hand clothes to resell.

loans.name: Magdalena Carolina

texts.es:
Carolina es una señora de 20 años, vive en unión libre con su esposo Hilmer, tienen dos hijitos varones uno de tres años y el pequeño de uno.  Radican en la ciudad Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas ciudad de la región costa, con un clima agradable. Es una ciudad muy comercial la misma que es considerada puerto terrestre que une a la sierra y a la costa.
Carolina hace tres años se dedica a la venta de ropa y cosméticos, lo realiza de manera ambulante visitando de casa en casa a su clientela, también en el gabinete de su madre cuenta con una pequeña vitrina donde exhibe sus productos. Su esposo es comerciante de mariscos, el mismo que lleva realizando esta actividad hace cinco años.
Por ahora ellos viven en casa de familiares, con ambos ingresos han podido comprarse su terreno propio, el sueño de Carolina es contar con su propia casa, para ello necesita incrementar su negocio para poder obtener mayores ingresos y así en un futuro poder ir construyendo poco a poco su casa.
Carolina solicitó un crédito para la compra de blusas, pantalones y camisetas, está segura que con este crédito podrá crecer en su negocio. Se siente muy agradecida con Fundación Alternativa y con Kiva por hacer posible el crecimiento en su vida laboral y personal.
texts.en:
Carolina, age 20, lives in a common-law marriage with her husband, Hilmer.  They have two sons.  One is three years old, and the little one is one.  They are from the city of Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas.  This city is in the coastal region, and is has a pleasant climate.  It is a very commercial city, and it is considered to be the inland port that unites the coastal and mountainous regions of Ecuador.

Carolina has been selling clothes and cosmetics for three years.  She does this in an itinerant manner by visiting her customers door to door.  Also, she displays her products in a small display case at her mother’s office.  Her husband sells seafood, which he has been doing for five years.

At the present time they are living in their relatives’ house.  With both incomes they have been able to buy their own piece of land.  Carolina’s dream to to have her own house.  However, she needs to expand her business in order to be able to have greater income.  This way, she will be able to build her house little by little in the future.

Carolina requested a loan to buy blouses, pants, and t-shirts.  She is sure that, with this loan, she will be able to grow in her business.  She is grateful to the Fundación Alternative and Kiva for making growth in her work and in her personal life possible.

loans.use: to buy clothes and merchandise.

loans.name: Hayfaa

texts.en:
Hayfaa is a 59-year-old married mother of one child. 

She has long experience in running a convenience store. It was established 44 years ago, and she has been managing it for a long time.

Hayfaa is a hard worker, well known in her region for her good reputation and the special services she provides.

Today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with special-offer products, especially cold beverages for the coming spring and summer seasons.

She hopes that one day she will turn her convenience store into a wholesale business and expand her working sector.

loans.use: To increase her business merchandise.

loans.name: Bat-Ulzii

texts.en:
Bat-Ulzii is 48 years old and married. She lives with her husband and four children in an apartment in Uvs province, Mongolia. Her husband, Davaadorj, works as a truck driver. Her oldest daughter, Tsend-Ayush, is 22. She studies at Mongolian University of Science and Technical. Her middle daughter, Tuvshinzaya, is 20. She studies at Mongolian University of Economics. Her son, Tuvshinsanaa, is 18. He attends local secondary school. Her youngest daughter, Buyankhishig, is 12. She is also in secondary school. 

Bat-Ulzii has been working as a tailor in a private company for a couple of years. Now she is working at her own tailoring business at home and is requesting a loan of MNT 600,000 to pay for her daughter Tuvshinzaya's tuition fee. She is a hardworking, diligent woman who wants to raise her children to be highly educated.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's tuition fee.

loans.name: Anush

texts.en:
Anush and her husband (in the photo) live in Goravan village with their two children and their parents. 

Anush and her parents-in-law are running a farm. Her husband works at a local private company and gets salary that is not enough for covering the family's costs. So the farming business helps the family to provide its living.

The farm that they run includes arable land where vegetables and fruit trees are grown. The gathered harvest is sold locally.

Now Anush is applying for this loan of USD 1,050 to be able to purchase seeds and fertilizer and cover cultivation costs (watering and gathering the harvest). The loan will be a huge support for Anush and her husband and make easier their farming business. 

As this is Anush's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products in the past because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to pay for seeds, fertilizer and cultivation costs.

loans.name: Elisam

texts.en:
Elisam is a father of six children and is a forty-one-year old business man having and operating a retail shop in a rural trading centre in Nyabubare.   He started his business in 2002 with an objective of earning income which he would use to pay school fees for his children. He is also a farmer. The business started small since he had little income at the time he started the business, but he has been injecting some of the profits back into the business and by doing so the business has grown steadily. He works six days in a week and works eight hours per day. Elisam’s clients are mainly residents of the local village and sometimes the passersby. The retail shop gives him reasonable money to cater for the needs of the family but because the children are now grown up, the needs have become many and the money earned from the business and from grain milling, which is his other source of income, is not enough to satisfy their family needs.

He has applied for a loan so that he can restock the shop, meet the needs of his clients, make higher sales and hence more profits so that he can ably cater for the needs of his family and most especially be in a position to pay all the school dues of his children which has always been his dream in life.  Elisam, however, will use the biggest portion to pay for a piece of land on which to construct a house for his family to cut on the high rent costs now that the number of family members has increased. Elisam is challenged by untrustworthy customers who never come good on their debts, but he is determined to carry on the business despite the challenge if only he could be given a boost of a loan.

loans.use: To pay for a piece of land on which to build his family house

loans.name: Sefer

texts.en:
Sefer wants to buy a dairy cow with this loan. 
He plants oats, potatoes and seasonal veggies like tomatoes, green peppers, spinach, leeks, white cabbage and all types of greens in his agricultural land. Besides all these, he has fruit trees such as plums, apples, mulberries and grapevines. In general, all villagers plant wheat and even nowadays they still drink water from the wells. A characteristic of the village is the folk dance of two people dressed in their traditional costumes. 
Sefer is a father of five children and lives in a mountain village; he's been photographed adjacent to his family home.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Nkome Nfa Group

texts.en:
Emmanuel is the group leader of Nkome Nfa Group. The group is located in the Teshie, Accra area of Ghana and is composed of two micro-entrepreneurs. Emmanuel lives in Teshie with his wife and two children.  

This is Emmanuel's eighth loan with ID Ghana and his third with Kiva. He started his business before joining ID Ghana. All the loans he had acquired from ID Ghana were used to invest in business. He plans to use this loan to purchase soft drinks, which he sells in a bar at his residence. He always uses his business profits to reinvest in his business, but he also saves to provide for his family. 

Emmanuel hopes to be able to save enough money to continue improving his family's lives and to make one of his dreams come true: the dream of having a successful business. He is thankful for your support!

Emmanuel, together with his co-borrower, Emelia, need a total of GHS 4,600 to achieve their business plans for this cycle of loan.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, which he sells in a bar at his residence.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 42-year-old married father of one child. He has worked in the construction business since 23 years ago. He has a wide experience in his domain, and he is specialized in painting houses, shops and offices. In 1995, he started working on his own to increase his income and develop his family's living.

Today, although his business is going just fine, it is not enough to cover his family's increasing needs. That's why he is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, to pay for his beloved child's increasing school tuition fees. He believes this is the most important tool he can provide for his child to plan for a brighter future.

Hassan hopes that one day he can establish a multitask construction company and expand his working area.

loans.use: To pay for his beloved child's increasing school tuition fees.

loans.name: Mahir

texts.en:
Mahir is a farmer. He is 47 years old, married and has two children. One of them is 23 years old and is married. Another is studying at the third course of university. His wife is a housewife. They are internally displaced persons (IDPs) from Fuzuli city and at present are living at Bala Bahmanli village in the Fuzuli region. 

Mahir has a cow. Today he wants to buy little calves to increase his business. Therefore he needs a loan in the amount of 2,150 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). He is very thankful to Kiva and its lenders for support.

loans.use: to buy little calves to increase his business.

loans.name: Benson

texts.en: Benson thirty-five years old and a resident of Kajunjo Kiyoya Nyakyera. He is married with two children, a farmer and a mobile trader dealing in clothes. He has applied for a loan of UGX 1,200,000 to improve the quality of his banana production and sales. His business faces the challenges of low turnover and low market purchase volumes, so he decided to come to UGAFODE for a loan to buy manure and other organic fertilizers. He is hard working and resilient.

loans.use: To buy manure.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta is thirty-nine years old and lives in the community of Panglao, Bohol. She is married with three children between the ages of eleven and fourteen. Vicenta's husband is a carpenter. 

For ten years now, Vicenta has helped her husband support their family by raising hogs. She is asking for a loan of 9,000 PHP to buy feed for the hogs and wood to renovate her barn. She hopes that someday she will be able to expand her business and make it bigger so she can provide for her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy hog feed and wood to renovate the barn.

loans.name: Willy

texts.es:
Willy vive en alquiler en un acabado de ladrillo y piso de cemento en la ciudad de La Paz. El oficio que desempeña es de chofer. Willy necesita el crédito para el mantenimiento de su herramienbta de trabajo (Vehiculo) y de esta madera mejorar sus ingresos y calidad de vida.
El sueño de Willy es poder tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Willy lives in a rented home, finished with bricks and with a cement floor, in the city of La Paz. Willy is a driver. He needs this loan in order to maintain his work tool (a vehicle) and then improve his income and quality of life.

Willy's dream is to own his own house.

loans.use: to maintain the vehicle he uses as a taxi.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cosmetics such as creams and perfumes.

loans.name: Gladis Del Carmen

texts.es:
Gladis, se le presenta la necesidad de hacerle mejoras a su vivienda y como no cuenta con los recursos económicos necesarios opta por solicitar un nuevo crédito con el que comprara ladrillos, láminas, una bomba achicadora, alambre, piedras, dijes, etc., para tener un mejor estilo de vida junto a su familia y continuar elaborando aretes, pulseras, anillos y collares..
La inversión anterior le sirvió para tener la materia prima necesaria para aumentar la producción de bisutería, que le dio como resultado nuevos clientes y mejores ingresos los que ha invertido en el pago de cuotas del crédito y los gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Gladis has the opportunity to make improvements to her house and, as she does not have the money to do it, she has decided to apply for a new loan in order to buy bricks, laminate sheeting, a baler pump, wire, stones and more. She can then have better living conditions alongside her family and continue to make earrings, bracelets, rings and necklaces.

Gladis' last investment helped her to buy the basic materials that she needed to increase her jewellery production. This resulted in more customers and a higher income, which she used to pay off her loan and to cover family expenses.

loans.use: to buy bricks, laminate sheeting, a baler pump, wire, stones and more.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn, lime and propane gas.

loans.name: Razmik

texts.en:
Razmik is from Ararat town where he lives with his wife and 24-year-old son. Razmik is a farmer. He keeps livestock and cultivates land. The farm that Razmik runs also includes a grape orchard, which he takes care of with great care and love. Unfortunately, the farm is in very poor condition and needs to be improved. 

The loan that Razmik requested is very important for him to renovate the barn where he keeps the livestock, cover cultivation costs and improve the grape orchard. The loan will be a great support for Razmik to improve his farm and make it more sustainable.

Razmik has already taken loans from local financial institutions before, but because of hard financial conditions wasn't able to pay it back on time. However, ensuring that his farm is now successful enough and he can afford monthly payments, he has requested this loan. 

Razmik has been approved for this loan. He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The second chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for renovation of the barn, cover cultivation costs and improve the grape orchard

loans.name: Roza

texts.en:
Roza is a fifty-three-year-old villager and a married mother of two who lives in the northern part of Albania. Before this, she lived in a very cold rural region characterized by its long and snowy winters.
 
With this loan Roza wants to stock up on second-hand clothes to resell. She has had this type of business for some years now. Besides this business, she has been raising livestock, particularly pigs and chickens (as you can see in the photograph). Roza's husband works as a security guard in a local factory that specialises in scrap metal recycling.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothing to resell

loans.name: Severa

texts.en:
Severa is a 43-year-old married woman who hails from the town of Panglao, Bohol, Philippines. She has three children ages five to nine. 

Severa raises chickens with her husband at home. A native chicken is good for business because it is highly priced in the market because of its distinct taste. She is asking for a loan to buy more chicks, feed, and wood for the improvement of her chicken coop. 

Severa works hard for her family and dreams of giving her children a better future someday.

loans.use: to buy more chicks, feed, and wood for chicken coop renovation

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy livestock to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Rosal

texts.en:
Ma. Rosal is a 35-year-old woman from the town of Talibon, Bohol. She is married and relies on raising hogs for an income. 

She would like to expand her business. Ma. Rosal is asking for a loan to buy more piglets that she can look after and raise. In four months time, a healthy hog will attract a buyer and give her a better return on her investment. Her income will then provide food and savings for herself and her husband.

In the future, she hopes to be successful as a hog raiser and have a bigger barn with a sow and more piglets to raise.

loans.use: to buy more piglets and feed

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en:
Susanna lives in Taperakan village with her 3 children (two sons and a daughter). Susanna's daughter is married and lives with her family. Susanna lives with her 2 sons and, with them, is involved in agriculture. She cultivates different types of vegetables and fruits and sells it in local markets. The income from agriculture is vital for this family, so Susanna works hard to run the farm successfully.

She has now applied for this loan to be able to purchase seeds and fertilizer, and to cover cultivation costs. The loan will make her farming activities easier and she hopes that lenders will support her.

loans.use: to pay for seeds and fertilizer, and to cover cultivation costs

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es:
María, está decidida por un nuevo crédito el cual utilizara para facilitar la compra de golosinas, jabón, legía, bebidas, granos básicos, especias, huevos, etc., pues su negocio cuenta con más afluencia de clientes y sus productos tienen mayor demanda.
El capital anterior fue de gran ayuda para María porque surtió bien la tienda para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes, tiene mejores ingresos, lo que le ha permitido cancelar la deuda y me aportar a los gastos familiares.
texts.en:
María has decided on a new loan to buy snacks, soap, bleach, beverages, basic grains, spices, eggs, etc.  Then her business will have more customers and there will be greater demand for her products.

María's previous loan was a big help because she stocked her store well to satisfy the needs of her customers.  She has a better income, which allowed her to repay the debt and help with the family expenses.

loans.use: to buy snacks, soap, bleach, beverages, basic grains, spices, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Rudina

texts.en: Rudina wants to stock up on used items to resell.

loans.use: To buy used clothing to resell.

loans.name: Beatrice Group

texts.en:
This group is ready to begin their third loan cycle with ID-Ghana. It is made up of two members and has a representative called Beatrice. The businesses belonging to the members of this group are varied, including selling African fabric and corn dough.

The loan they are taking out will benefit small micro-businesses where Beatrice is a member. She currently has a business which sells African wax prints. She began this business eight years ago when she acquired some used African wax prints which she sold to customers. 

The loan is for the increase of capital for the wholesale purchase of African wax prints, which she will buy from the market in Accra and later sell through hawking. This work allows her to generate as much income as she can for her household, since she is married and has children.

When she was asked what she likes about ID-Ghana, she responded that she likes the medical consultations and the assistance that the institution offers to them.

loans.use: purchase African wax prints which she will buy from the market in Accra and later sell through hawking.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase food store supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more 'lappa' (fabric) to expand her sales.

loans.name: Nadhir

texts.en:
Nadhir is a 29-year-old young man who lives in Sana`a, Yemen. Nadhir's business is a grocery store, where he sells basic foods and soft drinks. He has been in this business for many years and has customers who come to him every day. He would like to invest this loan in the expansion of his business.
Nadhir intends to increase his profit and has applied for a youth loan of 500,000 Yemeni rials (YER) from AMB. With this money, he wants to buy grocery stocks like sweets, soft drinks and soaps. In the future, he hopes that the extra income that he will generate can provide a better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy grocery items for his business.

loans.name: Estrella Del Mar Group

texts.en:
The rural town of Chuicavioc is located in the department of Quetzaltenango, Guatemala. The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank, “Estrella del Mar”, meaning “Star of the Sea”, is found here and consists of twelve women, most of whom have children. They are about to begin their second loan cycle with Friendship Bridge.

Two new members have joined the group, and Juana is one of them. She is 42 years old with six children. Her oldest is 21, and the youngest is 10 years old. Juana grew up in a farming family, and together with her husband, she still farms. The couple grows beans, peas, carrots and flowers on five acres. Juana has requested a loan from Friendship Bridge to purchase fertilizers and seeds. 

Juana’s husband is amazed that nowadays, women can find and receive financial support from organizations like Friendship Bridge. He unconditionally supports his wife, as he realizes that this benefits the family. Both of them are excited that their children are enrolled in school because they realize that the children will benefit and face a more successful future as adults. Juana had no opportunity to attend school because of the economic situation of her family. 

Juana, as well as the other eleven members of “Estrella del Mar”, enjoys the monthly trainings provided by a Friendship Bridge loan officer. They learn a great deal and discuss issues like business and money management, marketing, women’s health, children’s rights and leadership. 

The Trust Bank is grateful for the confidence and support of Kiva investors throughout the world. They wish to express their gratitude and best wishes to all in their endeavors.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard is a new client, 49 years old, a resident of Omukishanda, Ruyonza, Rubabo, Rukungiri. He is married with two children, and he applied for a loan of UGX.1,800,000 to improve his farming tactics. This he will do by buying fertilizer and pesticides for the plantation which will increase his production and therefore his income. He also works part-time as a laboratory assistant at the people’s clinic at Rubaare town in Ntungamo District which increases his monthly earnings. He thanks Ugafode for the financial services and low interest rates.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Al-Sbahy Group

texts.en: This group is called Al-Sbahy. It consists of four members who live in Hodeidah, Yemen. The members have developed business activities and applied for a loan of 120,000 YER. Tahany is a 24-year-old single woman. She currently has a business drawing tattoos on ladies' hands. She learned the trade and has been in this line of work for many years. She has worked in this business to provide her mother with income for expenses. Most of her customers are brides. Tahany would like to expand her business so she applied for a loan from AMB. She will use the loan to increase her capital, and buy pigment (khodhab) materials to draw tattoos on ladies' hands. Working in this manner allows her to help her family move forward.

loans.use: to buy pigment materials to draw tattoos on ladies' hands

loans.name: Rakan Group

texts.en: This group is called Rakan, and consists of 4 ladies who live in Hodeidah, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 120,000 YER from AMB. Joma`a is 34 years old and lives with her family in Hodeidah, Yemen. She sells ladies clothes, incense, perfumes and other goods. She has been in this business for many years and is experienced in sales, which allows her to make a better income. Joma`a works hard to offer a good life for her family. She has a regular customer base because they prefer the quality, affordable prices, and good service that she offers. She is a resourceful and honest woman, dedicated to her work. She applied for a loan from AMB to buy clothes, incense and perfumes for her business.

loans.use: to buy clothes, incense and perfumes for her business.

loans.name: Salwa Group

texts.en: This group is called Salwa and it is made up of four women who are natives of Hodeidah, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 100,000 YER. One of the members of this group is Fatema, who is 47 years old. She has a business selling incense, perfume and ladies' clothes. She started her business by making incense at home until she was able to sell it to her customers around her area. She realized that her business was profitable and she set out to invest more in it. Now Fatema is applying for a loan from AMB to buy perfume, incense and clothes for her business. She hopes to have a clothing shop to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy perfume, incense and clothes for her business.

loans.name: Unidos Para Progresar 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Alexadra is the group coordinator for Unidos Para Progresar 1 & 2. This group is located in the city of Hato Mayor. Her home is a compound for her three children. She lives with her children and her long-term partner. 

Alexandra has successfully completed six years and a half of loans with Esperanza, and this is her 13th loan. She sells new clothes, from her home and by walking around her community and other communities. She would like to continue expanding her business by increasing her inventory to access more customers and sell more products. She will use this loan to buy many pieces of clothing like pants, shirts, jeans, t-shirts and more. 
Alexandra says she enjoys doing business, and her most important dream is to produce enough income to provide for all of her family's needs. She has been saving her profits since she started her business with her first Esperanza loan. She thanks you all for your support!

loans.use: To buy new clothes to resell in her business

loans.name: Hayyam Group

texts.en: This group is called Hayyam, which consists of four ladies who live in Hodeidah, Yemen. The group has applied for a loan of 115,000 Yemeni Riel from AMB. Aisha is 43-years-old and married. She has been working as a vendor and has been selling food. She started her business with a small amount of capital and would now like to increase her sales volume. She would like to spend her time selling more products in order to increase her profit and raise her children well. She has requested a loan in order to purchase more stock to sell, such as potatoes, cooking oil and flour. She hopes to expand her business to live comfortably with her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell, such as potatoes, cooking oil and flour.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina is a 58-year-old woman from the town of Baclayon, Bohol. She is married and has two adult children. Sabina's husband is a fisherman. For five years now he has been fishing and Sabina has been selling his catch. She is asking for a loan to buy plywood to be used to repair their fishing boat. The loan will be a great help so they can continue to earn a living.

Sabina uses her income for food and to pay household bills like electricity and water. In the future, she hopes that she can continue to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy plywood

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To repair the roofing of his house

loans.name: Amistad 4 Group

texts.en:
Isabel is the coordinator of this group, called Amistad 4 ("Friendship"). The area in which the borrowers live is a nascent tourist zone, surrounded by the Atlantic Ocean and mountains, rivers, and natural breezes. Isabel lives with her long term partner in the beautiful town of Samana. She says her most important challenge is to keep her business stable and sustainable. She enjoys working and serving the needs of her family and friends.

Isabel is receiving her 6th loan with Esperanza International Dominican Republic, having repaid all her previous loans. After three years of investment her business has a growing range of products and acquiring more clients and communities. Isabel will use this loan to purchase clothes for her business. She will reinvest her profits in her business and she is also planning to buy other products. She thanks you all for your support!

loans.use: To buy clothes for resale

loans.name: Jumagul

texts.ru: Жумагул 61 год, вдова, одна воспитывает сына. У Жумагул - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Жумагул занимается животноводством, стартовав 29 лет назад, с покупки скота на 500 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Жумагул, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 1 нетель. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Жумагул обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом - на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Жумагул планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее обучение внуков в получении высшего образования.
texts.en: Jumagul is 61, widowed, and has one son. She has a high school education and raises farm animals as her family's main source of income. She started 29 years ago when she bought cattle for 500 som (KGS), and thanks to her hard work she now has two dairy cows and a heifer and earns 10,000 som (KGS) per month. In order to continue developing her farm Jumagul requested a loan from Bai-Tushum and Partners to buy sheep. She plans to use the profits from the loan to invest in additional livestock and to save money so that her grandchildren can go to college.

loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew is 32 years old, married and a resident of Piao, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte, Mindanao, Philippines. Aside from his wage in rendering carpentry works, Andrew operates  a "Sari-Sari" store (general store) in his house to earn extra income to support their family needs.

Last year, Andrew became a member of PMPC and he enjoys the privileges of being a member of the Cooperative. Now, he is applying for a loan of PHP 50,000 to restock inventories for his business. Andrew deeply wishes to maintain membership in good standing with PMPC and wants to have an adequate income from his business to live a comfortable life with his family.

loans.use: to restock additional inventories for his "Sari-sari" store (general store) business

loans.name: Remely

texts.en: Remely is 58 years old, is married, and lives in Camogao, Enrique Villanueva. She has 2 children who are adults. From her desire to help the family, she engaged in dried fish vending starting up with a capital of 3,000 PHP. It has operated for 1 year already. Now, she is planning to borrow  PHP 10,000 from PMPC, of which she became a member 1 year ago. She wants to have a stall in the public market to display her dried fish. She will be happy to see her business expand.

loans.use: to buy additional equipment for dried fish vending.

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans is a businessman in a local cell (neighborhood) where he has been  selling drinks since 2006. He is a father of four children aged between ten and three years old and he also looks after two girls who are the orphaned children of his late brother. Evans does some farming though on a small scale but this is done mainly because he needs enough money to achieve his dream in life. 

His clients are people in his area of operation and cattle traders who buy cows from him. Evans works two days in the shop and works two days on the farm which gives him ample time to improve the businesses. He applied for a loan of 3,000,000 shillings only to be able to buy more cows to boost his farming business so that he gets enough profits to help him expand the business such that he can become financially independent. 

He is challenged by people who never pay their debts and the untimely death of the animals which affects his profits in a given period. He is determined to keep on being the hard-working man he has always been so that he lives a better life in future.

loans.use: To buy cows

loans.name: Glenn

texts.en:
Glenn founded and currently operates a small advertising business known as JLAX. Glenn places computer monitors that flash business ads in multiple locations. Each local business in his network agrees to house a monitor in exchange for the ability to display their respective ads in the locations of other small businesses.
 
Due to this, there are no rental costs for his operation, but each small business pays a small fee to use his advertising service. 

Glenn hopes to purchase more monitors and to continue to expand his advertising network throughout Georgia. His business model thrives due to minimal costs and large profit margins as well as quality customer service.

loans.use: To purchase additional monitors and to cover installation and maintenance fees.

loans.name: Lucelly

texts.es:
Lucelly, a sus 26 años de edad, es madre de una hija de 6 años y cabeza de hogar desde que se separó de su esposo.
Actualmente se dedica a trabajar en una panadería que inició hace un mes, en compañía de una familiar, con capital que fue ahorrado entre ambas; el oficio lo aprendió de manera empírica, luego aumentó sus conocimientos realizando cursos de capacitación y la experiencia la obtuvo durante los 5 años que trabajó como empleada en diferentes panaderías de la ciudad. La ubicación actual del negocio es su mayor ventaja, pues se encuentra en un sector muy comercial; su horario de trabajo es de lunes a domingo de 4 am a 8 pm; de esta forma ha logrado generar recursos para solventar los gastos de su hogar.
El crédito que solicita es un apoyo para comprar una vitrina, utensilios de cocina e insumos al por mayor (harina, margarina, queso, levadura), esto le permitirá almacenar los productos refrigerados que incluirán en su portafolio, para ofrecer a sus clientes mayor variedad y satisfacer los diversos gustos, aumentando así las ventas e ingresos.
Lucelly manifiesta que su mayor motivación es el amor por su hija, por ello lucha cada día para ofrecerle un mejor bienestar y desea adquirir una casa propia para brindar mejores condiciones de vida y una buena educación.
texts.en:
Lucelly at 26 years old is the mother of a 6 year old daughter and head of the family since she separated from her husband. Today she is working in a bakery that she started one month ago, with a family member. They used capital that both had saved. 

Lucelly learned baking by doing it and then added to her knowledge taking training courses and five years experience obtained working as an employee in different bakeries in the city. The location of the business is her major advantage as it is in a very commercialized area. Her working hours are from Monday to Sunday from 4 am until 8 pm. In this way she has managed to generate the resources needed to pay the household expenses. 

The loan she is requesting is help to buy a glass display case, cooking utensils and ingredients wholesale (flour, margarine, cheese, yeast). This will permit her to store the refrigerated products that she sells. Then she can offer greater variety to her clients and satisfy their varied tastes, increasing her sales and profits. Lucelly states that her main motivation is her love for her daughter. For her she can fight very day to provide her with a better well-being. She wants to buy her own home to provide her better living conditions and a good education.

loans.use: to buy a glass display case, cooking utensils and ingredients wholesale (flour, margarine, cheese, yeast).

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
A local villager from Santo Thomas, Isabela, Beatriz is a 48-year-old mother of two whose primary income comes from raising pigs. She and her husband, a construction worker during his spare time, have been working hand in hand to sustain their needs. 

In order to expand her hog-raising enterprise, Beatriz is requesting a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy more piglets to raise and a decent motorbike for commuting. She hopes to improve her income through her requested loan.

loans.use: to buy a decent motorbike for commuting and more piglets to raise

loans.name: Charliceta

texts.en:
Charliceta is from Dicoyong, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 53 years old, has been married for 7 years and has 7 kids. 

In 2010, Charliceta applied for membership with PMPC. Hearing of all the benefits of membership, she did not hesitate to become a member. She maintains her membership in good standing and repays her obligations in a timely manner.

Charliceta is now asking for financial assistance of PHP 5,000 to buy stocks for snack vending. Through this, she hopes to increase her income and expand her business. She has found assistance for her financial needs through PMPC and she is very thankful with all her heart.

loans.use: to buy stocks for snack vending

location.town: Sindangan - Dicoyong, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Nor

loans.name: Prichet

texts.en:
Prichet, age 33, is happy tending her little store. She is married with four children. The store is her means of earning a living in support to her family.  Fortunately, her store is located in a populous neighborhood, so she makes promising daily sales. Prichet keeps on running the store well even though there is increased competition from other stores. Prichet believes that with PMPC's support, as one family they will sustain themselves and beat the competition.  

Prichet is a new member of PMPC. She has applied for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy additional canned goods, beverages, soft drinks, and shampoos for the store. Expanding her inventory will mean additional income. She has confidence that she can maintain the label of member in good standing. She is a hardworking mother and wishes to sustain the store and from there afford a good education for her children.

loans.use: To buy items for resale in her general store

loans.name: Jovana

texts.es:
Jovana vive en en anticretico con sus dos hijos, en un acabado de ladrillo y piso de cemento en la ciudad de La Paz. El oficio que desempeña es de Comercinate. Jovana necesita el crédito para el pago de mensualidad de su instituto de su hija que esta estudiando contaduria.
El sueño de Jovana es que su hija termine sus estudios superiores.
texts.en:
Jovana lives in an antichresis arrangement [a tenant pays a fixed sum, considered a loan, to the property owner, which is received back in full at the end of the rental period] in a finished brick unit with a cement floor in the city of La Paz. She is a merchant by profession. 

Jovana needs the loan to pay monthly education costs for her daughter who is studying accounting.

Jovana’s dream is for her daughter to complete her higher education.
.

loans.use: to pay the monthly education costs for her daughter who is studying accounting.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy food products like rice, sugar, eggs, oil, milk, etc.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 48 years old, a widow with two children, and a resident of Gampis, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She earns a living through drying fish. 

She has been a member of PMPC for 2 years and enjoys the privileges being a member of the Cooperative. Now, she is applying for a loan of Php 10,000 to purchase three boxes of fish foam for the fish drying process.

Susan deeply wishes to maintain a member in good standing with PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase three boxes of fish foam for the fish drying process

loans.name: Iresh

texts.en:
Iresh is 32 years old, single, and a resident of Balolang, Larena, Siquijor, Philippines. She has 1 child who is school-age. Starting with a capital of 3,000 PHP, she opened a sari-sari (general store) and was able to expand it with the help of Paglaum Cooperative. Aside from financial assistance, she was able to generate savings and enjoys the benefit given by the co-op. She became a member in 2013 and has taken out loans. 

Now she is applying for 10,000 PHP to buy additional stocks for her sari-sari store like canned goods, beverages, and other basic commodities. In the future, she wants to own a mini-mart someday, and will be fully satisfied if she sees her child finish studies.

loans.use: To buy additional items for resale in her general store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her graduate study.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Hardworking mother best describes Gina, 50 years old, residing in the North Pob. Larena, Siquijor, Philippines. Gina is a single mother and has 1 child. Gina started a business, a food stand or “carenderia.” Gina has been in the business more than 10 years now. 

Gina wants to expand her food stand business. She wants to gain more profit and to have enough to sustain her child. In order for Gina to make her wish possible, she needs PHP 14,900 additional capital to purchase additional cooking equipment and ingredients and will use the money to expand her business. She intends to buy meat, rice toppings and all the ingredients, utensils and other things that are needed in the food stand. She hopes to live a comfortable life someday with her child.

loans.use: To purchase additional cooking equipment and ingredients.

loans.name: Jerson

texts.en:
Jerson is 47 years old, he is married and a resident of Tamil, Jose Dalman, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. He earns a living through farming and rendering service as an automotive in an auto shop in their town.

Last year, Jerson applied for his membership in PMPC. Hearing of all the benefit, he didn't hesitate to become a member. Now, he is applying for a loan of Php 5,000 to buy tools to use for overhauling engines.

Jerson deeply wishes to maintain a member in good standing with PMPC and hopes to own a shop someday to have adequate income for his family.

loans.use: to buy tools for overhauling engines on autos and trucks.

location.town: SINDANGAN-TAMIL, JOSE DALMAN, ZAMBONGA DEL NORTE

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.es:
Erlinda, poco a poco ha ido diversificando la venta de carne de res, hoy en día también ofrece carne de cerdo, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para comprar carne, hueso de res y cerdo, chorizo, chicharrones, entre otros derivados, con lo que continuara fortaleciendo su negocio y satisfaciendo las necesidades de sus clientes.
El efecto que le dio el crédito anterior le fue muy positivo pues surtió el inventario con mercadería fresca y de buena calidad, sus ventas mejoraron, sus nuevos ingresos son mejores.
texts.en:
Erlinda has slowly been diversifying her sale of beef. Nowadays she also offers pork and is requesting a new loan to purchase more meat such as beef and pork bones, chorizo and pork rinds among other derivatives so that she can continue strengthening her business and satisfying her customers’ demands.

The impact of the previous loan was very positive. She stocked her inventory with fresh high quality merchandise, her sales improved and her new earnings are higher.

loans.use: to purchase more meat, beef and pork bones, chorizo and pork rinds, among other items.

loans.name: Genara

texts.en:
Genara joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in the year 2013 and she appreciates the programs, services and continuous education of the co-op. She is a member in good standing and very active in attending the various programs and services that the Cooperative offers.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 14,900. This loan is intended to  purchase additional ingredients such as flour, butter and sugar for her food vending activity.

Genara dreams of nothing more than to have a happy, healthy life and an adequate income out of her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Dieu Beni Group

texts.fr: DIEU BÉNI est un groupe constitué de quatre personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe nommée Célestine (celle qui a la main est levée sur la photo) âgée de 26 ans, n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Célestine est mariée à un revendeur du nom de Hypolite. Le couple a un enfant, scolarisé et à leur charge. Célestine vit ensemble avec son mari et son enfant. Célestine et son mari assurent ensemble les diverses charges de ménage. Pour ce faire, Célestine exerce comme activité la restauration dans sa région depuis quatre ans. De façon secondaire, Célestine vend des friperies. Célestine approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Célestine et les membres du groupe DIEU BÉNI sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé, dans le but de renforcer le niveau de leur activité afin de faire face à la demande de leur clientèle.
texts.en:
DIEU BÉNI is a group composed of four persons who reside in the same district. The group's representative is named Célestine (with her hand raised in the photo). She is 26 years old and did not go to school. Célestine is married to a retailer named Hypolite. The couple have one child in school and in their care. Célestine lives together with her husband and child. They both ensure that the diverse household expenses are covered. To do so, Célestine has had a restaurant business in her region for four years. On the side, she sells secondhand clothing. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin. 

Célestine and the members of the group DIEU BÉNI are requesting financial support from ALIDé with the goal of bolstering their businesses, so as to cope with customer demands.

loans.use: to purchase corn, condiments, and secondhand clothing

loans.name: Dieu Merci Group

texts.fr: DIEU MERCI est un groupe constitué de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe nommée Sourou Angèle (celle qui a la main est levée sur la photo) âgée de 39 ans, a fréquenté l’école jusqu’au niveau secondaire. Sourou Angèle est mariée à un certain Lucien. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Sourou Angèle vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de ménage. Pour ce faire, Sourou Angèle vend des produits vivriers (maïs, riz) et divers produits (bonbons, biscuits) depuis quinze ans à son domicile. Sourou Angèle s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. C’est la première fois, Sourou Angèle et les membres du groupe DIEU MERCI sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé, dans le but de renforcer leur fond de roulement afin de mieux faire face à la demande de leur clientèle.
texts.en: The Dieu Merci group is made up of three people who live in the same neighborhood. The representative of the group, whose name is Sourou Angèle (she is the one with her hand raised in the photo), is 39 years old and attended school up to secondary level. Sourou Angèle is married to a man called Lucien. The couple has two children, both dependants and at school. Sourou Angèle lives with her husband and children, and the couple cover the various household expenses between them. In order to be able to do this, Sourou Angèle has been selling fresh food (corn, rice) and other products (candy, cookies) from home for the past 15 years. She gets her supplies in a Benin market. This is the first time that Sourou Angèle, together with the other members of the Dieu Merci group, are requesting a loan from Alidé, so that they can boost their working capital and thus meet customer demand.

loans.use: to buy fresh food and other products.

loans.name: Kazadi

texts.fr: Monsieur Kazadi est employé dans un établissement universitaire. Il est parent d’un étudiant  de l’université. Informé d’une nouvelle opportunité de financement  des frais de scolarité, il sollicite un crédit qui va lui permettre de payer les frais académique 2013-2014 pour son fils étudiant. En remerciant Hekima pour ce nouveau prêt, il prie aussi Dieu de le bénir.
texts.en: Kazadi is employed in a university. He is father to a student at the university and, having been informed of a new opportunity to borrow money for school fees, he is requesting a loan which will enable him to pay his student son's academic fees for 2013 - 2014. He is very grateful to Hekima for this new loan and also prays to God to bless him.

loans.use: to pay academic fees for 2013-2014.

loans.name: Hipolito

texts.en: Hipolito is 62 years old and lives in Lumbayao, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte. He is married with 9 children. He has a passenger jeep for his transportation business and earns approximately 4,500 PHP each month doing this type of business. He has requested a loan for jeep maintenance. He has been a member of PMPC since 2011. In the future, Hipolito hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to pay for jeep maintenance.

loans.name: Claudia Elena

texts.es:
Claudia, continúa diversificando su negocio, por lo que solicita más capital para comprar tomates, maíz, gas propano, plátanos, cebollas, arroz, aceite, agua, sal. Lo que le ayudara a dar mejores opciones de compra a sus clientes y así continuar teniendo los recursos económicos para ir pagando sus cuotas y dar a su familia un mejor estilo de vida.
Claudia utilizo el crédito anterior para mejorar la variedad de productos que ofrecía a sus clientes, por lo que permitió mejorar sus ventas y tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Claudia is continuing to diversify her business, for which she's requesting more capital to buy tomatoes, corn, propane gas, plantains, onions, rice, oil, water, and salt.  This will help her give her customers better options and keep on having the economic resources to make her payments and give her family a better lifestyle.

Claudia used the previous loan to improve the variety of products she was offering her customers.  This allowed her to improve her sales and earn better profits.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, corn, propane gas, plantains, onions, rice, oil, water, and salt

loans.name: Fifonsi Gbenondou 1 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe FIFONSI GBENONDOU 1 est constitué de deux personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe nommée Akoua Chimène (celle qui a  la main est levée sur la photo) âgée de 29 ans, a fréquenté l’école jusqu’au niveau secondaire. Akoua Chimène est mariée à un pêcheur du nom de Basile. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Akoua Chimène vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de ménage. Pour ce faire, Akoua Chimène vend des produits vivriers (riz, huile et maïs) dans sa région depuis dix ans. Akoua Chimène s’approvisionne dans un  marché du Bénin. C’est la quatrième fois que Akoua Chimène et les membres du groupe FIFONSI GBENONDOU 1 sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé, dans le but de renforcer le niveau de leur activité afin de faire face à la demande de sa clientèle. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: THe FIFONSI GBENONDOU 1 groups is composed of two persons living in the same neighborhood. The representative of the group, named Akoua Chimène (seen in the photo with her hand raised) is 29 years old, and attended school until the secondary level. She is married to a fisherman named Basile. The couple have two children, both of whom attend school. Akoua Chimène lives with her husband and their children, and the couple share the costs of the family's needs. In order to do this, she has been selling food products (rice, oil and maize) in the region for the past ten years. She stocks up at the market in Benin. This is the fourth loan that Akoua Chimène and the group FIFONSI GBENONDOU 1 asks for a loan from ALIDE, in order to increase their level of activity and fulfill client requests. All previous loans were successfully reimbursed.

loans.use: purchase food products

loans.name: Quirilyn

texts.en:
Quirilyn is 35 years old and lives in Dicoloc, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She has one child and alone nurtures her as the sole breadwinner. 

For her means of living, Quirilyn is engaged in a rice palay trading and retailing business. She earns approximately 10,000 Philippines Pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing 20 additional sacks of rice palay for her trading business. 

Quirilyn has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Quirilyn hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase 20 additional sacks of rice palay

loans.name: Carmencita

texts.en:
Carmencita, 62 years old, lives in Camogao, Enrique Villanueva. She was gifted with 8 children. Carmencita is the breadwinner for the family. She has experienced hardships, especially in raising her family. This industrious member finds herself planting vegetables and other varieties of agricultural commodities. 

In need of additional working capital, Carmencita decided to join Paglaum Cooperative. She has received several loans already and recently requested PHP 3,500 for buying farm and garden fertilizer and paying labor costs for cultivating their land.

Being an MIGS member (Member in Good Standing) of the cooperative, she has been able to manage her income. She is able to provide for the daily needs of her family. Carmencita is very thankful because if it were not for Paglaum, she might not have any savings at all nor be guided properly in her finances.

loans.use: To purchase additional farming accessories and materials.

loans.name: Oeurm

texts.en:
Oeurm, 50 years of age, is widowed and blessed with six children, five of whom are employed in various careers, while the remaining one is her burden. To meet the daily needs of her family, Oeurm has been engaged in the agricultural business of growing rice in her village for almost 24 years and earns an income of about KHR 35,000 daily. Her income is usually spent on their food expenses, home bills and other costs of commodities. She is photographed with her son in the photo.

Besides the hardships of living, Oeurm has turned to focus on improving sanitation practices for the entire household. Due to insufficient capital, she is asking for a loan to be used to build a hygienic latrine for the sake of her family members. Thanks to the water loan program with a special rate offered by Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL), Oeurm is encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions, to safeguard the health of her family and to protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine for the sake of her family members.

loans.name: Aritas

texts.en:
Aritas earns a living through offering recycling activity. She is 58 years old, married and lives in Balolong, Larena, Siquijor. She is now well known for the nice quality of services she offers. She has already purchased some new recycling materials and has been able to save from it. Her service is self-sustainable and has become profitable, with a net profit of about Php 5,000 per month.  

Aritas is seeking a Php 10,000 loan. She would like to use the loan to purchase bottles and cans for recycling. This is a regular loan, and would be repaid in a few months. In her previous loans she has never had a delinquency. Aritas is very diligent and loves accuracy which only adds to the effective management of her venture.

loans.use: To purchase additional bottles and cans to recycle.

loans.name: Balondana

texts.fr: Le Client Balondana est un employé dans un établissement universitaire. Il est parent des 2 étudiants dont 1 à l’université et 1 à l’école secondaire. Il a été informé du nouveau produit de financement de frais d’éducation par l’IMF Hekima. C’est ainsi qu’il  sollicite un prêt pour  payer les frais académiques et scolaires de ses enfants. Il remercie Hekima pour cette innovation qui résous le problème de plusieurs ménages.
texts.en: Balondana is an employee in a university. He is the father of two students, one at the university level and another in secondary school. He was informed of the new financial loan offered by the MFI Hekima to cover education costs. He is therefore asking for a loan in order to help cover his children's education costs. He thanks Hekima for this innovative type of loan, that addresses a challenge faced by many households.

loans.use: cover academic costs

loans.name: Tupemba

texts.fr: La cliente Tupemba est employée dans un établissement universitaire. Elle est parent d’1 étudiant et d’1élève inscrits régulièrement à l’université et à l’école primaire. Elle a été informée de nouvelles opportunités de crédit éducation qu’offre l’IMF Hekima pour financer anticipativement les frais de scolarité. Ainsi, ce prêt lui permettra de payer les frais de scolarité de ses enfants pour l’année scolaire 2013-2014. Elle remercie Hekima et salut son initiative.
texts.en: This client, Tupemba, is employed at a university establishment. She is the parent of a student and a child enrolled regularly at a university and at a primary school. Tupemba was informed of new opportunities for education loans offered by the microfinance institution Hekima in order to finance education in advance. This loan will thus enable her to cover her children's  education expenses for the 2013-14 academic year. She thanks Hekima and tips her hat to its initiative.

loans.use: to pay education expenses

loans.name: Aydee

texts.es:
Aydee vive en en alquiler con su mama, en un acabado de ladrillo y piso de cemento en la ciudad de La Paz. El oficio que desempeña es de Peluquera. Aydee necesita el crédito para la compra de insumos como ser acondicionador, tintes, shampoo y otros y de esta madera mejorara sus ingresos y calidad de vida.
El sueño de Aydee es poder tener una peluqueria propia ya que actualmente ella atiende a domicilio.
texts.en:
Aydee lives with her mother.  They rent a finished house made of brick with a cement floor in the city of La Paz.

Aydee works as a hairdresser.  She needs the loan to buy conditioner, dyes, shampoo, and other supplies to improve her income and her quality of life.

Aydee dreams of having her own beauty salon, because currently she works at home.

loans.use: to buy conditioner, dye, and shampoo

loans.name: Rolin

texts.en: Rolin is married with 3 children. He is 22 years old and lives in Pobalacion, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte. He owns a sari-sari store to earn a living and has had this business for 1 year. Each month, he earns about 5,000 PHP doing this type of business. He has requested a loan for 12,000 PHP for additional capital. He has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Rolin hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase rice and corn as additional stock to sell in his store.

location.town: Liloy-Santo Niño, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Wilfreda

texts.en:
Wilfreda previously accessed a 25,000 PHP loan that she used to buy an additional stock of supplies and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan for her to buy additional stock of ready-to-wear products, such as shirts, blouses, men's wear and other products. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. The profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and pay the educational expenses for her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Wilfreda dreams that her business will continue to flourish and have more customers. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for an additional stock of supplies and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Wabulakombe Bruno

texts.fr: Le client  Wabulankombe  est un administrateur dans un établissement universitaire. Il est parent d’un étudiant  inscrit à l’université. Il a été informé de nouvelles opportunités de crédit éducation qu’offre l’IMF Hekima pour financer anticipativement les frais de scolarité. Ainsi, ce nouveau prêt lui servira de payer les frais de scolarité de son enfant étudiant pour qu’il ne soit plus exclu des cours durant toute l’année académique 2013-2014. Ce parent rêve un avenir meilleur pour son fils et souhaite le voir devenir un directeur financier d’une grande entreprise. Enfin, il remercie HEKIMA de soutenir l’éducation.
texts.en: This client, Wabulankombe, is an administrator at a university establishment. He is the parent of a student enrolled at a university. Wabulankombe was informed of new opportunities for education loans offered by the microfinance institution Hekima in order to finance education in advance. This new loan will thus be used to cover his child's  education expenses, so that he is not excluded from classes during the entire 2013-14 academic year. This parent dreams of a better future his child and would like to him become the financial director of a large company. So he thanks Hekima for supporting education.

loans.use: to cover education expenses

loans.name: Gulnor

texts.ru: Гулнор 64-летняя жительница предгорного района Вахш. Она живет вместе с мужем, сыном, невесткой и двумя любимыми внуками. Гулнор, ее муж и сын занимаются земледелием и животноводством. На протяжении 8 лет они выращивают сельскохозяйственные культуры и разводят скот. Прибыль с продажи урожая и скота является единственным источником дохода семьи. Гулнор сейчас обратилась за кредитом для развития животноводства. В хозяйстве осталось всего одна корова и она хочет приобрести еще пару голов бычков для дальнейшего откорма и перепродажи. Она надеется на вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Gulnor is a 64-year-old resident of the mountainous Vakhsh area of Tajikistan.  She lives together with her husband, her son, her son's wife and her two dear grandchildren.  Gulnor, as well as her husband and son, grow crops and raise cattle for a living.  They've been at it for 8 years, and the money they get from harvesting crops and selling cattle is the sole source of income for the family.  Gulnor has recently requested a loan to help expand her cattle-raising business.  There's only one cow left on her farm at the moment, and she would like to use a loan to buy a couple of bull calves to fatten and sell later for a profit.  She is counting on your support.

loans.use: buy a couple of bull calves for fattening and resale

loans.name: Cigusha

texts.fr: Monsieur Cigusha est employé dans un établissement universitaire. Ce client est parent de 2 élèves de l’école secondaire. Il a été mis au courant de l’existence du credit éducation offert par l’IMF Hekima. Ainsi, le prêt sollicité  lui servira de payer les frais scolaires 2013-2014 pour ces 2 enfants. Il remercie l’IMF Hekima de soutenir l’éducation qui forme les futurs leaders de la RDC.
texts.en: Mr. Cigusha is employed at a university establishment. This client is a parent of two children in secondary school. He has been updated on the existence of education loans offered by the microfinance institution Hekima. The loan requested will thus be used to cover his children's education expenses for the 2013-14 academic year. He thanks the microfinance institution Hekima for it support of education that trains the future leaders of the DR Congo.

loans.use: to cover the education expenses for 2013-2014

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is married and has four children. She is forty-eight years old and lives in Kinangay Norte, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. 

She has had a manicure and pedicure business for the past twelve years. Teresita has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase cement, lumber, sand and gravel for house repairs. She has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, she hopes to be successful in her business.

loans.use: to purchase cement and lumber for house repair

loans.name: Juan Jose

texts.es:
Juan, es una persona muy reconocida por su responsabilidad y honestidad, actualmente vive solo, es soltero, no tiene ayuda del extranjero, se dedica a la crianza de ganado y siembra de granos básicos, por el momento no representa ninguna dificultad para realizar dicha actividad, es un oficio que aprendió de su familia, una de sus ventajas es que lo hace en tierras propias.
El capital que está solicitando lo invertirá en la compra de concentrado para ganado, lo que le facilitara alimentarlo en la época de verano y evitar que este pierda valor en el mercado, espera mejorar sus ingresos con los cuales cancelara sus cuotas y mejorara su estilo de vida.
Su sueño es tener una mayor rentabilidad en su negocio, con el cual formara un patrimonio para ofrecer a su futura familia.
texts.en:
Juan is well known for his responsibility and honesty.  Currently he's single and lives alone, and has no outside help.

Juan earns a living raising cattle and growing basic grains, work he learned from his family.  At the moment he has no particular problem carrying out his job.  One of the advantages is that he works on his own land.

The capital Juan's requesting is to buy concentrated cattle feed to make it easier to feed them in the summer and to avoid any loss in market value.  He hopes to improve his income so he can make his payments and improve his lifestyle.

His dream is to have greater profitability in his business so he can create a legacy for his future family.

loans.use: to buy concentrated cattle feed

loans.name: Ciza

texts.fr: Madame Ciza est employée dans un établissement universitaire. Parent de 3 élèves, elle fut informée de nouvelles opportunités de crédit éducation offert par l’IMF Hekima. Ainsi, le prêt demandé lui servira de payer les frais scolaires de ses enfants durant toute l’année scolaire 2013-2014. Elle se fait un grand reve de voir ses enfants achevés leurs études universitaires et devenir des cadres d’entreprises. Elle loue le grand projet de Hekima et le remercie.
texts.en: Ms.Ciza is employed at a university establishment. A parent of three students, she was informed of new opportunities for education loans offered by the microfinance institution Hekima. This loan requested will thus be used to cover her children's education expenses for the entire 2013-14 academic year. A big dream of hers is to see her children complete their university studies and become staff employees in private companies. She praises Hekima's grand plans and gives her thanks.

loans.use: to cover education expenses

loans.name: Cinthia Mercedes

texts.es: Cinthia es originaria de la ciudad de León, soltera. Tiene 23 años de edad. Es de oficio comerciante se dedica a la venta de bebidas. Inicio su negocio hace tres años con capital propio y poco a poco ha aumentado sus ventas logrando salir adelante. Solicita el crédito para comprar gaseosas y frutas para la elaboración de refrescos. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que podrá ofrecer una amplia variedad de productos a sus clientes. Su plan futuro es ofrecerles mejores condiciones a sus clientes.
texts.en: Cinthia is 23 years old, she is single and she comes from the town of León. She is a retailer and she sells soft drinks. She started her activity three years ago with her own capital, and little by little she has succeeded in increasing her sales and in getting ahead. She is requesting a loan to buy fizzy drinks and fruit to prepare soft drinks. She thinks the loan will be of great help to her, as she will be able to offer a wide variety of products to her customers. Her plan for the future is to provide her customers with a better service.

loans.use: To buy fizzy drinks and fruit to prepare soft drinks.

loans.name: Wagakyumo

texts.fr: Le client Wangakyumo est travailleur dans un établissement universitaire. Parent d’1 étudiant et d’1élève inscrits régulièrement à l’université et école secondaire. Il a été informé de nouvelles opportunités de crédit éducation qu’offre l’IMF Hekima. Ainsi, ce nouveau prêt lui servira de payer les frais de scolarité de ses enfants pour qu’ils ne soient plus exclus des cours durant toute l’année académique 2013-2014. Le souhait de ce parent est de voir ses enfants achevés leurs études. Il loue grandement l’initiative de Hekima.
texts.en: This client, Wangakyumo, is a worker in a university establishment. The parent of a student and a pupil enrolled regularly at a university and at a secondary school, he was informed of new opportunities for education loans offered by the microfinance institution Hekima. This new loan will thus be used to cover his children's education costs, so that they are not excluded from classes during the entire 2013-13 academic year. The wish of this parent is to see his children complete their studies. He greatly praises Hekima's initiative.

loans.use: to cover education costs

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is 44 years old and lives in Gango, Ozamiz City. She is married and has four school-age children.

Flora has a canteen business and earns approximately 10,000 PHP each month doing this type of business. She has a requested a loan to purchase stock for her canteen.

Flora has been a member of PMPC for 4 years. In the future, Flora hopes to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase stock for her canteen.

loans.name: Luneta

texts.en: Luneta is 54 years old and lives in Gango, Ozamiz City. She is married and has five adult-aged children, and one school–aged child.  Luneta has a buy and sell business.  She has been doing this for three years.  She has requested a loan for house repair.  Luneta has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Luneta hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to repair her house.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is forty-five years old and lives in Salimpono, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with seven children. 

Wilma is engaged in farming activity, particularly coconut production. At present, she is also an elected Barangay Official in the community. She is earning roughly PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of work and from honorarium. She has requested a loan to cover her son's tuition fees for the Marine Nautical course he is currently doing. Wilma became a member of PMPC this year. In the future, she hopes to engage in other types of business.

loans.use: To pay her son's tuition fees

loans.name: Tilalo

texts.fr:
Tilalo est âgée de 32 ans. Elle est originaire du nord du Togo plus précisément de Kara. Elle est célibataire et habite le quartier de Tokoin. En 2003 elle a commencé la vente des produits de premières nécessités  dans son quartier. 3 ans après l'exercice de cette activité, elle a constaté que cette activité ne lui procure pas assez de revenus pour lui permettre de supporter ses charges.
En 2006 Tilalo a démarré la vente des céréales à son domicile. Elle a des clients qui sont des restauratrices qui viennent faire des achats chez elle en fin de journée. Au cours de la journée, elle fait le commerce ambulant des pâtes alimentaires et des boîtes de conserve.
Ce crédit que Tilalo sollicite lui permettra d'acheter 2 sacs de maïs afin de répondre au mieux aux besoins de ses clients et gagner plus de bénéfices.
texts.en: Tilalo is 32 years old. She is originally from northern Togo, that is Kara to be exact. She is unmarried and lives in the Tokoin district.
