Since 2006, Patras Masih has been running a small cloth and garment shop in the market. This shop is the only source of income for his family. He wants to purchase a variety of clothing, such as pants, dress shirts, suits, sweaters, coats, gloves, mufflers and school jerseys. To do this, he has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan. The loan will help him to offer a variety of products to his clients and increase his net income as well. Patras Masih dreams of growing his business so that his children can have a better future. Patras Masih's family sends loads of prayers and thanks to all of the staff of Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy cloth and garments such as dress pants, shirts, t-shirts, sweaters, coats and gloves

loans.name: Rose Marry

texts.en:
Rose Marry is aged fifty-one, married to a farmer and blessed with seven children. She works in direct selling business in their village and earns a net income of PHP 3,000 a month. Her net profits are usually spent on purchasing rice grain and food expenses. Her income has not been enough to to cover this, so she decided to apply for a loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to purchase lotions, colognes, shampoo and talcum powder to sell. 

Rose Marry also earns additional income from working in a retail store. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she can immediately buy some personal use products to sell in their village, to have additional income.

loans.use: To purchase lotions, colognes, shampoo and talcum powder to sell

loans.name: Odalma Lisseth

texts.es:
Odalma, comenta que gracias a los créditos a podido mantener en buenas condiciones su vehículo, lo que le facilita dar seguridad a su familia cuando tienen momentos recreativos. En su familia algunas cosas han cambiado, en la actualidad hace 9 meses se caso y junto a su esposo tienen un cibercafé, ella continua siendo empleada y él se encarga de atender el negocio.
Ella solicita un nuevo crédito para pagar el mantenimiento a su vehículo, así como también mejorar la tecnología que poseen en su cibercafé, comprara teclados, mouse, memorias, entre otros, los que le servirá para fortalecer su negocio y continuar movilizándose a su empleo.
texts.en:
Odalma says that thanks to her loans she has been able to keep her vehicle in good shape, which makes it easier for her family when they have free time.  

Some things in her family have changed.  Nine months ago now she got married and together with her husband she has a cybercafé.  She continues to be employed and her husband is in charge of taking care of their business.  

She is asking for a new loan to pay for maintenance on her vehicle and also to improve the technology they have in the cybercafé.  She will buy keyboards, computer mice, and memory, among other items.  These uses will serve to strengthen her business and to keep her commuting to her work.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance on her vehicle and to buy keyboards, memory, and computer mice, among other items.

loans.name: Phaly

texts.en: Phaly is 35 years old and is a married woman with three children in Oudong, Kampong Speu Province. She is a soybean juice vendor and her husband is a motor-taxi driver. Both of them can earn $17 per day. Now she would like to apply for a loan of $1,000 to buy a new motorbike for her husband to provide transportation service to clients. In the future, she hopes that she can expand her business and renovate her house and that her kids can get bachelors degrees.

loans.use: to buy a new motorbike to provide transportation service to clients.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy dressmaking supplies

loans.name: Chenda

texts.en:
Chenda, age 26, is single and lives with his parents, brothers and sister in a village about 10 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Chenda is an artist and gets hired and paid with fees. He is asking for a loan to fill in the land in front of his house because there are some ponds and it’s difficult, especially when the rainy season comes.

loans.use: to fill in the land in front of his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy decorations for children's parties.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 31 years old and married with six children. She is a responsible mother and always makes sure that she can provide for all the needs of her family, especially educating her children. She loves and enjoys selling products to her community because, not only does she earn income, but she earns kindness and gains more friends within her locality. In this way, her costumers will choose the products she offers. 

To further grow her personal products business, she is borrowing a loan of Php 8,000 to buy clothes, shoes, slippers and soap for her business. 

In the future, Judith hopes that she can achieve her dreams for her family.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes, slippers and soap for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the costs associated with finishing her degree.

loans.name: Afi Brigitte

texts.fr:
Brigitte est une femme togolaise mariée et mère de 2 enfants, née en 1971, elle habite le quartier Adidogomé au nord ouest de Lomé où elle a débuté son commerce d’alimentation générale en 2007 ce qui lui a permis de se lancer en 2013 dans la fabrication artisanale de savon appelé en langue locale « KPEVIDI ».   
Commerçante rigoureuse et accueillante, elle a su fidéliser sa clientèle qui de jour en jour s’accroît. C’est pour cette raison qu’elle sollicite ce crédit qui lui permettra d’augmenter son stock de matières premières et produire en quantité suffisante du savon.
Les revenus de son activité lui permettront de mieux épargner et se garantir sa retraite.
texts.en:
Brigitte is a Togolese woman who is a married mother of two. She was born in 1971 and lives in the Adidogomé district northwest of Lomé, where she started her grocery business in 2007. It enabled her to launch a business in 2013 for making artisanal soap, called "KPEVIDI" in the local language. 

A rigorous and accommodating merchant, she knew how to earn the loyalty of her customer base, which grows from day to day. For this reason, she is requesting this loan enabling her to increase her stock of raw materials for making sufficient quantities of soap. The revenues from her business will allow her to save more money and assure her retirement.

loans.use: to purchase palm nut oil and some soda.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase wood and drinks wholesale

loans.name: Rhubemuguma Group

texts.fr: Madame Claire, conseillère dans le groupe de credit Rhubemuguma est mère de 7 enfants  dont 6 sont scolarisés  et 1 n’a pas encore atteint l’âge de scolarité.  Agée de  35ans, elle est mariée à un cultivateur. Commerçante depuis plus de 10ans, elle sollicite ce nouveau prêt pour acheter  1000kg de manioc sec. Le grand problème qu’elle rencontre dans l’exercice de son activité  c’est la mévente et l’absence prolongée de l’énergie électrique pendant  la période pluvieuse.
texts.en: Ms. Claire, the advisor in the loan group Rhubemuguma, is the mother of seven children, of whom six are in school, and one is not yet school-aged. She is 35 years old and married to a farmer. A merchant for over ten years, she is requesting this new loan to purchase 1,000 kg  of dried cassava. The big problems she encounters while operating her business are drops in sales and prolonged electrical outages during rainy periods.

loans.use: to purchase dried cassava to sell

loans.name: Chrep

texts.en: Chrep is a 42-year-old widowed woman with two children from Oudong, Kampong Speu Province. Chrep and her eldest child work at a factory. They can earn $8 per day. Now she is asking for loan of $500 to buy cement to cover a floor with a concrete. She is trying to work hard to enlarge the front of her house and to encourage her youngest kid to get a diploma.

loans.use: to buy cement to cover a floor with a concrete

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Victor vive en compañia de sus padres en la ciudad de La Paz. Trabaja como Costurero se dedica a la elaboracion de prendas de vestir para niños, nos solicito el crédito para poder comprar materia prima en especial de color blanca que es la que es mas dificil de conseguir.

El sueño de Victor Hugo es agrandar su pequeño negocio y tener una casa propia.
texts.en:
Victor lives with his parents in the city of La Paz. He works as a tailor, making garments for children. He is requesting the loan so he can purchase material, particularly in white as it is the most difficult to get.

Victor’s dream is to expand his small business and have his own house.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for making children's clothing, such as fabric and thread

loans.name: Amani Group

texts.fr: Madame Feza est présidente de l’association d’affaire  Amani. Femme forte et entrepreneur, veuve à 49 ans est mère de 5 enfants tous scolarisés. Elle est vendeuse des Maniocs depuis plus de 20ans. Le nouveau prêt va lui servir à l’achat de 3 bâches de 500kg de cossettes de manioc. Son vouloir est  d’étendre son entreprise.  Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima de son soutient aux femmes rurales et de son initiative à la culture de l’épargne.
texts.en: Ms. Feza is the president of the business association Amani. A strong woman and an entrepreneur, she is 49 years old and a widowed mother of five children, all provided with education. She has been a vendor of cassava for over twenty years. This new loan is going to be used to purchase three 500-kg [units] of dried cassava slices. Her wish is to expand her enterprise. She therefore thanks Hekima for it support of rural women and its initiative for promoting saving accounts.

loans.use: to purchase dried cassava slices to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cooking utensils and ingredients like rice, oil, etc.

loans.name: Linda Group

texts.fr: La cliente M’Baganda est présidente dans le  groupe de credit  Linda. Elle est  mariée à l’âge de 43 ans à un homme d’affaire et mère de 9 enfants  qui vont tous à l’école. Vendeuse au grand marché public depuis plus de 10 ans, elle sollicite ce nouveau prêt pour acheter 2ballons de friperies.  Son objectif est de devenir grossiste. Elle remercie Hekima pour l’encadrement des femmes pauvres économiquement actives.
texts.en: This client, M’Baganda, is the president of the loan group Linda. She is married at 43 years of age to a businessman, and she is the mother of nine children, who all go to school. A vendor at the big public market for over ten years, she is requesting this new loan to purchase2 bales of secondhand clothing. Her goal is to become a wholesaler. She thanks the microfinance institution Hekima for providing training to poor women who are active in the economy.

loans.use: to purchase bales of secondhand clothing to sell

loans.name: Murhunda

texts.fr: Le client Murhunda est un Médecin de carrière depuis 12 ans dans un hôpital de grande renommé de la place, âgé de 48 ans, veuf et parent de 3 élèves inscrits respectivement a l'école secondaire et primaire. Il a été informé de nouvelles opportunités de crédit éducation qu’offre l’IMF Hekima pour financer anticipativement les frais scolaires. Ainsi, ce nouveau prêt lui servira de payer les frais de scolarité de ses enfants élèves pour qu’ils ne soient plus exclus des cours durant toute l’année scolaire 2013-2014. Ce parent rêve un avenir meilleur pour ses enfants et les voir devenir de médecins, ingénieurs agronomes, électro mécaniciens, informaticiens, cadres d’entreprise, professeurs d’université, Révérend pasteur, parlementaires, etc. Au finish, il salut grandement l’initiative spéciale de Hekima surtout de ce projet d’impact social pendant cette période de la reconstruction de l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
This client, Murhunda, has had a career as a doctor for twelve years in a famous local hospital. He is 48 years old, a widower, and the parent of three pupils enrolled respectively in secondary and primary school. He was informed about new opportunities for education loans offered by the microfinance institution Hekima to finance education expenses in advance. This new loan will thus be used to cover his children's education expenses, so that they are not excluded from classes during the entire 2013-14 academic year. 

This parent dreams of a better future for his children and to see them become doctors, engineers, agronomists, electro-mechanics, software developers, company managers, university professors, pastors, members of parliament, etc. 

In conclusion, he raises his hat to Hekima's special initiative, especially to its social impact project, during this period of reconstruction in the country's east.

loans.use: to cover education costs

loans.name: Badeya Group

texts.fr:
Mme SOLANGE représente le groupe BADEYA. Elle se porte bien avec son bébé. Mariée, elle est mère de 04 enfants. Le plus âgé a 19ans et le moins âgé a 08mois. Les 03 vont à l’école.
Mme fait la restauration (vente d’atiéké) depuis 11ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de son quartier. Ses clients sont les hommes, femmes et enfants de son quartier.
Elle veut s’acheter 12sachets d’atiéké (couscous de manioc), 02bidon d’huile et 03sachets de poisson frais.
Avec ses bénéfices, elle désire réinvestir dans son activité. Mme ambitionne étendre les limites de son activité et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ms. SOLANGE represents the group BADEYA. She is doing well with her baby. She is a married mother of four children. The oldest is 19 years old, and the youngest is 8 months old. Three of them go to school. SOLANGE has been in the restaurant business serving atiéké (cassava couscous) for eleven years. She gets her supplies at the market in her district. Her customers are the men, women and children in the district. 

She wants to purchase 12 bags of atiéké, 2 containers of cooking oil, and 3 bags of fresh fish. With the profits, she would like to reinvest in her business. Her ambition is to expand her business and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase cassava couscous, cooking oil, and fish for her restaurant

loans.name: Ntahaliza Group

texts.fr: La cliente Buhoro est  membre du groupe d’affaire Ntahaliza. Commerçante expérimentée depuis plus de 12 ans, elle est mariée a un homme sans travail. Elle est mère de 7 enfants dont 5 scolarisés et  2 n’ont pas encore atteint l’âge de scolarité. Avec le nouveau crédit, elle va acheter 7 tôles pour renforcer son stock. Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son entreprise, avoir son propre dépôt de stockage, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima  de tout cœur et prie Dieu de le bénir.
texts.en:
This client, Buhoro, is a member of the business group Ntahaliza. An experienced merchant for over twelve years, she is married to a man who is unemployed. She is the mother of seven children, of whom two are not yet school-aged. 

With this new loan, she is going to purchase 7 sheets of metal [typically for roofing material] to bolster her stock. She would therefore like to increase her enterprise, have her own warehouse, and provide education and food for her children. With all her heart, she thanks the microfinance institution Hekima and prays that God blesses it.

loans.use: to purchase roofing metal to sell

loans.name: Hiyam

texts.en:
Hiyam is a 53-year-old widowed mother of three children who has been struggling and fighting for her beloved children since her dear husband passed away 15 years ago.

Hiyam is a hard working woman with an excellent reputation in her region. She is well known for the sacrifices that she does in order to make sure that her children have the necessary standard of living.

Hiyam has been running her convenience store for 15 years and she is managing it properly. Today, since her family's needs are increasing and her customers' requests are becoming wider, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with special offer products, especially spring and summer special release offers. This product diversification will attract new customers and satisfy their desires.

Hiyam is sure that the acquired loan will help her improve her children's living conditions and cover most of their needs in a well-managed way.

She hopes that in the future, she can keep on expanding and diversifying her business products to turn her moderate convenience store into a supermarket that covers almost all of her customers' needs.

loans.use: To buy special offer products to sell

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to buy more stocks of mineral water needed in her business.  Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, house hold and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 8,000 PHP loan for her to buy additional stocks of mineral water needed in her business.  The more mineral water displayed at the store the better.  More items to sell will result in increased profits.  Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her family's daily needs as well as her children's educational expenses.  She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Lorna dreams to be more successful in her business and hopes that her children will finish their studies.  She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more stocks of mineral water to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to buy peanuts, oil and other ingredients needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and for her family's personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another loan, for 15,000 PHP, to buy raw ingredients needed in her business. Her profits will definitely help her to meet her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Luzviminda hopes that her business will grow bigger and dreams to improve her family's way of living. She meets up with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients needed in her business.

loans.name: Saturnino

texts.es:
Saturnino es una persona de 50 años de edad.  Se dedica a la agricultura en pequeño y lleva acabo esta actividad de hace 35 años, el señor Saturnino vivió y se creció con sus padres y fue de ellos que aprendió a trabajar la agricultura principalmente en la siembra de granos básicos, maíz, frijoles y maicillo de esta manera lleva el sustento diario a su familia, que esta compuesta por su esposa  con la cual son padres de 5 hijos de los cuales 3 de ellos se encuentra cursando educación básica en el Centro Escolar y los otros dos aun no cumplen con la edad adecuada para asistir a la escuela. 

 A realizar esta actividad agrícola, lo hace con ayuda de su hijo mayor el cual por la mañana le ayuda a trabajar y por la tarde asiste a sus clases en la escuela.


El dinero sera utilizado en para comprar un caballo, el cual le servirá para  transportar los insumos agrícolas del pueblo hacia sus parcelas, las cuales quedan a 4 km de su casa  y de la misma manera para halar las cosechas, halar leña y otras cosas que requieran de transportarse. De esta forma ya no tendrán que halar los fertilizantes y los demás insumos en sus espaldas con los que recorren 4 km y con la compra de dicho animal ya no tendrán que maltratarse para trasladar sus materiales agrícolas.


Las proyecciones que don Saturnino son las de pagar su crédito y adquirir otro para comprar otro caballo y para hacer una carreta con ayuda de su hermano el carpintero y apoyar la educación de sus hijos ya que el mayor quiere  estudiar para agronomo.
texts.en:
Saturnino is 50 years old. He is a small-scale farmer and has been farming for 35 years. Saturnino lived and grew up with his parents and from them he learned to work farming, primarily growing basic grains, corn, beans, and maicillo (a type of small grain). In this way he provides for his family's daily needs. His family consists of his wife with whom he has 5 children, 3 of whom are in primary school and the other two are not yet old enough to attend school.

In order to carry our his farming, he has the help of his oldest son who helps him in the morning and attends class at school in the afternoon.

The money will be used to buy a horse, which will be used to transport farming supplies from the town to the fields which are located 4 kilometers from his house. The horse will also transport the crops, firewood, and other items that need to be transported. In this way they won't have to haul the fertilizer and other supplies on their backs for the 4 kilometers and by buying the horse they won't have to hurt themselves transporting their farming supplies.

Saturnino's future plans are to pay his loan and seek another in order to buy another horse and to build a cart with the help of his brother who is a carpenter, and to support the education of his children as the oldest wants to be an agronomist.

loans.use: to buy a horse.

loans.name: Sakhorn

texts.en: Sakhorn is 45 years old, a widowed woman of two children at Kampong Speu Province.  She works at a rice grinding machine manufacturer and her two children work at the garment factory.  All of them earn $14.50 per day.  Now she would like to apply for loan of $1,000 for buying farmland to increase her harvest. This loan will help her in increasing her income through farming and bringing her family a better life.

loans.use: For buying a farmland to increase her harvest through farming

loans.name: Mitima

texts.fr: Le client Mitima est un Manager et cadre d’entreprise dans une organisation de la société civile, âgé de 42 ans, marié et parent de 2 élèves inscrits respectivement à l'école primaire. Il a été informé de nouvelles opportunités de crédit éducation qu’offre l’IMF Hekima pour financer anticipativement les frais scolaires. Ainsi, ce nouveau prêt lui servira de payer les frais de scolarité de ses enfants élèves  pour qu’ils ne soient plus exclus des cours durant toute l’année scolaire 2013-2014. Ce parent rêve un avenir meilleur pour ses enfants et les voir devenir president de la republique, ministres, de gestionnaires parmi les cadres entreprises publiques ou para étatiques, professeurs d’université, Révérend pasteur, parlementaires, etc. Au finish, il salut grandement l’initiative spéciale de Hekima surtout de ce projet d’impact social pendant cette période de la reconstruction de l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
This client, Mitima, is a manager and staffer in a public service organization. He is 42 years old, married, and the parent of two pupils enrolled respectively in primary school. He was informed about new opportunities for education loans offered by the microfinance institution Hekima to finance education costs in advance. This new loan will thus be used to cover his children's education costs, so that they are not excluded from classes during the entire 2013-14 academic year. 

This parent dreams of a better future for his children and to see them become president of the republic, ministers, managers in public or para-state enterprises, university professors, pastors, members of parliament, etc. 

In conclusion, he raises his hat to Hekima's special initiative, especially to its social impact project, during this period of reconstruction in the country's east.

loans.use: to cover education costs

loans.name: Chrysostome

texts.fr: Le client Chrysostme est un Manager et cadre d’entreprise dans une organisation de la société civile, âgé de 39 ans, marié et parent de 4 élèves inscrits respectivement à l'école primaire et secondaire. Il a été informé de nouvelles opportunités de crédit éducation qu’offre l’IMF Hekima pour financer anticipativement les frais scolaires. Ainsi, ce nouveau prêt lui servira de payer les frais de scolaires de ses enfants élèves  pour qu’ils ne soient plus exclus des cours durant toute l’année scolaire 2013-2014. Ce parent rêve un avenir meilleur pour ses enfants et les voir devenir de ministres, pourquoi pas président de la république, ingénieurs, agronomes, médecins, professeurs d’université, Révérend pasteur, parlementaires, etc. Au finish, il salut grandement l’initiative spéciale de Hekima surtout de ce projet d’impact social pendant cette période de la reconstruction de l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
This client, Chrysostme, is a manager and staffer in a public service organization. He is 39 years old, married, and the parent of four pupils enrolled respectively in primary school and secondary school. He was informed about new opportunities for education loans offered by the microfinance institution Hekima to finance education costs in advance. This new loan will thus be used to cover his children's education costs, so that they are not excluded from classes during the entire 2013-14 academic year. 

This parent dreams of a better future for his children and to see them become ministers -- and why not president of the republic? -- engineers, agronomists, doctors, university professors, pastors, members of parliament, etc. 

In conclusion, he raises his hat to Hekima's special initiative, especially to its social impact project, during this period of reconstruction in the country's east.

loans.use: to cover education costs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a car for her husband's taxi service

loans.name: Kabasele

texts.fr: Le client Kabasele est un Manager et cadre d’entreprise dans une organisation de la société civile, âgé de 33 ans, marié  et parent de 5 élèves inscrits respectivement à école primaire. Il a été informé de nouvelles opportunités de crédit éducation qu’offre l’IMF Hekima pour financer anticipativement les frais scolaires. Ainsi, ce nouveau prêt lui servira de payer les frais de scolarité de ses enfants élèves pour qu’ils ne soient plus exclus des cours durant toute l’année scolaire 2013-2014. Ce parent rêve un avenir meilleur pour ses enfants et les voir devenir de gestionnaires parmi les cadres entreprises publiques ou para étatiques, ingenieurs, medecins, professeurs d’université, Révérend pasteur, parlementaires, etc. Au finish, il salut grandement l’initiative spéciale de Hekima surtout de ce projet d’impact social pendant cette période de la reconstruction de l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
This client, Kabasele, is a manager and staffer in a public service organization. He is 33 years old, married, and the parent of five pupils enrolled respectively in primary school. He was informed about new opportunities for education loans offered by the microfinance institution Hekima to finance education costs in advance. This new loan will thus be used to cover his children's education costs, so that they are not excluded from classes during the entire 2013-14 academic year. 

This parent dreams of a better future for his children and to see them become staff members in public or para-state enterprises, engineers, doctors, university professors, pastors, members of parliament, etc. 

In conclusion, he raises his hat to Hekima's special initiative, especially to its social impact project, during this period of reconstruction in the country's east.

loans.use: to cover education costs

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a 44-year-old married mother of five children. She has been running her convenience store for twelve years. She also works in a beauty business from her house, and has a few requests for handcrafts which she accepts from time to time depending on whether she is capable of finishing the requests on time or not.

Mariam is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with special-offer products that will increase her net profit. She will invest part of the loan in supporting her beauty business by buying newly released cosmetics and makeup items that she needs to improve her business.

Today, Mariam is working hard to expand her diversified businesses, to expand her working sectors and to develop her beloved children's standard of living. She will make sure that they are going to benefit from the best education and enjoy a brighter future.

loans.use: To buy special-offer products for her convenience store and newly released cosmetics and makeup items for her beauty business

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to buy ready-to-wear items like polo shirts for men and women, socks and shirts to expand her product inventory. Her earnings were a big help for her personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another loan, for 20,000 PHP, to buy ready-to-wear products to expand her product inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in greater profits. Her profits will definitely help her to meet her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Elvira hopes to be more successful in business and dreams that her family will always be in good health. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy ready-to-wear products to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Pastor

texts.es:
Pastor es una persona de 40 años, se dedica a la agricultura en pequeño. Él se creció con su madre y su abuelo quien se dedicaba a la ganadería y a la agricultura, especialmente a la siembra de granos básicos. El señor Pastor carece de una formación academia, ya que en aquél tiempo se le dificulto el acceso a la educación por sus escasos recursos económicos, de esta forma se dedicó a trabajar en las actividades agrícolas y ganaderas de su abuelo, con el paso del tiempo fue adquiriendo experiencia y conocimientos en realizar esta actividad y decidió independizarse y formar su hogar con su esposa, que se dedica a los oficios domésticos de su hogar, juntos son padres de 3 hijos,  quienes 2 de ellos se encuentran estudiando educación básica y su hijo mayor se encuentra trabajando en Estados Unidos.

Don Pastor, se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado y realizando esta actividad lleva 26 años de experiencia. Actividad que aprendió de su abuelo con quien se creció y dedico parte de su vida a convivir y a realizar los trabajos agrícolas de su hogar y decidió continuar esta actividad motivado por los buenos resultados económicos que se tienen,  además porque cuenta con la experiencia en la compra y venta de dichos animales. Él compra y vende en el tiangue municipal los días viernes de cada semana y manifiesta que en cada compra y venta que realiza lo acompaña su hijo mayor a quien desde ya, lo va capacitando para que en un futuro él sea quien se encargue de realizar dicha actividad.

El dinero será utilizado para la compra de ganado, ya que se le ha presentado una propuesta de ganado y necesita el dinero para complementar el monto y adquirir dichos animales que después podrán ser vendidos a un mejor precio, los cuales le darán una ganancia la que invertirá en la educación de sus hijos y de esta manera estará garantizando un derecho fundamental a sus hijos. 
 
Los sueños del señor Pastor son los de tener un corral más adecuado para apacentar su ganado, apoyar en la educación de sus hijos hasta que sean unos profesionales de éxito y con ayuda de un nuevo crédito podrá ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Pastor is 40 years old and is a farmer. He grew up with his mother and grandfather, who raised cattle and farmed, growing basic grains. Pastor does not have a formal education, as back in the days of his childhood it was difficult to access education because of few economic resources. So he dedicated himself to farming and raising cattle like his grandfather. Over time he acquired experience and knowledge about farming and decided to become independent and create a home with his wife, who is a homemaker. Together they are parents of 3 children, 2 of whom are in school and the oldest is working in the United States.

Pastor buys and sells cattle, something he has been doing for 26 years. He learned this work from his grandfather who raised him and dedicated part of his life to living with him and farming, and he decided to continue farming motivated by the good economic results that they had. In addition because of the experience he has in buying and selling animals. He buys and sells in Tiangue municipality every Friday and with each buy and sell his oldest son accompanies him in order to learn for his future so that he can continue in this work.

The money will be used to buy cattle, as he has been presented a proposal for the cattle and needs the money in order to complete the deal and acquire the animals so that he can then sell them at a better price, which will provide an income to use to invest in his children's education and in this way this fundamental right will be available to his children.

Pastor dreams of having a larger corral to graze his cattle, support the education of his children so that they may become successful professionals and with help of a new loan be able to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Louis

texts.fr: Le client Louis est un Manager et cadre d’entreprise dans une organisation de la société civile, âgé de 37 ans, marié et parent de 2 élèves inscrits respectivement à l'école primaire. Il a été informé de nouvelles opportunités de crédit éducation qu’offre l’IMF Hekima pour financer anticipativement les frais scolaires. Ainsi, ce nouveau prêt lui servira de payer les frais de scolarité de ses enfants élèves pour qu’ils ne soient plus exclus des cours durant toute l’année scolaire 2013-2014. Ce parent rêve un avenir meilleur pour ses enfants et les voir devenir de gestionnaires parmis les cadres entreprises publiques ou para étatiques, professeurs d’université, Révérend pasteur, parlementaires, etc. Au finish, il salut grandement l’initiative spéciale de Hekima surtout de ce projet d’impact social pendant cette période de la reconstruction de l’Est du pays.
texts.en: Our client Louis is a manager and  a member of the executive  team in an NGO. He is 37 years old, married and has two children in primary school. He has learned about the new possibility of obtaining educational loans offered by IMF Hekima in order to finance school fees in advance.  Thus, this new loan will allow him to pay the school fees for his children and ensure that they are able to attend school during  the entire 2013-2014 school year. As a parent, Louis dreams of a  better for his future for his children, imagining them to become  executives or managers in public or  civil service, university professors, pastors, elected officials etc.  Finally, he commends this special initiative of Hekima and its social impact, particularly during this time when the east of the country is being rebuilt.

loans.use: to pay for school fees.

loans.name: Sopheunn

texts.en:
Sopheunn is 53 years old, a married woman, and the mother of three children. She lives at Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a fish-and-vegetable vendor, and her husband is a fisherman and farmer. Her two daughters are factory laborers. All of them, together, can earn $18 per day.

Now she is asking for a loan of $400. She will use it for buying fertilizer, seed, insecticide and petroleum, for farming in the dry season. This loan will be helpful in increasing her harvest, as well as her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seed, insecticide and petroleum

loans.name: Benkady Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Benkady de Koutiala  est un regroupement de femmes qui vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 35 ans et ont au moins 3 enfants chacune.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels que d’Habits, Produits Cosmétiques, Fruits et Légumes, Beurre de Karité, Plastiques,  etc. Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de groupe. 
Maimouna, 1 ère  assise de la gauche vers la droite, est une vendeuse des produits Cosmétiques. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des différents types de  pommades, lotions, laits et savons à Koutiala. Elle vend ses produits au comptant à la maison et au marché à une clientèle diverse. 
Tandis que les autres membres  du groupe Benkady comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 110 000CFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Mme Maimouna compte réaliser  125 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnelles et augmenter son fonds de commerce. 
Elles souhaitent voir renforcer ce partenariat avec  Soro Yiriwaso pour que les stocks ne soient pas rares.
texts.en:
The Benkady group of Koutiala brings together women who live in large traditional families with their husbands, children, and other relatives. On average, they are 35 years old and have three children. 

This group of women sells various items like clothing, cosmetic products, fruits and vegetables, shea butter, plastics, etc. In order to increase the size of their business, the members decided to join Soro Yiriwaso's loan program. This is their second group loan. 

Maimouna, the woman all the way on the left, sells cosmetic products. She would like to use her loan to buy different types of ointments, lotions, milks, and soaps in Koutiala. She sells her products for cash, out of her home in at the market, to a diverse clientele. 

While the other members of the Benkady group would like to earn an average monthly profit of 110,000 FCFA during this loan cycle, Mme Maimouna would like to earn 125,000 FCFA.  

In addition to reimbursing their loan, they use a part of the revenue to pay for personal expenses and to grow their business. 

They would like to reinforce their partnership with Soro Yiriwaso so that their supplies do not run out.

loans.use: buy cosmetic products.

loans.name: Chanthy

texts.en:
Chanthy is 49 years old, a married woman, and the mother of four children. She lives at Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a housewife, and her husband is a livestock retailer.

She would like to apply for a loan of $500. She will use it for buying a cow and a buffalo, to sell them for profit. This loan will be helpful for her husband’s small business, which is the only means of feeding her family. She hopes that this business can be more expandable. Then she could build a new house for her family.

loans.use: to buy a cow and a buffalo

loans.name: Jenny Rose

texts.en:
Jenny Rose, 34 years of age, is married to a driver. They have been blessed with two children. She's been in a hog-raising business in their village for almost three years. She earns a net income of PHP 4,000 per hog. She usually spends her profits on the family's daily expenses and the school fees of their two children.

Due to insufficient capital, she would like to obtain a loan from those generous lenders, amounting to PHP 10,000. She will use the loan to purchase hogs to raise. She's hoping that the loan she requested will be granted, so that she can use it immediately in her hog-raising business.

loans.use: To purchase hogs to raise.

loans.name: Kotognogontala Group

texts.fr:
Kotognogontala est un regroupement de femmes de Koutiala  qui se connaissent bien et qui  vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 23 ans et ont au moins 3 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels que, Fruits et Légumes, Bois de chauffage, Tissus, Beurre de Karité etc. Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de groupe. 
Fatoumata  est un membre du groupe Kotognogontala assise, deuxième personne de la gauche vers la droite, elle est  vendeuse de Beurre de Karité. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter de beurre de Karité en quantité à Koutiala et les vend en détail à la maison et au marché à une clientèle diverse. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Kotognogontala comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 100 000CFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Mme Fatoumata compte réaliser  105 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnelles et augmenter son fonds de commerce. 
Elles souhaitent voir renforcer ce partenariat avec  Soro Yiriwaso pour que les stocks ne soient pas rares.
texts.en:
Kotognogontala is a group of women from Koutiala. The women know one another well and live in large traditional families with their husbands, children, and other relatives. On average, they are 23 years old and have at least 3 children. 

This group of women sells various articles like fruits and vegetables, firewood, fabric, shea butter, etc. In order to grow their business, the members decided to join Soro Yiriwaso's loan program. This is their second group loan.

Fatoumata is a member of the Kotognogontala group. She is seated second from left to right. She sells shea butter. She would like to use her loan to buy a large quantity of shea butter in Koutiala. She will sell the shea butter at retail in her home and in the market to a diverse clientele. 

While the other group members of Kotognogontala would like to earn an average monthly profit of 100,000 FCFA during this loan cycle, Mme Fatoumata would like to earn 105,000 FCFA.  

In addition to reimbursing their loan, they will use some of their income for personal expenses and to grow their business. 

They would like to strengthen their partnership with Soro Yiriwaso so that their supplies do not run out.

loans.use: buy shea butter.

loans.name: Saodat

texts.ru: Саодат 38-летняя замужняя женщина с четырьмя детьми. Она живет в районе Шахритус. Ее дети учатся в школе. Сама Саодат вместе с мужем занимается выращиванием крупнорогатого скота для продажи. Они ведут данный бизнес в течение 4 лет. Саодат ухаживает за скотами сама, а муж занимается закупом и продажей скота, а также привозом корма для скота. Они живут скромно, но счастливо. Сейчас в их хозяйстве имеется одна корова. Саодат запрашивает кредит, чтобы приобрести еще одну корову и увеличить поголовье скота. Так она сможет увеличить доходность от деятельности.
texts.en: Saodat is a 38 year-old woman with four children.  She lives in the Shahrituz district.  Her children attend a school.  Saodat and her husband are involved in raising cattle for sale.  They have been running this business for 4 years.  Saodat takes care of livestock by herself, and her husband buys and sells livestock and also brings livestock feed.  They live modestly, but happily.  Currently, their household contains one cow.  Saodat is requesting this loan to buy another cow and increase livestock headcount.  This is how she would be able to increase her business profitability.

loans.use: to buy a cow in order to increase livestock headcount

loans.name: Warda

texts.en: Warda is a 56-year-old single lady who takes good care of two members of her beloved family. She is her family's sole breadwinner. Warda has been employed at a hospital in the archives department for thirty years. Her main aim is to be able to keep providing her family with their necessary living needs and to help them have a secure future. Warda is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to complete necessary renovations to her parents' kitchen in order to maintain a healthy living environment.

loans.use: to complete necessary renovations to her parents' kitchen in order to maintain a healthy living environment.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is married with children. She has been running her own store for one year.

Evelyn wants to borrow 10,000 PHP to buy beans, corn, rice and other grains. She knows that through the financial support that she has requested, she will be able to improve her income and re-stock her general store. 

Evelyn is hoping for a continuous smooth cash flow from her general store so that she can earn better income and cover all of her household expenditures.

loans.use: to buy beans, corn, rice and other grains

loans.name: Hermie

texts.en: Hermie, 47 years old, is married and lives in Caputol, Aloran, Misamis Occidental, Mindanao, Philippines. Hermie and her husband earn a living through farming rice, corn, vegetables, beans and root crops. She has experienced hardships in raising their family. This hard working member helps her husband plow the rice field and plant corn, vegetables, beans and root crops. Hermie decided to join Paglaum Cooperative. Hearing about all the benefits, she didn't hesitate to become a member. She has received several loans already and paid her obligations in a timely manner. Recently, Hermie requested PHP 14,900 to buy materials used for house repair. The income she earned from their farming activities will be used to pay off the loan she requested from PMPC. Being a MIGS member (Member in Good Standing) of the cooperative, she has been able to manage her income. She is able to provide for the daily needs of her family. Hermie is very thankful because if it were not for Paglaum, she might not have any savings at all nor be guided properly in her finances. She only wants to have a decent and happy life together with her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for house repair

loans.name: Anian1 Group

texts.en:
Nojoud is the featured borrower of the Anian1 group. She joined the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua because they have always been neighbours and friends.

Nojoud,  23 and single, is in the centre of the picture.The other group members, Huda and Rimonda, are on her left and right respectively.

Nojoud works as a salesperson in a bakery to cover her family's needs and her university costs. She is the sole breadwinner for four members of her family. She is working hard to finish her university education and graduate to shift to a better working domain and cover the extra needs and requests of her family.

Nojoud is taking a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua for her university tuition fees. She is very anxious about this loan and is working hard to continue developing herself and her career to make sure that she can respond to her beloved family's needs and requests.

loans.use: To cover her university tuition fees

loans.name: Afshan's Group

texts.en:
Afshan is a 30-year-old woman residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is the mother of two sons. Her husband is running a workshop out of the country. Afshan's husband is also the owner of a rickshaw that is driven by a driver who takes a monthly salary for driving the rickshaw. Currently the rickshaw is not working properly, and it requires proper maintenance to run efficiently. Its engine needs to be repaired properly so that it can work without making trouble for this purpose. Afshan's husband does not have enough money. 

Therefore Afshan has applied for a Kiva group loan with another member from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will help her husband with the expenses for the maintenance of his rickshaw to run properly and to provide better transportation services. For this financial assistance, Afshan is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair her husband's rickshaw

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel es un hombre soltero de 32 años de edad, vive junto a sus dos hijos ambos menores de edad y su pareja, la cual tienen una relación de unión de hecho, actualmente viven en el Departamento de Sololá.
Comenta que es un hombre trabajador.En la actualidad se dedica a la compraventa de ropa típica, la cual lo comercializa en el mercado local de su comunidad y en la ciudad capital. Ahora cuenta con nueve años de experiencia en este tipo de negocio, que le ha ayudado a salir adelante a su familia en cuanto a la generación de ingresos y ganancias que obtiene en la labor que realiza.
El ahora se ha dado cuenta que cada vez este producto es más rentable y es por ello que está solicitando un préstamo de Q 6,000.00 para la compra de hilos y ropa típica, para ofrecerles una gran variedad de estilos y colores a sus clientes. 
El tiene varios sueños que cumplir entre ellos está, el más importante construir su vivienda para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Miguel is a single, 32-year-old man.  He lives with his two young children and his partner, with whom he has a common-law marriage.  They currently live in the Sololá department.

Miguel describes himself as a hardworking man.  He works buying and selling traditional clothing.  He sells it in the markets in his town and also in the capital city.  He has been involved in this type of business for 9 years and it has helped him progress his family in terms of earning income.

He has become aware of the fact that his goods are becoming more profitable and for this reason is asking for an $800 loan to buy thread and traditional clothing.  In this way, he will be able to offer his customers a larger variety of styles and colors.

He has many goals, the most important of which is building a house so as to improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: buy thread and traditional clothing.

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en: Felisa is age 49, married and blessed with five children. She has been in the food vending business for almost two years. She cooks and sells daily meals as well as roams around their village to sell. In this business, she's earning a net income of 200 PHP daily. Due to insufficient funds, she would like to request a loan amounting to 8,000 PHP to purchase food ingredients and other materials needed for her food vending business. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she can improve her business and earn more profits.

loans.use: to purchase food ingredients and other materials needed for her food vending business.

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en:
Lanie is a hardworking mother, who owns and manages a variety store. Her income is in addition to her partner's income. She is 44 years old and has been blessed with seven children. She is responsible, aiming for her family to become financially stable so she can provide for their needs and give her children brighter futures.

With this goal in mind, she is asking for additional capital of PHP 5,000. She will use the loan to buy more stock to sell, including canned goods, seasonings, noodles and biscuits. Regardless of the problems and difficulties in life, she is hoping that she will be able to develop the business and make it more profitable.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell, including canned goods, seasonings, noodles and biscuits

loans.name: Martha Estela

texts.es:
Martha es una persona de 24 de edad,  con buenos principios morales.  Se dedica al los oficios domésticos de su hogar se preocupa por que su familia tenga lo necesario y estén en un ambiente limpio y agradable, tiene una experiencia de 6 años, la señora Martha carece de una formación académica ya que ella se creció con su abuela quien era una persona de la tercera edad, que adolecía de una enfermedad y  falleció. 

Su esposo,  se dedica  a la agricultura principalmente a la siembra de granos baciscos. El señor vende parte se las cosechas y de esta forma obtiene dinero para satisfacer las necesidades de su hogar. Ellos son padres de una hija que tiene dos años de edad.

El préstamo sera utilizado para la compra de una estufa, una licuadora y unos sartenes, lo que le facilitara la preparación de los alimentos a su familia. 

Ya que manifiesta que todos los días se levanta muy temprano a encendre el fuego con leña para comenzar a cocinar, cuando adquiera la cocina a gas propano se le facilitaran los procedimientos de preparación de los alimentos.


Los planes que ella tiene son los de adquirir otro crédito, para equipar su cocina de esta manera se le facilitara la preparación de los alimentos para su familia, ademas ella espera que en un futuro que su hija pueda superarse mediante el estudio y su hija sea una chef reconocida.
texts.en:
Martha is a 24-year-old woman with good moral principles.  For 6 years, she has dedicated herself to keeping up her home, ensuring that her family has what they need and that they live in a clean and pleasant environment.  She didn't have a formal education since she grew up with her grandmother who was a senior citizen.  She suffered from a disease and passed away.

Her husband works as a farmer and mostly grows basic grains.  He sells part of his harvest and in this way gains the money that they need to meet the needs of their house.  They are the parents of one daughter who is 2 years old.

This loan with be used to buy a stove, a blender, and some frying pans.  They will be used to make food for her family.

She says that she gets up very early every day to start a fire with firewood so she can start cooking.  When she gets a propane gas stove, it will make preparing food much easier.

Her plans include obtaining another loan to outfit her kitchen.  In this way, it will become easier for her to make food for her family.  In addition, she hopes that in the future her daughter will be able to get ahead by going to school and eventually become a well-known cook.

loans.use: buy a stove, a blender, and some frying pans, which will allow her to make food for her family.

loans.name: Maria Victoria

texts.es:
Maria Victoria vive en la ciudad del Cusco al Sur de Perú. Esta ciudad de muy encantadora porque tiene hermosos paisajes y porque es la capital histórica de América. 

Maria Victoria es mujer emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo de su trabajo. Su actividad económica principal es la venta de jugos y ceviche. Desde hace varios años fue invitada a participar del banco comunal “Imasumac II”  donde obtiene varios créditos y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo limon, pescado, camote, maiz, cebolla y otras más. 

Maria Victoria se siente muy agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con sus pagos de sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Maria Victoria lives in the city of Cusco in southern Peru.  The city is enchanting because it has beautiful scenery and is an historical capital of the Americas.

Maria Victoria is an entrepreneur who supports her family through her hard work.  Her main source of income is selling juices and ceviche (fish dish).  Several years ago she was invited to join the communal bank "Imasumac II" where she has received several loans.  On this occasion she is requesting a loan to buy supplies such as lemon, fish, sweet potato, corn, onion and other items.

She is very grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy supplies such as lemon, fish, sweet potato, corn, onion, etc.

loans.name: Maria De La Cruz

texts.es: Maria tiene 23 años de edad. Es originaria de la ciudad de Chinandega. Es una joven casada, estudia en una de las universidades de la ciudad. Ella a pesar de su escaso recurso económico ha salido adelante con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación, logrando así sus metas propuestas. Su familia la apoya de igual manera ya que comparte el sueño de ver a su hija como una profesional completa. Solicita el crédito para pagar sus módulos de finalización de estudios. Su plan futuro es conseguir un empleo en donde pueda aplicar sus conocimientos adquiridos.
texts.en:
Maria, 23, is from the city of Chinandega.  She is married and studies at one of the city universities.  Despite having a low income she has been able to get ahead through much hard work and dedication, and has achieved the goals she set for herself.  Her family also supports her because they share the dream of seeing her become a full professional.

She is requesting a loan to pay the graduation course fees.  Her plan for the future is to get a job and apply the knowledge she has acquired.

loans.use: To pay graduation course fees.

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es:
Guadalupe vive en la ciudad del Cusco al Sur de Perú. Esta ciudad de muy encantadora porque tiene hermosos paisajes y porque es la capital histórica de América. 

Guadalupe es mujer emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo de su trabajo. Su actividad económica principal es la elaboración de artesanía, ella sigue pintando cuadro de diferentes paisajes. Desde hace varios años fue invitada a participar del banco comunal “Imasumac II” donde obtiene varios créditos y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de trabajo como acuarelas, pínceles, pinturas y otras cosas más. 

Guadalupe se siente muy agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con sus pagos de sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Guadalupe lives in the city of Cusco in southern Peru.  The city is very enchanting because it has beautiful scenery and is an historic capital of the Americas.

Guadalupe is an entrepreneur who supports her family through her hard work.  Her main source of income is craft work since she continues to paint pictures of different landscapes.  Several years ago she was invited to join the communal bank "Imasumac II" where she has obtained several loans.  On this occasion, she is requesting a loan to buy supplies for her work such as water color paints, brushes, and other items.

Guadalupe is very grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: to buy materials for her work, for example brushes, paints, and other items.

loans.name: Djekafo Group

texts.fr:
Djekafo est un regroupement de femmes de Koutiala du quartier Hamdallaye de Koutiala  qui vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 28 ans et ont au moins 4 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels que, Savons, Bois de chauffage, Tissus,  la restauration etc. Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso pour la première fois. 
Aichatou qui a l'enfant sur le pied, est la restauratrice du groupe. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter du Haricot, des paquets de spaghetti, des condiments nécessaire à la restauration. Elle se procure de ces Haricots, spaghetti  et condiments   au à Koutiala et les préparer afin de les vendre dans son restaurant à une clientèle diverse. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Djekafo comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 90 000CFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Mme Aichatou compte réaliser  105 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnelles et augmenter son fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
Djekafo is a group of women from the Hamdallaye district of Koutiala.  They all live in large, traditional families with their husbands, children and other family members.  The women are, on average, twenty-eight years old, and have at least four children.

The members of the group sell various products, such as soap, firewood, fabric and food.  The group have now decided to work with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso, in order to increase the size of their businesses.

Aichatou (sitting with her child in the photo) works in her restaurant business.  She will use her loan to buy beans, packets of spaghetti and other ingredients needed to prepare her food for sale.  She buys these supplies in Koutiala, and then prepares them for sale in her restaurant, to a varied range of customers.

While the other members of the group expect to earn an average of 90,000 francs CFA a month, Aichatou expects to earn 105,000 francs CFA.  She will use her earnings to repay her loan, provide for her personal expenses and increase her working capital.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Youssouph

texts.fr: Youssouph était un électricien auto,habite au sud du Sénégal âgé 20 ans célibataire,avec la rareté des clients dans son métier,il préfère se lancer dans le transport,depuis 2ans.Youssouph avec le transport moto taxi,il parvient à épargner 2500fcfa par jour dans l'ambition d'avoir une grande entreprise de transport avant de marier une femme.
texts.en:
Youssouph is twenty years old, single and lives in the south of Senegal.  

He is a vehicle electrician by profession but, due to a lack of customers in his trade, he started a transport business two years ago.  Working as a motorbike taxi driver, he can save up to 2,500 francs CFA a day.  

He intends to use this money to build up a large transport business before he marries a woman.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for his taxi business.

loans.name: Hamady

texts.fr:
Âgé de 21 ans, cet emprunteur s’appelle Hamady, il est jeune et ambitieux et s’active dans le petit commerce de tissus. D’ailleurs c’est un grand commençant qui n’a besoin que de 50.000F CFA pour acheter deux variétés de tissus à la mode. Hamady est célibataire et libre de voyager un peu partout pour chercher de quoi vendre et avoir un bénéfice. Il se prend en charge et appuie aussi ses parents dans la dépense quotidienne
Hamady pense faire de cette activité une simple transition, car son vœu le plus cher est de faire du transport et il pense pouvoir y arriver grâce à l’appui de l’IMCEC.
texts.en:
Hamady is twenty-one years old, young and ambitious.  He works selling fabric.  He needs only 50,000 francs CFA in order to buy two types of fabric which are very popular.

Hamady is single, and therefore, free to travel in order to find good products to sell to make a profit.  He provides for all his personal expenses and also helps his parents with their day-to-day expenses.

Hamady would like to use his business to build up enough funds to achieve his ambition of establishing a transport business.  He believes that he can do this with the help of the field partner, UIMCEC.

loans.use: to buy various fabrics for resale.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
This is Theresa, 62, resident of Malibay, Pasay, Philippines. She is married to Benedicto, her business partner, and has children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Theresa operates a bakery. Breads and spreads are staples in Filipino cuisine and are mostly used for breakfast and snacks. The most popular type of bread is Pandesal, a Filipino version of the Spanish Pan de Sal or salted bread. It is baked during the wee hours of the morning and sold steaming hot to early commuters, students and workers. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue the operation of her business, she is requesting a PHP 12,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy raw supplies like flour, sugar, and butter, which she needs to continue production and expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business. 

Theresa dreams of having a bigger bakery and hopes that her children will have a good future. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for ingredients to make bread.

loans.name: Nyushulira Group

texts.fr: Muselemu est une femme dynamique, présidente du groupe de credit Nyushulira. Elle est âgée de 53 ans, mère de 5 enfants scolarisés  et mariée à un homme sans emploie.  Elle sollicite le nouveau credit pour acheter 35 tôles qu’elle revendra a son tour.  Elle souhaite prospérer dans ses affaires et construire une maison familiale. Ainsi, elle remercie et bénie Hekima.
texts.en:
Muselemu is a dynamic woman who is the president of the loan group, Nyushulira.  She is fifty-three years old, married and has five children who all attend school.  Muselemu's husband is currently out of work.  

She has requested this loan in order to buy 35 metal sheets which she will resell.

Muselemu would like to succeed in her business and be able to build a house for her family.  She is grateful to the field partner, Hekima for their help with her ambition and she blesses their work.

loans.use: to buy 35 metal sheets for resale.

loans.name: Nshobole Group

texts.fr: Sifa, femme entrepreneur est présidente du groupe de credit  Nsobole. Mariée à  un homme sans emploie à l’âge à de 35 ans, elle est mère de 8 enfants  tous scolarisés. Elle sollicite ce nouveau crédit pour acheter 3 sacs de farine de maniocs de 100kgs. Son objectif est de construire une maison pour sa famille et agrandir son entreprise.  Elle remercie Hekima  de soutenir les femmes entrepreneurs.
texts.en:
Sifa is a woman entrepreneur who is the president of the loan group, Nsobole.  She is thirty-five years old, married and mother to eight children who all attend school.  Her husband is currently out of work.

Sifa will use her loan to buy 3 sacks of 100kgs of cassava flour for resale.  Her ambition is to build a house for her family and expand her business.

She is grateful to the field partner, Hekima for the support that they offer to women entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy 3 sacks of 100kgs of cassava flour for resale.

loans.name: Buyunvikane Group

texts.fr: La cliente Mutalegwa  est vice-présidente de la banque villageoise Buyunvikane. A 52 ans, elle mariée à un homme sans emploie et ensemble ils ont 5 enfants qui vont tous à l’école. Elle sollicite un nouveau crédit pour acheter 5 sacs de maniocs. Ainsi, elle souhaite  devenir fournisseur de manioc dans les marchés publics. Elle remercie Hekima d’avoir facilité la scolarité de ses enfants au travers le bénéfice de son credit.
texts.en:
Mutalegwa is the vice-president of the 'banc villageois' Buyunvikane.  She is fifty-two years old, married and has five children who all attend school.  Her husband is currently out of work.

Mutalegwa has requested this new loan in order to buy five sacks of cassavas, which she will use to become a cassava supplier at the public markets.

She is grateful to the field partner, Hekima, for having enabled the schooling of her children, through their loan system.

loans.use: to buy 5 sacks of cassavas for resale.

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Srey is a hardworking person and an experienced farmer from Prey Chhor district, Kampong Cham province. She is 44 years old, married and has four children. As other villagers, Srey is dedicated to the farming business, growing rice as her major source of income. She has been in this field for more than 20 years and earns a decent income.

Though Srey is a farmer with a small income, she would like to focus on improving sanitation practices for her entire household. Due to insufficient capital, she has requested a loan to build a hygienic latrine and a bathroom for the sake of her family members. Thanks to the water loan program with a special rate offered by Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL), Srey is encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions to safeguard the health of her family and to protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine for the sake of her family members.

loans.name: Rasheeda

texts.en: Rasheeda is 48 years old. She is a housewife and looks after her family consisting of five persons. She is well trained in cloth stitching. She provides services in stitching to the people at her own house. She needs to purchase a sewing machine and a variety of stitching material for the shop, including thread, needles, clothing, etc. This is very important for her to continue her work efficiently and professionally. However, due to the lack of money she finds it difficult, so she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan. Brac Pakistan issued her loan as per her requirement. Rasheeda is very thankful to Kiva partner Brac Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy stitching related items like clothes, thread, cotton, a sewing machine, etc.

loans.name: Kean

texts.en:
Kean is a 36-year-old man from a remote area of Prasat Bakong, Siem Reap province. He's married and his wife works in agriculture, as does he. This couple has three children who still depend on their income and are going to school. With a great effort and hard work, they are able to provide them with daily meals and send them to school.

Kean would like to improve his living standard by having clean energy for household use. Because of the lack of capital, he is asking for a loan in the sum of 250 USD to build a small biogas digester, under the project of NBP (National Biogas Program) in partnering with HKL. After an initial investment in this system, he hopes that he won’t spend much money on fuel and will lessen the smoke from wood or charcoal. He is very happy and thankful, because with this kind of loan product, HKL has offered a special interest rate better than its general loans. He awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to build a small biogas digester.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en: Nora is 43 years old and married with four children. The couple are both hardworking, responsible and full of hope in life. Nora is involved in the hog raising and farming business. Nowadays, she raises two pigs. Nora hopes that she can increase the number of pigs she raises someday. With her determination to get ahead in life and improve her hog raising business, she decided to ask for a loan of PHP 5,000. She will use this amount of loan to buy hog feed and a pig. She believes that this amount of loan has much to do with the development of her business and income someday.

loans.use: to buy hog feed and a pig in order to increase the number of pigs she raises

loans.name: Nela

texts.en:
Nela is from Aloran, Misamis Occidental, Mindanao, Philippines. She is 42 years old and is married. From her desire to send her son to college, she works in the service crew in a fast food house.

Nela joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in the year 2011 and she appreciates the programs, services and continuous education of the co-op. She is a member in good standing and very active in attending the various programs and services that the Cooperative offers.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 14,900. This loan is intended to pay for the college tuition fee of her son and the daily wage she gets from the fast food house shall be used to pay off the loan she requested from the PMPC.

Nela dreams of nothing more than to have a happy, healthy life and be able to send all her children to college.

loans.use: to pay for college tuition fee

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia, 40 years old, is married and lives in Caputol, Aloran, Misamis Occidental, Mindanao, Philippines.

Nelia and her husband earn a living through farming. She has experienced hardships in raising their family. This industrious member helps her husband plowing the rice field and planting vegetables and other varieties of agricultural commodities.

Nelia decided to join Paglaum Cooperative. Hearing all the benefits she didn't hesitate to become a member. She has received several loans already and paid her obligations in a timely manner. Recently, Nelia requested PHP 14,900 to buy materials to use for house repair. The income she earns from their farming activities shall be used to pay off the loan she requested from PMPC

Being a MIGS member (Member in Good Standing) of the cooperative, she has been able to manage her income. She is able to provide for the daily needs of her family. Nelia is very thankful because if it were not for Paglaum, she might not have any savings at all nor be guided properly in her finances. She hopes to own a land tractor someday for their rice field.

loans.use: to buy materials to use for house repair

loans.name: Mariafe

texts.en:
Mariafe joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in the year 2012, and she appreciates the programs, services, and continuous education from the co-op. She is a member in good standing and very active in attending the various programs and services that the Cooperative offers. 

She has had a rice retail business for a good number of years. Mariafe is requesting a loan in the amount of 3,000 PHP. This loan will be used to buy rice for retail sales. 

Mariafe dreams of nothing more than to have a happy, healthy life and an adequate income from her business.

loans.use: to buy rice to sell.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is from Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 54 years old and is married with eight kids.

Carmelita applied for membership with PMPC this year. After hearing about all the benefits, she did not hesitate to become a member. She maintains the status of being a member in good standing and repays her obligations in a timely manner.

Recently, Carmelita asked for financial assistance of 5,000 PHP to expand her banana production. With this loan, she hopes to increase her income and expand her business.  

She has found assistance for her financial needs through Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative, and she is very thankful with all her heart.

loans.use: to expand her banana production

loans.name: Marhabo

texts.en:
Marhabo was born in 1976 and is married with three children. She is a smart, kind, and higher-educated woman.

Her son, Afzal, is a student. Her daughters, Nigina and Surayo, are schoolgirls. Marhabo is a careful mother of her children. 

She graduated from Khujand State University and is an accountant. She has worked for more than 20 years and works for a state organization. 

Marhabo always works for the well-being of her children. She must pay for her son's tuition, so she is asking for a loan of $700. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to pay for her son's tuition fees.

loans.name: Adama's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupement est composé de femmes très engagées qui ont su développer depuis la création du banc villageois le 25 novembre 2003 en plus des activités génératrices de revenues essentiellement tournées vers le petit commerce, de bonnes relations  basées sur la solidarité et l’entre aide.

Madame Adama (debout à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est âgée de 35 ans, mariée et mère de deux garçons. Elle est vendeuse de sucre, d’huile de palme, et de pâte d’arachide qu’elle achète en gros pour la revente au détail. Elle a une bonne expérience de cette activité pour l’avoir fait pendant plus de cinq ans. 

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter un sac de sucre de 50 Kg et un seau de 20 Kg de pâte d’arachide pour la revente.

Ses bénéfices lui permettront de mieux se prendre en charge d’une part et d’autre part acheter des habilles pour ses deux garçons.
texts.en:
This group is made up of very committed women who have, since the creation of the Banc Villageois on 25th November 2003, managed to develop not only income generating activities - primarily small trading businesses -  but also good relations based on solidarity and mutual help. 

Adama (who is standing on the far right of the photo with her hand raised) is the star borrower of the group. She is 35 years old, married and mother to two boys. She sells sugar, palm oil and groundnut paste, which she buys wholesale to sell on retail. She has good experience in this business as she has been doing it for more than five years.

With he new loan she is planning to buy a 50kg sack of sugar and a 20kg bucket of groundnut paste to resell.

Her profits will on the one hand enable to provide for herself more easily, and on the other to buy clothes for her two boys.

loans.use: to buy a 50kg sack of sugar and a 20kg bucket of groundnut paste to resell.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
La socia Norma se  sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de granos secos como maiz,la socia tambien vende papa y habas,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los granos secos.La socia solicita el credito para comprar habas,papa y maiz.


La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito que le otorgarán y de este modo podrá  mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Norma continues working in her business selling dried grains such as corn. She also sells potatoes and beans. She works from 8:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m. She has had this business for several years and it is going well for her. Her dream is to have a locale where she can sell the dried grains. She is asking for the loan to buy beans, potatoes and corn.

She values and is very grateful for the loan she will be given. In this way she will improve her quality of life. She is also committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy beans, potatoes and corn.

loans.name: Aissatou Commandan's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupement est composé de femmes très engagées qui ont su développer depuis la création du banc villageois le 25 novembre 2003 en plus des activités génératrices de revenues essentiellement tournées vers le petit commerce, de bonnes relations  basées sur la solidarité et l’entre aide.

Madame Aïssatou (assise à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette de ce groupe. Elle est âgée 44 ans, elle est mariée et mère  de cinq enfants dont trois garçons et deux filles. Elle s’active dans la vend de fruits selon les saisons. Elle achète sa marchandise soit chez le producteur le cas de la banane ou auprès d’intermédiaires pour les produits qui ne sont pas cultivés dans la zone.

Son nouveau prêt lui permettra d’acheter une dizaine de caisses de banane et divers fruits pour la revente au détail et par tas.

Elle compte avec les bénéfices réfectionner sa maison et accroître ses têtes de petits ruminants.
texts.en:
