This group is made up of very committed women who have, since the creation of the Banc Villageois on 25th November 2003, managed to develop not only income generating activities - primarily small trading businesses -  but also good relations based on solidarity and mutual help. 

Aïssatou (who is sitting on the far right of the photo with her hand raised) is the star borrower of the group. She is 44 years old, married and mother to five children: three boys and two girls. She sells seasonal fruits and buys her goods either from farmers, in the case of bananas, or from intermediaries in the case of products which are not grown in the area. 

With her new loan she is planning to buy ten crates of bananas and other fruits to resell on a retail basis and by heap.

She is planning to use her profits to refurbish her house and increase.the number of her animals.

loans.use: to buy ten crates of bananas and other fruits to resell on a retail basis and by heap.

loans.name: Hamoule's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est composé de femmes très actives dans leurs activités génératrices de revenu et dans la vie de leur banc villageois  qui a été créé le  14 Octobre 2010. Elles sont toutes issues du même village et ont une bonne entente entre elles. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce et l’agriculture sous pluie.

Madame Hamoulé (assise à l’extrême droite avec la main droite levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe,  âgée de 30 ans, elle est mariée et mère de cinq enfants  (03 garçons et 02 filles. Elle achète des graines d’arachides auprès de producteurs dans les villages pour la revendre aux commerçants dans les marchés hebdomadaires.

Avec ce prêt elle compte acheter au moins 15 sacs de graines d’arachide fait le tri pour la revente.

Les bénéfices de son activité lui permettront de soutenir son époux dans la scolarité des enfants et la nourriture.
texts.en:
This group is made up of women who are very active in their income-generating businesses and their Banc Villageois, which was set up on 14th October 2010. They all come from the same village and get on well together. Their main activities are small trading businesses and farming in the rain.

Hamoulé (who is sitting on the far right of the photo with her right hand raised) is the star borrower of the group. She is 30 years old, married and mother to five children (three boys and two girls). She buys groundnut seeds from farmers in the villages and sells them to traders at the weekly markets.

With this loan she is planning to buy at least 15 sacks of groundnut seeds to sort out and resell.

The profits from her business will enable her to help out her husband to pay for their children's school fees and food.

loans.use: to buy at least 15 sacks of groundnut seeds to sort out and resell.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica is 59 years old with three children. She presently resides at Gotocan Diot, Ozamis City. Monica has a sari-sari store (convenience store) business. She has requested a loan in the amount of 15,000 PHP to buy a variety of goods and products to sell in her store. Monica hopes to save more money for her future.

loans.use: to buy a variety of goods and products to sell in her store.

loans.name: Rosayde

texts.es:
Rosayde vive en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco ubicado al sur de Perú.  Ella es una mujer emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo y dedicación de su trabajo. Su actividad económica principal es brindar servicio turístico pues ella vende paquetes turísticos a diferentes lugares del Cusco como por ejemplo al Valle Sagrado del los Incas, Machupicchu y Choquerirao. Ella pertenece al banco comunal "Cusco" desde hace varios años y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar boletos turísticos. 

Rosayde se siente contenta por el préstamo y se compromete a pagar las cuotas puntuales y con mucha responsabilidad. Agradece a todos los inversionistas por el préstamo y desea que sigan apoyando a los demás proyectos.
texts.en:
Rosayde lives in the beautiful city of Cuzco, located in southern Peru. She is an enterprising woman who gets her family ahead with hard work and dedication to her work. Her main economic activity is offering a tourism service. She sells tourism packages to different places in Cuzco, such as Valle Sagrado del los Incas, Machupicchu and Choquerirao. She has belonged to the "Cuzco" communal bank for several years and at this time she needs the loan to buy tourist tickets.  

Rosayde is happy with the loan and committed to making her payments on time and very responsibly. She is grateful to the investors for the loan and would like for them to keep supporting the other projects.

loans.use: to buy tourist tickets.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel previously accessed an 8,000 PHP loan that she used to buy more raw ingredients such as hamburger, noodles, coffee and other food staples. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 8,000 PHP loan for her to purchase raw ingredients such as hamburger, noodles, coffee and other food staples. Her profits from her business will definitely help sustain her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Isabel dreams to be more successful in business and hopes that her family will always be in good health. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients such as hamburger, noodles, coffee and other food staples.

loans.name: Melida

texts.es:
Melida es una mujer emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo y dedicación de su trabajo. Melida es profesora y enseña en uno de los colegios más populares de la ciudad del Cusco. Ella pertenece al banco comunal "Cusco" desde hace varios años y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para pagar las matriculas de sus hijos. 

Melida se siente contenta por el préstamo y se compromete a pagar las cuotas puntuales y con mucha responsabilidad. Agradece a todos los inversionistas por el préstamo y desea que sigan apoyando a los demás proyectos.
texts.en:
Melida's an enterprising woman who gets her family ahead with her effort and dedication to her job.  She teaches in one of the most popular schools in the city of Cusco.

Melida has belonged to Cusco Communal Bank for several years.  She needs the current loan to pay her children's tuition.

Melida's happy about the loan and promises to make her payments punctually and responsibly.  She's grateful to the lenders for the loan and hopes they'll continue to support the other projects.

loans.use: to pay her children's tuition

loans.name: Rosmeri

texts.es:
La socia Rosmery se dedica al negocio de venta de materiales de construccion como ladrillos,cementos y blouqetas,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio venta de materiales de construccion.La socia solicita el credito para comprar cemento,ladrillos y bloquetas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Our member Rosmeri sells building materials such as bricks, cement and breezeblocks between 8am and 5pm.  She has been running her business for several years and is doing very well.  Her dream is to expand her building materials business.  She is seeking a loan to buy cement, bricks and breezeblocks.  She is delighted to receive the loan and guarantees that she will pay it back in full.

loans.use: to buy cement, bricks and breezeblocks.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
La socia Paulina pertenece al banco comunal LAS HORMIGUITAS, él banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Paulina tiene 37 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 4 hijos, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de materiales de construcción, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de ladrillos, cementó entre otros para su negocio.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en: Paulina is a member of the LAS HORMIGUITAS communal bank, which is located in the district of Cusco in the province and department of the same name.  Paulina is 37 years old and lives with her partner and 4 children.  She alternates her daily chores with running her building materials business.  She has been running the business for some time now and it is doing well thanks to the commitment Paulina puts into it each day.  Paulina is a responsible and dedicated person as this is her means of supporting her family. She is seeking the loan to buy bricks and cement, among other things, for her business. She is grateful for the loan she has been granted and guarantees that she will repay it in full.

loans.use: to buy bricks and cement etc. for her business.

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es: la señor rosa elena tiene un negocio de venta de ropa en el mercado desde hace 3 años , trabaja de lunes a domingo desde las  ocho de la mañana a cuatro de la tarde, se esfuerza por sacar adelante el sustengo de su hogar, es casada, madre de un niño, empezo en un negocio como ayudante de venta, posteriormente decidio ahorrar para poner su propio negocio, solicita el financiamiento para compra de mercaderia para su negocio como ropa escolar, con el fin de aprovechar las mejores ventas en el producto escolar y obtener ganancias en el mes de enero y febrero.
texts.en: Rosa Elena has had a business selling clothes in the market for the past three years. She works Monday to Sunday from eight in the morning to four in the afternoon. She makes an effort to sustain and improve her household. She is married and the mother to one young boy. She began in the business as a sales assistant, and later decided to save in order to set up her own business. She is requesting this loan in order to buy merchandise for her business, such as school clothes, with the goal of taking advantage of school product sales and making money in January and February.

loans.use: to buy school skirts, white blouses, camisoles, socks, and undergarments

loans.name: Kamsat

texts.en: Kamsat is 35 years old and a married man with two children in Oudong, Kampong Speu Province. He is a construction laborer and his wife is a farmer. Both of them can earn $7 per day. He would like to apply for loan of $1,200 to buy cows to do farming. This loan will help him in farming and bring his family a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy cows to do farming.

loans.name: Aracely De Jesus

texts.es: Aracely de 29 años de edad es una joven de escasos recursos económicos, labora en un hospedaje como recepcionista devengando un salario mínimo, con lo que se apoya para pagar sus estudios universitarios, la carrera de promoción social y humana del cual está en la etapa final, por lo que solicita del apoyo de crédito para poder pagar el curso de titulación, siendo su objetivo con esta profesión servir a la sociedad y superase económicamente.
texts.en: 29-year-old Aracely is an economically disadvantage young woman.  She works as a receptionist in a hotel, earning the minimum wage, which she uses to pay for her university studies. She is in the final year of her social and human promotion course and so she is seeking this loan to pay for her degree course, as her ambition in her profession is to serve society and get by financially.

loans.use: to pay for her degree course.

loans.name: Aristides

texts.es: Aristides vive en la ciudad de Cusco al sur de Perú y continúa participando en el banco comunal “Imasumac II”. Su actividad económica principal es la elaboración de artesanía y cuando no alcanza tiempo compra artesanía. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para la compra de mercadería como cerámicas. Se siente agradecido por el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Aristides lives in the city of Cusco, in the south of Peru, and continues to participate in the communal bank "Imasumac II." His main economic activity is the production of artisan work and when there isn't enough time to make it, he buys merchandise from others. It's now been several years that he has been working in this business and it is going quite well for him.
He needs the loan to buy merchandise such as ceramics. He is grateful for the loan given to him and is committed to making his payments as established.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as ceramics.

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en: Cheryl lives with her husband and her four children. They all work and struggle each day for their well-being. Cheryl owns a store, an activity which she does from 6:00 am to 10:00 pm. She has had this kind of business for one year. The loan amount she is requesting will allow her to buy basic foods such as beans, corn, rice, sugar, oil, salt, and sweets to re-stock her general store. She hopes to obtain her requested loan amount in order to achieve her dream in life which is to have her own house to live in.

loans.use: to buy beans, corn, rice, sugar, oil, salt, and sweets for her general store.

loans.name: Vy

texts.en:
Vy, age 35, is an experienced farmer of Trapeang Svay village, Siem Reap province. The village is one of the remote communities in the Svay Leu district. She and her spouse, Chhum, together raise their two children by cultivating rice on one and a half hectare of farmland in their village. Having been in this field for nearly 15 years, they can earn a daily income of USD 4.50.

This will be her fifth loans with HKL and the first with Kiva. Vy aims to use the loan to buy a solar home system to install on the roof of her house, which is located in the off-grid area of the province. After this initial investment, Vy will be able to gain access to clean energy, which she will use to support household appliances such as light, black-and-white TV and radio so everyone in her family can work or study at night. She is very thankful to all lenders in advance.

loans.use: to buy a solar home system.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
Carolina is 44 years old, married and a resident of Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She earns a living through snack vending. 

She has been a member of PMPC for six years and enjoys the privileges being a member of the Cooperative. Now, she is applying for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy ingredients for her snack vending business.

Carolina deeply wishes to continue as a member in good standing with PMPC.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her snack vending business.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel previously accessed a 40,000 PHP loan that she used to buy additional merchandise like children's, men's and women's clothing. Her earnings were a big help in her family's personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 47,000 PHP loan to buy additional merchandise like children's, men's and women's clothing. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Maricel dreams to be more successful in business and hopes to have a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week. She also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional merchandise like children's, men's and women's clothing.

loans.name: Manal

texts.en:
Manal is a 41-year-old married mother of four children. She is a hard worker who decided a year ago to start her own business to help her husband in covering their precious children's increasing living and education needs.

Manal's work is mobile. She visits customers' houses and businesses to present her products for them in a well-managed way. She sells home products specialized in cooking needs. Today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to increase her business merchandise with special offer products that will increase her business capital and income at the same time, in addition to attracting customers' attention to newly released products and create an urgent need for such products.

Manal is an ambitious lady who is working hard to open a wide home products sales shop that includes a wide variety of all kitchen ware needs.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with special offer products that will increase her business capital and income at the same time, in addition to attracting customers' attention to newly released products and create an urgent need for such products.

loans.name: Mehrubon

texts.en: Mehrubon was born in the year 1979. She is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a business man. She also wants to have her own income and is going to organize her own business. She took part in a competition, ‘The Best Business Plan,’ organized by National Association Business Women. She is a very smart woman. Mehrubon is going to open a kindergarten and she wrote her business plan.  Now, she needs money because she must repair the building of her kindergarten and buy beds, tables and chairs.  She is asking for a loan of 3500 USD with this aim. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To repair the building of her kindergarten and to buy beds, tables and chairs

loans.name: Anacleta

texts.es:
Anacleta vive en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco y donde realiza sus actividades económicas, ella es una madre trabajadora que saca adelante a su familia que se dedica a brindar servicio de transportes, ella tiene un automóvil que lo hace trabajar con otras personas. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para hacer mantenimiento del carro. 

Anacleta agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Anacleta lives and works in the beautiful city of Cusco.  She's a hardworking mother who gets her family ahead.

Anacleta earns a living providing transportation services with a car that other people drive for her.  She needs this loan to perform maintenance on her car.

Anacleta's grateful for the loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to perform maintenance on her car

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en: Elvie is 43 years old, married with 3 children, and lives at Lower, Lamac, Oroquieta City Misamis Occidental, Mindanao: Philippines. From her desire to help the family, she raises pigs in their backyard while her husband is a tricycle driver. Raising pigs is a good business; aside from having earnings, she also enjoys doing it. Elvie is in her 2nd year with PMPC. Now, she requests a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy sacks of feed for her pigs. She really hopes and prays that her business will grow and benefit her family, in addition to the income of her husband. Someday, she wants to build a concrete pig cage to easily keep more sanitary conditions, and she also wants to generate more savings for future needs.

loans.use: to buy sacks of feed for her pigs

location.town: Oroquieta-Lower Lamac, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occ

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es: Doña María Teresa es originaria de la ciudad de León, casada y madre de 4 hijos ya independientes. Tiene 52 años de edad. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de Gaseosas y Refrescos. Inicio su negocio hace 10 años con la ayuda de su madre quien le enseño todo lo que sabe hasta el día de hoy. Su meta próxima es incrementar sus ventas. Solicita el crédito para la compra de: Gaseosas, Jugos, Galletas, Rines, Picos, Panes dulces en general, Variedad de frutas, entre otros. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que podrá brindar una amplia variedad de bebidas a sus clientes. Su plan futuro es mejorar las condiciones del local donde atiende para que sus clientes se sientan cómodos.
texts.en: María Teresa, who hails from the city of Léon, is married and has 4 independent children.  She is 52 years old and is a shopkeeper, selling fizzy and soft drinks. She set up her business 10 years ago with the help of her mother, who taught her everything she knows today. Her next goal is to boost her sales. She is applying for this loan to buy:  fizzy drinks, fruit juices, biscuits, pork rinds, bread sticks, pastries in general and a range of fruits among other things. She believes that the loan will be very useful in enabling her to offer her customers a wide range of drinks. Her plan for the future is to improve the condition of her premises so that her customers will feel more comfortable.

loans.use: to buy fizzy drinks, fruit juices, biscuits, pork rinds, bread sticks, pastries in general and a range of fruits among other things.

loans.name: Hanaa

texts.en:
Hanaa is a 50-year-old married mother of four children. She has been working as a hairdresser since 2007. She used to work as a tutor, but she was seeking a stable business with continuity; that's why she established her current beauty salon to develop her career and improve her family's living through providing her beloved husband with the necessary financial support to satisfy their needs.

Hanaa is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with special beauty products, and to support her newly established bed-shields-selling business with a newly released collection to attract new customers.

Today, both businesses are located at her salon. She is working hard to develop both of them equally in order to establish separate businesses in the future and run them perfectly.

loans.use: To increase her business merchandise with special beauty products, and to support her newly established bed shields business with a newly released collection to attract new customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tuition fees

loans.name: María Nieves

texts.es:
La Señora María forma parte del grupo de crédito 10 de Agosto desde hace 12 años, en todo este tiempo ha llegado a tener muy buenas amigas con quienes comparte sus momentos buenos y malos. Vive en la parroquia de Santa Ana en Cuenca, su arquitectura es una mezcla de lo antiguo y lo moderno, su gente es de un corazón cálido y aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.
La Señora María tiene 70 años de edad, es viuda pero en su unión conyugal ha concebido 6 hijos mayores de edad que están casados y viven independientes, la casa en la que vive es  propia.
Doña 	María se dedica a lavar ropa ajena, cría ganado, cuyes, pollos y también se dedica a cuidar de sus nietos. El dinero de su crédito es para comprar pollos, cuyes y alimento para animales. Su sueño es continuar con sus animales y mantener su salud.
texts.en:
María, 70, has belonged to 10 de Agosto Communal Bank for 12 years.  In all this time she has come to have very good friends, with whom she shares her good and bad times.  She lives in the parish of Santa Ana in Cuenca, where the architecture is a mix of ancient and modern and the warm-hearted people still preserve the culture and traditions of their communities.

María's a widow but has six adult children from her marriage; all of them are married and live on their own.  She lives in her own house.

María makes a living washing clothes for people and raising livestock, guinea pigs, and chickens.  She also takes care of her grandchildren.

Her loan is to buy chickens, guinea pigs, and animal feed.

María dreams of continuing with her animals and staying healthy.

loans.use: to buy chickens, guinea pigs, and animal feed

loans.name: Saroem

texts.en: Saroem is 34 years old. She is a married woman of one child in Oudong, Kampong Speu Province. She is a factory laborer, and her husband is a mechanic. Both of them can earn $10 per day. She would like to apply for a loan of $1,500 for buying drinks to sell at home. This loan will help her in opening up a small business at home, as well as in bringing her family a better life.

loans.use: to buy drinks to sell at home

loans.name: Richard Augusto

texts.es: Richard vive en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco y donde realiza sus actividades económicas. El socio se dedica a la reparar autos pues tiene su taller en su domicilio. Desde hace varios años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien pero al transcurrir de los años los clientes aumentaron entonces necesita de más herramientas de trabajo entonces un grupo de amigos le invitaron para participar del banco comunal “Imasumac II” donde él se presta dinero y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar repuestos como por ejemplo llantas, culatas, pistones y entre otras cosas más, él agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Richard lives and works in the beautiful city of Cusco.  The member works repairing cars in a repair shop that he has in his house.  He has been doing this work for many years, and it has gone well.  However, as the years passed his customer base expanded, and he needed more tools to work.  His friends invited him to join the "Imasumac II" communal bank, where he could receive loans.

At the moment, he needs a loan to purchase spare parts such as: tires, cylinder heads, pistons, and others.  He is thankful for the support he has received, and he is committed to complying with the repayment schedule.

loans.use: purchase spare parts such as: tires, cylinder heads, pistons and others.

loans.name: Lei

texts.en:
Lei is a 38-year-old widowed woman with 3 children and lives in Kampong Speu Province. 

She is a farmer and two of her children are construction laborers. All of them earn $9 per day. 

She would like to apply for loan of $800 USD to buy a motorbike. This loan will help her family to reduce travelling expenses as well as provide her family with a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy education equipment

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John's transport is doing well and he has managed to repay his first loan before the due date. He has also managed to extend financial support to his elderly mother as well as his two brothers. He was informed about Vision Fund by a loan officer.

John has been advanced a 2nd loan of Kes 50,000, which he will use to support his wife's tailoring business. He intends to use the proceeds to tend to the extended family's needs as well as repay the loan. He hopes to educate his brother to higher levels of learning

loans.use: to support wife's business

loans.name: Margarit

texts.en:
Margarit is an agronomist from Taronik village. She lives there with her husband and 12 year-old daughter. Together with her husband, Margarit is involved in agriculture. She cultivates peppers, eggplant and some watermelon. The gathered harvest is sold in local open markets and the family gets income which is vital for its living. 
Now, Margarit has applied for this loan to purchase cucumber seeds and materials for improving the greenhouse. The loan will be a huge support for her farming business and she will be able to cultivate more types of vegetables in repaired greenhouse.
Margarit and her family hope for your support.

loans.use: to pay for cucumber seeds andmaterials for improving the greenhouse

loans.name: Dilafruz

texts.en:
Dilafruz was born in 1983 and  is married with 4 children. Dilafruz lives in a small village of the North part of Tajikistan. 

She has been busy raising animals for more than 7 years. She began her business  with the support of her mother-in-low. She runs her business well. She is the main provider for her children because her husband is a migrant worker in Russia.

She is going to increase the number cattle that she feeds. She asks for 2,000 TJS to buy cattle. 

Dilafruz awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy cattle to increase the number of cattle that she raises.

loans.name: Barrack

texts.en:
Barrack is a 38-year-old man with 6 children between the ages of 13 and 20 . 

He describes himself as humble. He operates a retail shop to sell cooking fat, bread, wheat flour, juices and other items. He has been involved in this business for 12 years. His business is located in an urban area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be late payments from his customers.

He will use 70,000 KES to buy cement, sand, pipes and other materials to build a septic tank for his family's home and rental houses that he owns. 

His business goal is to buy a piece of land and build more rental houses within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will be prosperous. This is his sixth loan with SMEP DTM. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, pipes and other materials to build a septic tank.

loans.name: Pao

texts.en:
Pao, age 41, is a married woman and a responsible mother of three children.  They are employed as garment workers in Phnom Penh. She describes herself as a humble person who operates a rice farm as her major source of income. She has been involved in this occupation for over 26 years. Her income is usually spent on their food expenses, home bills and other commodities.

This will be her first loan and Pao aims to  improve sanitation practices for the entire household. Due to the shortage of funds, she has applied for a loan to build a hygienic latrine and a bathroom for her family members. Thanks to the water loan program with a special rate offered by Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL), Pao is encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions, to safeguard the health of her family, and to protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine and a bathroom for the sake of her family members.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a 34 year old married man. He has two children, aged one and two years. He describes himself to be courageous and ambitious. He operates a retail business where he sells milk. His business is located in a suburban area. He describes his family challenge to be water shortage. He will use the Kes 60,000 loan to buy a water storage container and buy more stock of milk for resale. The water container will enable his family of five members to store clean water for domestic use. He hopes that in the future, he will be wealthy. This is his third loan with SMEP DTM.  A previous loan of Kes 50,000 was paid successfully.

loans.use: buy a water storage container and buy more stock of milk for resale

loans.name: Leakena

texts.en:
Leakena is 20 years old and single, living with her parents and other siblings in a rural community, Prasat Bakong, Siem Reap. Leakena is a university student and has a part-time job to help her parents cover her education costs. She helps her parents with their farming chores when she gets free time from school and job.

As this will be her second loan, Leakena aims to focus on improving sanitation practices for the entire household. That’s why she has applied for a loan of USD300 to build a hygienic latrine for the sake of her family members. Thanks to the water loan program with a special rate offered by Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL), Leakena is encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions, to safeguard the health of her family and to protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine for the sake of her family members.

loans.name: Nora Isabel

texts.es:
Nora, a sus 22 años de edad, es madre soltera de 2 hijos de 4 y 6 años, por quienes lucha incansablemente para dar el sustento diario. Al ser cabeza de hogar, tuvo que buscar una alternativa que le permitiera generar ingresos para su familia y, por la dificultad para conseguir oportunidades de trabajo, decidió iniciar con una pequeña fábrica de arepas, gelatina blanca y pionono, el oficio lo aprendió de su madre, trabaja todos los días y la producción es comercializada en las diferentes tiendas del municipio, sus vecinos y amigos; de esta forma logra brindar solventar todos los gastos del hogar.
Actualmente solicita el crédito como un apoyo para fortalecer su negocio, pues comprará un computador y cancelará el saldo de un crédito que tiene vigente, esto le permitirá mejorar el manejo de inventarios de los insumos y llevar la contabilidad organizada de su negocio, con el fin de tener la capacidad para crecer y expandir su mercado.
Nora, con su espíritu emprendedor, perseverancia y dedicación, desea seguir trabajando constantemente para lograr cumplir el sueño de tener una fábrica bien estructurada, con una gran planta de producción y que le permita generar oportunidades de empleo, así mejorará las condiciones de vida y el bienestar para sus hijos, además estará en la capacidad de brindarles una buena educación para que sean personas íntegras y exitosas en el futuro.
texts.en:
At 22 years old, Nora is a single mother of two children, ages 4 and 6.  She struggles tirelessly to meet their needs from day to day.  As the head of her household, she had to look for an alternative that would allow her to generate income for her family.  Due to the difficulty of finding job opportunities, she decided to start a small factory producing arepas [traditional corn cakes], creamy gelatin, and Swiss rolls.  She learned this type of work from her mother.  She works every day and her products are sold in different stores in her town, as well as to her neighbors and friends.  In this way she can manage to cover all her household expenses.  

She is currently asking for a loan as a support to strengthen her business.  She will buy a computer and pay off the balance on a loan that she already has.  This will allow her to better manage the inventory of her ingredients and keep her business’s accounting in order, with the goal of being able to expand her business and her market.

With her entrepreneurial spirit, perseverance, and dedication, Nora hopes to continue constantly working to reach her dream of having a well-organized factory, with a big production plant that allows her to create job opportunities.  In this way, she will improve the living conditions and the well-being of her children.  Additionally, she will be in a position to give them a good education so that they can be upstanding and successful people in the future.

loans.use: to buy a computer and to pay off the balance on an outstanding loan.

loans.name: Zoraida

texts.es:
Zoraida es una joven madre y estudiante de segundo semestre de Auxiliar de Enfermería en la institución educativa CAMPO ALTO, se levanta de lunes a viernes a las cuatro y media cada mañana, para llevar a la pequeña bebe de tan solo unos meses de vida  a la casa de una vecina cercana e ir a trabajar, el trabajo comienza a las 7:00 a.m. y termina a las 4:00 Pm, a esta hora busca a la hija y la lleva inmediatamente al  hogar. 
Los días sábados asiste  a clases en la mencionada institución, llega a la casa alrededor de las cinco de la tarde para hacer las asignaciones con la hija. 
La joven madre, dice que lo más importante para una persona es superarse, es tener las ganas de ser alguien, siempre quiso estudiar y ayudar a las personas, pero no sabía cómo hacerlo.  

Zoraida, explica que estudia por la hija, para que  se sienta orgulloso de ella, la joven desea demostrarle a la hija que todo lo que uno se propone en la vida, se puede alcanzar.  

Aunque los problemas económicos parecen no tener fin, continúa estudiando y desea demostrar que no hay impedimento que le prohíba seguir el sueño, los problemas no la detienen, siempre tiene que seguir empujando. 
Zoraida desea seguir estudiando para ayudar a las personas que la han ayudado y en un futuro darle a la  hija de todo lo que necesiten.

Ella tiene todas las esperanzas puestas en poder contar con el apoyo de KIVA, para no tener que renunciar a los sueños de terminar la carrera, ya que en este momento está atravesando por un momento difícil en la situación económica debido a los todos los gastos que implica la manutención del  bebe.
texts.en:
Zoraida is a young mother and a student in her second semester of a nursing assistant program in the Campo Alto education institute.  Monday- Friday, she wakes up at 4:30am to take her few-months-old baby to her neighbor's house so she can go to work.  She starts work at 7:00am and ends work at 4:00pm, at which time she goes to pick her daughter up and bring her home.  On Saturdays, she attends class in the aforementioned school.  She gets home from class at around 5:00pm at which time she does her assignments with her daughter.  

The young mother states that the most important thing that a person must do to succeed is to have the desire to be someone.  She always wanted to study and help people, but she did not know how to do so.  Zoraida explains that she is going to school for her daughter, so that she can be proud of her.  She wants to show her daughter that one can achieve anything in life that you set your mind to.  Although her financial troubles seem to be endless, she continues to study, hoping that she can show that there is nothing that can stop her from following her dream.  Problems do not stop her, she always keeps pushing.  

Zoraida hopes to continue going to school to help the people that have helped her, and so that in the future she can give her daughter everything that she needs.  She has high hopes that she will be able to count on Kiva's support so that she will not have to give up on her dream of finishing her education, because she is currently in a difficult financial situation given all of the expenses associated with caring for a baby.

loans.use: pay for a semester of school.

loans.name: Sokmet

texts.en:
Sokmet is a 44-year-old married woman with five children living in Oudong, Kampong Speu Province. Her two children are garment factory laborers.
She is a farmer and her husband is a fish vendor. All of them earn $14 per day. 

She would like to apply for loan of $1,500 to buy cement, roof zinc, and timber to build a kitchen and a toilet. This loan helps her family live  a better life.

loans.use: to buy cement, roof zinc, and timber to build a kitchen and a toilet.

loans.name: Zahra

texts.en:
Zahra is a 34-year-old single lady who has been selling toys and accessories for two years.  Zahra used to work as an assistant to a well known doctor in her region, but she made up her mind and decided to start a business of her own to make sure that she can improve her living and develop her career.

After two years of establishing her own business, Zahra requests a loan from  Kiva partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with special-offer toys and accessories, especially those newly released for the coming spring and summer seasons.

She hopes that in the future, she'll keep on developing her business and diversifying her products to attract more customers' attention and satisfy their desires.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with special-offer  toys and accessories, especially those newly released for the coming spring and summer seasons.

loans.name: Ho

texts.en:
Ho is a 55-year-old woman and a widow with seven children, living in a rural rear of Kampong Thom province. She is in the business of making rattan furniture from her home and sells to local traders who come into the village to buy rattan products once a week. All of her children are married and work in the same business as she does. Having been in this occupation for nearly 20 years, she can earn a daily income of USD8.00 per day.

Ho would like to focus on improving sanitation practices for her entire household, but she is experiencing financial shortage. That’s why she is asking for a loan of USD560 to build a hygienic latrine for the sake of her family members. Thanks to the water loan program with a special rate offered by Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL), Ho is encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions, to safeguard the health of her family and to protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine for the sake of her family members.

loans.name: Yeimy Carolina

texts.es:
Ella es Yeimy Carolina, tiene 18 años, ella vive con la madre Omaira y los dos hermanos, estudia cosmetología y estética integral en Campo alto, para ella estudiar es lo que la puede ayudar a sacar adelante a la familia, pues las condiciones en que viven no son muy agradables ya que la madre es madre cabeza de hogar y no les puede dar todo a los hijos, a si que yeimy solicita el convenio con kiva, ya que ella misma paga las cuotas y le quedan con un valor muy alto, por este motivo Yeimy trabaja desde muy pequeña y se esfuerza mucho para poder reunir lo de la cuota y materiales para continuar estudiando. 

En este momento se encuentra trabajando en un restaurante en el cual se ha desempeñado como una gran persona y una buena trabajadora.

Ella se esfuerza mucho para cuidar lo que tiene, pues sabe que sin ello no puede culminar los estudios que es por lo cual ella ha hecho hasta lo imposible para no tener que dejarlo.  

La vida le enseño a que debe luchar por cumplir con los propósitos, sueña con culminar los estudios y así tener la propia estética y siempre continuar estudiando para encaminar una nueva meta cada dia, gracias a la ayuda que le brinda Kiva le queda más cerca la meta para cumplir el sueño y ayudar a la madre y brindarle un mejor futuro a los hermanos.
texts.en:
Her name is Yeimy Carolina.  She is 18 years old, and lives with her mother, Omaira, and her two siblings.  She studies cosmetology and holistic aesthetics in Campo Alto.  To her, an education is what will help her to get her family ahead.  The conditions that they live in are not very good as her mother is the head of the household, and she can not give her children everything.  Therefore, Yeimy is seeking help from Kiva since she is paying her tuition herself, and it is very expensive.  

Yeimy has worked since she was very little, and she puts a lot of effort into being able to pay for her tuition and the materials that she needs for school.  At the moment, she is working in a restaurant where she has proven herself to be a great person and a good worker.  She strives to save whatever she has because she knows that without it, she will not be able to finish her education, for which she has done even the impossible to avoid having to leave school.  

Life has taught her to fight to achieve her goals.  She dreams of finishing her education, and being able to have her own beauty shop.  She wants to always continue learning so that she can move towards a new goal everyday.  Thanks to the help that Kiva has provided her, she is closer to achieving her dream, helping her mother, and bringing her siblings a better future.

loans.use: pay for a semester of school.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en: Rosalie is 29 years of age, married, and blessed with three children. She has owned and managed a retail store in their village for almost four years and earns a net income of PHP 500 daily. Due to insufficient funds, she's asking for a loan amounting to PHP 15,000 to purchase cooking oil, eggs, detergent soaps, & shampoo to sell. She's hoping that her loan will help her business to improve more and make it more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase cooking oil, eggs, detergent soaps, & shampoo to sell.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia previously accessed an 20,000 PHP loan that she used to buy additional stock of merchandise like children's, men's, and women's clothing needed in her business. Her earnings helped to educate  her children and meet their personal, house hold, and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan to re-stock her merchandise. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell  results in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to meet her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Virginia dreams of having another  store and hopes to give her family a good future. She meets weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stock of merchandise like children's, men's and women's clothing needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy a water tank

loans.name: Héctor Manuel

texts.es:
Héctor es un hombre soltero de 25 años de edad, vive junto a sus padres y hermanos en el Departamento de Sololá.
El cuenta con un pequeño taller en donde elabora chumpas de tela y nailon y  se encuentra ubicada en su vivienda. Eligió esta actividad porque es rentable y productiva ya que anteriormente trabajaba en un lugar donde se elaboraban prendas de vestir, es por ello que fue adquiriendo experiencia. Ahora cuenta con dos años de tener este negocio que le genera buenos ingresos y ganancias para contribuir a la economía de su familia.
El ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un préstamo de Q 2,000.00 para la compra de una maquina de coser que le proporcionara rapidez a su trabajo y de esta manera podrá darles un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
Comenta que uno de sus sueños es comprar un terreno para poder construir su vivienda y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Héctor is a 25-year-old single man.  He lives with his parents and siblings in Sololá.  He has a small workshop in his home where he makes cloth and nylon jackets.  He chose this line of work because it is profitable and productive.  Previously, he worked in a business where they made clothing, which is where he gained experience.  He has now had his business for two years, and it generates a good income that allows him to contribute to his family's finances.  

He has decided to seek a loan of Q 2,000.00 to purchase a sewing machine that will make his work faster, allowing him to provide better service to his customers.  He states that one of his dreams is to purchase a plot of land to build his own house on and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: purchase a sewing machine.

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Sokha is a 33-year-old married woman with one child and lives in Oudong, Kampong Speu Province. 

She is a factory laborer and her husband is a carpenter. Both of them earn $9 per day. She would like to apply for loan of $600 USD to buy a cow to help with farming in the dry season. This  helps her harvest the crops and improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Alianza Unida  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Alianza Unida está formado por 11 mujeres quienes viven por el centro de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es de clima frió, tiene una gran belleza arquitectónica y natural, cuenta con una variada gastronomía la misma que cautiva los paladares de quienes la vistan, su gente mantiene su cultura y tradiciones. Las socias son mujeres que luchan  día a día para mejorar su calidad de vida y para sacar en adelante a sus hijos. Aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Rosa, tiene 39 años de edad, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 5 hijos de 15, 12, 11, 10 años y su último hijo de 5 meses de edad,  su primer hijo estudia en el colegio y sus tres últimos hijos estudian en una escuelita de la ciudad, su esposo labora como albañil, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
Doña Rosa se dedica a la venta de frutas, actividad que la realiza ambulantemente desde hace 2 años, trabaja de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo. Su nuevo crédito va a  invertir en la compra de más frutas. Su meta es de tener un puesto propio para vender su producto.
texts.en:
The "Alianza Unida" lending group is made up of 11 women who live in the center of the city of Cuenca.  This city has a cold climate, great architectural and natural beauty, and gastronomical offerings that captivate the palates of all who visit.  The city's people hold on to their culture and traditions.  The members are women who fight everyday to improve their quality of life, and to get their children ahead.  They still maintain the culture and traditions from their villages.  

One of the members of this group is Rosa.  She is 39 years old, married and has five children (ages 15, 12, 11, and 10 years old, and a 5-month old ) from this marriage.  Her first son is in high school, and the following three are in an elementary school in the city.  Her husband works as a mason.  They do not own their own home, so they live in a rental.  Rosa works selling fruit, which she has been doing door-to-door for the past two years.  She works everyday without a fixed schedule.  

She will use this new loan to invest in the purchase of more fruit.  Her goal is to have her own stand to sell her products.

loans.use: purchase fruits.

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.en: Mahbuba is a woman who has a kind heart. She lives with her family in the northern part of Tajikistan. She has had her own business for more than 15 years. She feeds cows and sells them at a local market. She also has a dairy cow. She sells milk to locals. Mahbuba now has 7 cows. She has a cowshed at her house. She buys feed for her cows at the local market. Mahbuba knows how to do her work well. She is going to develop her business further. She is asking for a loan of 10,000 Somoni to buy cattle to increase her working capital. She will use her profits to organize her son's wedding. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy cattle in order to increase her working capital.

loans.name: Mujeres De Esperanza  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Mujeres de Esperanza está formado por 6 socias y 1 socio, quienes viven en diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que es desde Diciembre de 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, es la tercera ciudad de mayor importancia del país, es de un clima frió pero su gente es de un corazón muy cálido quienes reciben a sus visitantes siempre con una sonrisa. Las socias son mujeres carismáticas que gracias al trabajo arduo que realizan diariamente pueden solventar los gastos de sus hogares y sacar adelante a sus familias, mantienen un la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora María Wilma, está realizando su primer crédito a lado de sus amigas del grupo de crédito Mujeres de Esperanza, espera que los créditos le ayuden para mejorar la estabilidad económica de su hogar. 
La Señora María Wilma tiene 46 años de edad, es viuda y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 23, 22, 13 años, su primer hijo es casado y vive independiente, su segundo hijo trabaja y le ayuda económicamente, su último hijo está estudiando en un colegio de la ciudad, la casa en la que vive es propia. 
Doña María Wilma tiene un pequeño restaurante desde hace un año y medio, labora de lunes a sábados sin un horario fijo, su especialidad son los almuerzos y la comida rápida, también es dueña de una unidad de taxi. Su crédito lo va a  invertir en la compra de llantas nuevas de su taxi. Su meta es ampliar su casa.
texts.en:
Mujeres de Esperanza Communal Bank is made up of seven members, six women and one man, who live in different places in the city of Cuenca.  Cuenca has been a [UNESCO] World Heritage Site since 1999 and is the third most important city in Ecuador.  The climate there is cold but the people are warm hearted and always greet their visitors with a smile, and they still preserve the culture and traditions of their communities.

The members of Mujeres de Esperanza are charismatic people who manage to pay the household expenses and get their families ahead through their hard work every day.  One of the members, María Wilma, is getting her first loan along with her friends in the bank.  She hopes the loans will help her improve the financial stability of her household.

María Wilma's a widow and has three children, ages 23, 22, and 13.  Her oldest child is married and lives on his own; the second one works and helps her financially; and the youngest attends school in the city.  She lives in her own house.

María Wilma has had a small restaurant for a year and a half.  She works Monday through Saturday without a set schedule.  Her specialties are lunch and fast food.

María Wilma also owns a taxi.  She's going to use her loan to buy new tires for her taxi.

Her goal is to expand her house.

loans.use: to buy tires

loans.name: Sabohat

texts.en:
Sabohat is kind woman from a rural area. She is married and her husband is a master in repairing houses. They have 4 children. 

Sabohat began her own animal husbandry business 20 years ago with 2 sheep.  Little by little, she  developed her business and is very experienced. She grows cattle feed and earns additional income growing potatoes. She is going to increase her working capital and asks for 4,500 TJS to buy cattle.

 She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy cattle to sell.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en: Jackline is a 32 year old woman. She describes herself as being helpful. She operates a retail business where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the lack of firewood. She will use the Kes 15,000 loan to buy cooking gas. This will enable her family to cook efficiently and save trees. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Previous loan of kes 20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy cooking gas.

loans.name: Soraya

texts.es: La Señorita Soraya tiene 26 años y es soltera,  estudia la carrera  de licenciatura en Psicologia en una universidad muy reconocida de la ciudad de La Paz, la Señorita Soraya trabaja  para pagar sus estudios trabaja administrando el alquiler de garajes,  la Señorita Soraya va a usar este préstamo para  los tramites que implica el sacar su título académico a nivel nacional,  la Señorita Soraya enfrenta retos en su estudios que son falta de apoyo económico  por parte de sus padres y el tener que trabajar y estudiar es muy duro pero ella tiene ganas de seguir adelante superarse terminar su carrera y poder ejercer su profesión,  vive en la zona de Pampahasi bajo, su deseo es poder terminar sus trámites y poder encontrar trabajo para ejercer su profesión y con el tiempo poder estudiar una maestría y así poder incrementar su sueldo y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Soraya, age 26, is single.  She is studying for a degree in psychology at a very well-known university in the city of La Paz.  Soraya works in order to pay for her studies.  She works in the administration of garage rentals.  

Soraya is going to use this loan to cover the costs involved in getting her academic title accredited at the national level.

Soraya faces challenges in her studies.  They are the lack of financial support from her parents and having to work and study.  It is very hard, but she has the desire to get ahead, to improve herself, to complete her degree, and to be able to practice her profession.

She lives in the Pampahasi Bajo area.  Her wish is to be able to finish getting her academic title accredited and to be able to find work in order to practice her profession.  In time, she would like to be able to get her master’s degree.  This way she would be able to increase her salary and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to cover the costs involved in getting her academic title accredited at the national level and her thesis.

loans.name: Pepa

texts.en:
Pepa is a 38-year-old married mother of two children who has been selling clothes from her house since eight years ago. Pepa is a hard worker with a very good reputation. She is well known in her region for the special quality with which she serves and the encouraging prices she sets.

Pepa is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with the newly released spring and summer collection.

Pepa is working hard to develop her business more and will make sure that in the future when she finds herself financially capable of opening a separate clothes selling shop outside her house she'll definitely take this step, and she is definitely seeking continuity in her career to provide her children with the necessary standards of living and requested education.

loans.use: to buy the newly released spring and summer clothing collections.

loans.name: Gavhar

texts.en:
Gavhar was born in 1977. She is a woman who always tries to find new sources of income. Gavhar began her own business with selling food items one year ago. Before that, she sold industrial goods. She buys food items in bulk from a central bazaar and sells them in the food shop which is located near her house. Her neighbors are her customers. 

Gavhar is divorced. She has no children. She lives with her parents. Gavhar is going to repair her house because her house is in bad condition. She is asking for a loan of 3,000 Somoni to buy building materials such as wood, cement, paints, etc. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy building materials such as wood, cement, paints, etc.

loans.name: Arcangel Gabriel Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “ARCANGEL GABRIEL”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Natividad ella es soltera y tiene 52 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de productos de belleza, la socia vende lápiz labiales, perfumes y cremas, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,la socia lleva a diferentes lugares como amigos y empresas, la socia ya tiene en este negocio 4 años y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los productos de belleza. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar lápiz labiales, perfumes y cremas.
 
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de librería, negocio de internet, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.




La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to Arcángel Gabriel Communal Bank, located in the district of Cusco in the province of Cusco and department of Cusco.

The member, Natividad, 52, is single and has two children.  She works in her business selling beauty products: lip pencil, perfume, and creams.  She works from 8 a.m. until 7 p.m., selling to friends or businesses in different places.  Natividad has had this business for four years and it's going very well for her.  Her dream is to have a place to sell her beauty products.

She's requesting the loan to buy lip pencil, perfume, and creams.

Natividad's grateful to those who are part of her dream through this loan, and she promises to make her payments on time.

The other members earn a living with a bookstore, an Internet business, a grocery store, and a restaurant.

loans.use: to buy lip pencil, perfume, and creams

loans.name: Justiniana

texts.es:
Justiniana estudio solamente tercer grado, ella es casada el esposo está en estados unidos,  ella se dedica a trabajos del hogar, tiene cinco hijos solo una es hembra,  sus hijos  trabajan en una finca. 
La señora va a construir otra vivienda, pues sus hijos estarán mas cómodos, con el préstamo podrá hacer la casa en menos tiempo, cree que poco a poco lo ira pagando. Sus sueños son comprar terrenos y construir casas para sus hijos poco a poco para darle herencia digna, también piensa apoyarlos en la educación.
texts.en:
Justiniana only went to school through the third grade.  She is married, and her husband is in the United States.  She devotes herself to the household chores.  She has five children; only one is a girl.  Her children work on a farm.

She is going to build another house so that her children will be more comfortable.  With the loan she will be able to build the house in less time.  She believes that she will be paying little by little.

Her dreams are to buy land and to, little by little, build houses for her children.  She wants to give them a decent inheritance.  She also plans on supporting their education.

loans.use: to buy tiles and wood and to pay for labor to build her house.

loans.name: Carlos Remigio

texts.es: Carlos   de 21 años de edad,  soltero y sin hijos, es una agradable estudiante de la facultad ingeniería de sistemas, estudia mucho para alcanzar sus metas en la vida. Carlos está culminando sus estudios con éxitos y poder ser un buen ingeniero de sistemas. Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá  en seguir pagando su matrícula, para el pago de sus pensiones universitarias  y  realizar la compra  de útiles de estudio que necesita. Se encuentra muy agradecido  por la ayuda brindada y se despide con muchos deseos de culminar sus metas propuestas agradece a Edaprospo y kiva.
texts.en:
Carlos, age 21, is single and does not have children.  He is a likable student of engineering systems.  He studies a lot in order to achieve his life goals.  Carlos is finishing his studies successfully, and he will be able to be a good system’s engineer.

He will use the loan to continue paying his registration, to pay for university housing, and to buy school supplies that he needs.  He is very grateful for the help provided.  He says good-bye with a great desire to meet his proposed goals, and he is grateful to EDAPROSPO and Kiva.

loans.use: to continue paying his registration, to pay for university housing, and to buy school supplies that he needs.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria  vive en la ciudad del Cusco al sur del Perú y pertenece al banco comunal “Imasumac II” de la Asociación Arariwa. Ella es una mujer trabajadora y responsable que saca adelante a su familia y su actividad económica principal es la venta de jugos. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más insumos como por ejemplo azúcar, leche, papayas, manzanas, plátanos, piñas, duraznos, naranjas y otras cosas más. 
Victoria agradece por apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Victoria lives in the the city of Cusco, in southern Peru, and belongs to Imasumac II Group, a communal bank of Asociación Arariwa.  She's a hardworking and responsible woman who gets her family ahead.

Victoria's main job is selling juice.  She needs this loan to buy more sugar, milk, papayas, apples, bananas, pineapples, peaches, oranges, and other ingredients.

Victoria's grateful for the support she's being granted and promises to be disciplined in making her payments.

loans.use: to buy sugar, milk, papayas, apples, bananas, pineapples, peaches, oranges, and other ingredients

loans.name: Santa Terecita-32 Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento SANTA TERECITA-32 en esta tercera secuencia está compuesto por diez integrantes, siete  mujeres y tres varones, la presidenta del banco sigue siendo la Sra. Erika, cuenta que le fue bien con su actividad que es la venta de comida, en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de mesas y sillas para así brindar comodidad a sus clientes, se siente feliz y agradecida por la oportunidad que le dan para crecer en su negocio ya que con esta actividad le va muy bien está mejorando sus ingresos y por ende su calidad de vida.
texts.en: The Santa Terecita-32 village bank is in its third loan cycle. It is made up of ten members, seven women and three men. The leader of the group is still Erika, who says her business selling food is going well. She is requesting this loan so she can buy tables and chairs so her customers will be more comfortable. She is happy and grateful for this opportunity to strengthen her business, which will help her increase her income and thus her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs.

loans.name: Yaneht

texts.es: Yaneht vive en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco al sur de Perú y pertenece al banco comunal “Imasumac II”. Ella es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo de su trabajo entonces su actividad económica principal es la venta de artesanía. Ella hace trabajos de artesanía como aretes y collares. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de trabajo como por ejemplo alambres, pegamentos, piedras de colores y otras cosas más.
texts.en: Yaneht lives in the beautiful city of Cusco in southern Peru and is a member of the Imasumac II village bank. She is a hardworking, enterprising woman who is supporting her family with her efforts. She makes a living selling handicrafts. She makes jewelry such as earrings and necklaces. She is currently seeking a loan to buy supplies for her work such as wire, glue, colored stones, and so on.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her work such as wire, glue, colored stones, and so on.

loans.name: Phat

texts.en: Phat is 58 years old married woman with one child at Oudong, Kampong Speu Province. Phat and her husband are farmers and her child is a factory laborer. All of them can earn $6 per day. She would like to apply for loan of $500 to buy pigs to breed. This loan will help her family in making more income for a better life.

loans.use: to buy pigs to breed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase palm oil, vegetables, salt, pepper, magi cube, rice, onion, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wheat flour, cooking oil and beans

loans.name: Sotum

texts.en:
Sotum is 36 years old and from the village of Rumlech, Bakan, Pursat province. For more than 10 years, she has been farming rice alongside her husband to earn a living. With great effort and hard work, she is able to provide her two children with daily meals and send them to be educated at school.

Sotum needs financial support in order to improve water and sanitation for her entire household. She realizes that all these play an important role for healthy living conditions. The loan amount will be used to build a hygienic latrine and buy a water pump. 

Thanks to the water loan program with a special rate offered by Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL), Sotum is encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions to safeguard the health of her family and protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine and buy a water pump.

loans.name: Mahfirat

texts.en: Mahfirat is 29 years old. She is married and has 2 children. Mahfirat is young and purposeful woman. She began her own business selling electronics. Mahfirat has a shop in the center part of her region. Mahfirat manages her business alone. Her husband is a migrant in Russia. Mahfirat works 8 hours a day. She is going to refill her working capital. She is asking for a loan of 10000 Somoni to buy new electronics. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy new electronics to refill her working capital

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en: Sofia is married with five children and three of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family (a grand son). She has a business of a retail shop and has been in this business for 11 years. She has applied for a loan of 2500000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, cooking oil, rice, beans and maize flour. She works in the shop seven days a week and sells on retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality, transportation and ever increasing prices of commodities in Uganda. She is aspires to become a wholesaler and  also  to own a delivery van to ease in transportation. She resides in the family house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and paying for utility bills.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, cooking oil, rice, beans and maize flour

loans.name: Taguhi

texts.en:
Taguhi is from Haytagh village. She lives there with her mother in law and husband. They own a farm where they cultivate greens, potato and wheat. Taguhi's husband sells the gathered harvest in nearby markets and gathers income for the family. The family also owns greenhouse which is old and needs to be improved. Taguhi would greatly like to renovate it and start cultivation new types of vegetables.
She has now requested this loan to purchase potato seed and materials for improving the greenhouse. Taguhi will be very grateful to lenders if their support her farm. As this is Taguhi's first loan it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who don't have access to credit products in the past because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to pay for potato seed and materials for improving the greenhouse

loans.name: Diana Angela

texts.es: Diana  de 23 años de edad,  soltera y sin hijos, es un agradable estudiante de la facultad de contabilidad   estudia mucho para alcanzar sus metas en la vida. Con la ayuda de sus padres  diana ha sabido salir adelante estudiar mucho y  así culminar sus estudios y así poder ser  exitosa en la vida. Con el préstamo otorgado diana  podrá realizar los pagos de su matrícula universitaria y la compra de útiles de estudio que necesita. Diana se encuentra muy agradecida  por la ayuda brindada y se despide con un fuerte abrazo ah Kiva y diciéndoles que cumplirá la promesa de salir adelante.
texts.en: Diana is 23 years old, single and without children. She is a likable student in the faculty of accounting and she studies hard to reach her life goals. With some assistance from her pare, Diana has understood to come out ahead, to study hard and therefore culminate her studies and be able to be successful in life. With the loan awarded, Diana will be able to pay her university tuition and the make the purchase of study tools that she needs. Diana is very grateful for the help dedicated to her and she signs off with a big hug to Kiva, and telling them that she will complete her promise to come out ahead.

loans.use: purchase study tools

loans.name: Sarwat's Group

texts.en:
Sarwat is a 38-year-old woman residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of five children. Her husband owns a printing shop. He is the guardian of the family and responsible to fulfill the needs of all family members. Sarwat has been running her own beauty saloon for the past five years. She also contributes her income with her husband to manage the household.
 
She needs to buy different types of cosmetics, i.e. creams, hair brushes, and other accessories for her beauty saloon, but due to financial constraints, she is not able to buy these items for her business purpose. Therefore, Sarwat applied for a Kiva loan in group with other two members. This loan will help her buy the relevant items for her business purpose so that she can provide better services to her customers. It will also be helpful for her to earn maximum profitable income to fulfill the needs of her business and family.

For this financial assistance, Sarwat is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy different types of cosmetics, i.e. creams, hair brushes, and other accessories.

loans.name: Mukaddas

texts.en:
Mukaddas was born in 1957. She is hardworking woman. Mukaddas is married and has four children. Her children are adults. Mukaddas has been busy with animal husbandry more than 28 years. She has worked hard over these 28 years to earn a living. She always struggles for the well-being of her children.

 Now, she is ill. Mukaddas must buy medicines for her treatment but she has not enough money. She is asking for a loan of 7,500 Somoni to buy medicines for her treatment. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy medicines for her treatment

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is married, with three children. Two of her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. 

Mary has a clinic business and she has been in this business for 20 years. She has applied for a loan of UGX 2,000,000 (Uganda shillings) from Micro Credit for Development and Transformation SACCO (MCDT SACCO) to buy more boxes of drugs, syrups, and syringes. 

She generates additional income from poultry farming. She works from home, seven days out of every week, and she sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality and taxes. She aspires to own a fully-stocked clinic. 

Mary decided to join MCDT SACCO because of quick loans. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of drugs, syrups, and syringes for her clinic.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is married with six children; and three of her children go to school. She doesn’t have any other income generating activity. She has a business of selling used clothes, and has been in this business for a few months. She has applied for a loan of 2,000,000 Uganda Shillings (UGX) from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes. 

She generates additional income from selling plastics, such as basis cups, plates, and shoes. She moves door to door selling used clothes, and works six days out of every week. She sells on a retail basis. 

Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. She is aspiring of getting a permanent business premise, becoming a wholesaler, and educating her children up to university. 

She resides in the family house, and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food for the family.

loans.use: to buy bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase oil and a bag of plantains for her business.

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen lives in Apaga village with his parents, his wife and two little kids (ages 4 and 1 year old). He has been involved in agriculture. Mainly he keeps cows, pigs, and a calf as well as cultivating tomatoes, greens and some grass for the livestock.

Armen is a hardworking young man who works day and night to be able to provide better living conditions for his family. By requesting this loan, he asks Kiva lenders to support him with the farm. The income that he gets from selling agricultural products at the market is hardly enough to cover the family's costs, and at the same time the farm needs some improvements. 

So, Armen has requested this loan to purchase cucumber seeds, fertilizer and materials for renovation of the greenhouse. This will be huge help for Armen and he hopes that lenders will support him.

As this is Armen's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products in the past because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to pay for cucumber seeds, fertilizer and materials for renovation of the greenhouse

loans.name: Dan

texts.en:
Dan comes from a village in Kiruhura district. He is married with six children and all of them are in school. Dan runs a retail shop with a working capital of 600,000 UGX which he supports with his banana plantation where he harvests bananas to supply to the trading centre.  He gets customers from neighboring homes, though the main challenge is stiff competition, price fluctuations and thieves who steal his bananas while still in the garden. 

Dan has applied for a loan of UGX 1,200,000 to help him add more stock for his shop and buy manure and fertilizers for his banana plantation. He plans to use the rest of the money to pay school fees for his children.

Dan hopes to build a permanent home for his children.

loans.use: To buy stock for his general store and buy manure and fertilizers for his banana plantation

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more slippers, to increase her business.

loans.name: Hafizan

texts.en:
Hafizan is a 31-year-old married woman and the mother of four. She has been running a business selling cloths for many years. She purchases a variety of cloths from the main city and then sells them to the people of her vicinity. She has become famous for selling good quality cloths in her community.

Hafizan requested a loan of PKR 40,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy a stock of different cloth for the summer season by taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she would be able to earn more income through her greater sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard efforts in her business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of different cloth for the summer season.

loans.name: Irshad

texts.en: Irshad is a married woman who has run a small general store in her community for many years.  She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. Irshad makes enough to provide for her family. To make her store fully stocked she requested a loan of PKR 50,000 to buy grains, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates. In this way she would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. Irshad wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy grains, sugar and flour.

loans.name: Zaynura

texts.en:
Zaynura is a farmer who has a plantation. She has been in the agricultural business since 2007. She sells her agricultural produce at the local market. She has a lot of clients who prefer her goods because she grows vegetables with good quality. She hopes that during some future years she will develop her business and earn more income. 

She is a well-bred person and has good knowledge as she was one of the best pupils at school. Her parents were poor and that’s why she couldn’t get higher education. She always dreams of being a highly-functioning person. 

 Zaynura has acquired a loan of 5,000 Somoni  to buy mineral fertilizers and seeds. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy mineral fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Neiva Maria
