texts.es: La señora Neiva tiene 25  años tiene dos hijos de 12 y 4 años,  ella se dedica  a la venta de artículos de primera necesidad en su  tienda de barrio que se encuentran ubicado en su mismo domicilio que es en la zona de Horizontes de la ciudad de el Alto,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  la señora Neiva va a usar este préstamo para a la compra de mercadería para surtir su negocio como abarrotes, dulces, galletas y variedad de refrescos, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es necesidad de surtir su tienda ya que esta época tiene mucha demanda, la señora Neiva enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia ya que en la zona hay muchas tiendas de barrio, ella va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando mercadería y así incrementar su capital y poder tener un almacén ya que este es uno deseos, se siente feliz y agradecida por esta oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en:
Sra. Neiva is 25 years old and has two children, ages 12 and 4. She sells basic necessities from a neighborhood store inside her home, which is located in the District of Horizontes in the city of El Alto.

This loan is her first transaction with Emprender. Sra. Neiva will use the loan to buy merchandise for restocking her business such as groceries, sweets, cookies, and a variety of soft drinks. Her reason for requesting this loan is that she needs to restock her store for this time of year when there is great demand. Sra. Neiva faces challenges in her business, such as dealing with the competition in the area since there are several neighborhood stores. She will use her profits to continue buying merchandise so that she can increase her capital. Having a store is one of her wishes, so she is pleased and grateful for the opportunity that has been given to her.

loans.use: to buy groceries, sweets, cookies, and a variety of soft drinks.

loans.name: Ruth Magaly

texts.es:
Ruth Magaly vive en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco y pertenece al banco comunal “Imasumac II” de la Asociación Arariwa. Ella es una mujer trabajadora que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo de su trabajo,  ella  se dedica a la venta de  productos de  belleza y ropa. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar perfumes , collares, camisas, blusas, aretes, pulseras y otras cosas más.   

Agradece el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Ruth Magaly lives in the beautiful city of Cusco and is a member of the Communal Bank “Imasumac II”, which is part of Asociación Arariwa. She is a hardworking woman who is able to move her family forward as a result of the efforts of her work. Ruth sells beauty products and clothing. She is taking this opportunity to request a loan in order to buy perfumes, necklaces, shirts, blouses, earrings, bracelets, and other items.

Ruth is grateful for the loan and promises to submit her payments according the schedule.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, necklaces, shirts, blouses, earrings, bracelets, and other items.

loans.name: Seraphine

texts.fr: Seraphine est une dame âgée de 57 ans qui mène comme activité la vente des vivres secs dans un marché de la ville depuis 07 ans déjà. ceci dit elle bénéficie d'une bonne expérience dans le domaine, ce qui lui a permit d'avoir une clientèle considérable. elle voudrait avec ce crédit acheter en gros du maïs, du pistache et du poisson fumé. ce qui est générateur de plus de revenu car pour l'instant elle s'approvisionne en détail. les revenus générés lui permettront de mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Seraphine is a 57-year-old woman who has had a business selling dried foodstuff at a town market for seven years already. She benefits from good experience in this domain that enabled her to have a considerable customer base. With this loan, she would like to purchase corn in bulk, some pistachios, and smoked fish, which generates more and more revenues, since she gets her supplies at the retail level for the time being. The revenues generated will enable her to do better at meeting family needs.

loans.use: to buy maize, pistachios and smoked fish for resale.

loans.name: Antal

texts.en: Antal is a 35-year-old vigorous lady who has been stitching clothes for many years. She sews for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to a lack of funds she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she requested a loan of PKR 45,000 from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of thread in different colors along with the packs of laces, zippers and buttons. She is on her fifth loan and has a good credit history.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread in different colors along with the packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 53-year-old woman and works from home as a tailor. She has been in this line of work for seven years now, and is proud to be contributing to her household income. When Nasreen was not earning, her family was going through severe financial crisis that compelled her to use her stitching skills in a productive manner. 

Nasreen felt an obligation to change her family’s living standards and start working from home. Her hard work helped her establish a good clientele, but she is having difficulty in fulfilling large orders. For this reason, she has requested PKR 40, 000. Her loan will be used to purchase a new stitching machine, along with some threads in various colors.

loans.use: to purchase a new stitching machine, along with some threads in various colors.

loans.name: Sarvinoz

texts.en: Sarvinoz is a hard-working young woman, born in 1989. She is married and has three children. Her husband emigrated to Russia. Sarvinoz needs to earn money to cover her children’s necessities. Sarvinoz is going to organize her own business. She took part in a competition for “The best business plan” organized by National Association of Business Women. She wants to start a cleaning company to provide house-cleaning services to local people. She is applying for a loan of US$2,800 to buy cleaning equipment. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy cleaning equipment and organize a new business.

loans.name: Ousman

texts.fr: Ousman est un homme de 40 ans marié et père 5 enfants dont l'age varie entre 01 et 10 ans. il est commerçant dans un marché de la place depuis 23 ans où il vend la viande grillé, à cause de la petitesse de son capital,. Mais il se retrouve constamment en rupture de stock parce qu'il est obligée de faire écouler tous le stock pour pouvoir s'en procurer à nouveau ceci à cause de la petitesse de son capital.il souhaiterai acheter beaucoup plus de viande pour satisfaire la demande constante de sa clientèle et d'éviter les ruptures de stocks. il économisera son bénéfice pour non seulement agrandir son activité mais aussi subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Ousman is a 40-year-old man and the married father of five children, from 1 to 10 years old. He has been a merchant at a local market for 23 years where he sells grilled meats. But he finds he is constantly short of inventory. Due to his meager capital, he is compelled to sell everything in order to be able to procure more. He would like to purchase much more meat to satisfy the constant demand from his customers and to avoid shortages. He will save his profits not only to expand his business but also to meet the needs of his family.

loans.use: to increase quantities of meat to cook and sell

loans.name: Irshad

texts.en:
Irshad is a 57-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store at the corner of her house. Her husband and son also assist her by purchasing a stock of goods from the market and dealing with customers at store. 

She is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing, and health. She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of PKR 50,000 to buy packs of salts, biscuits, and beverages to meet the increasing demands at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings, and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits, and beverages.

loans.name: Rode Maria

texts.es:
Rode de 35 años de edad, casada con dos hijos menores de edad de 9, 18 años  lo cual están bajo su responsabilidad están estudiando en la universidad y en primaria. Es originaria de Carazo, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte de la región. Se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. En sus ratos libre le gusta disfrutar de la compañia de sus hijos. En la actualidad lucha, día a día  para brindarle un futuro mejor.
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica una farmacia ubicada en su casa de habitación, desde hace 15 anos. El negocio lo inicio con un poco de capital que tenía ahorrados y poco a poco ha surtido su farmacia con mucha esfuerzo. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 10 horas diarias ofreciendo su producto, actividad que la desempeña con mucho gusto. El objetivo del crédito es surtir su farmacia con productos éticos y genéricos como: acetaminofén, diclofenad, talerdin, corilin, dolovitalgia, cardiosar, losartan, glibenclamida, ibuprofeno, kidi, emulsión de escott, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.  Rodé agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a  personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
  .
texts.en:
Rode is 35 years old. She is married with two children, ages 9 and 18, who are under her responsibility. They are studying at university and in elementary school. She is originally from Carazo, which is located in the northern area of the region. Rode is known for being hardworking and responsible and striving to improve herself. In her free time, Rode enjoys spending time with her children. She fights day by day to offer them a better future. 

Thanks to her effort and her hopes to get ahead, she has had a pharmacy located in her house for 15 years. She started the business with a little bit of money that she had saved. Little by little, with a lot of effort, she stocked her pharmacy. Rode works her business 10 hours a day, offering her products, an activity that she performs with pleasure. Her goal for the loan is to stock her pharmacy with ethical and generic products, such as acetaminophen, diclofenac, talerdin, corilin, dolo-vitalgia, cardiosar, losartan, glibenclamida, ibuprofen, Kidi, and Scott's emulsion, so that she can have better income in the near future. Rode is thankful for the help that Kiva investors offer to people with scarce resources and to countries such as Nicaragua to have a means of good work.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and to stock her business by buying and selling pharmacy products, such as: acetaminophen, diclofenac, talerdin, corilin, dolo-vitalgia, cardiosar, losartan, glibenclamida, ibuprofen, Kidi, and Scott's emulsion.

loans.name: Niegoude's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe  est créé le 12 Décembre 2011 au jour d’inauguration du banc villageois. Il est composé de  femmes qui sont issues du même quartier. Elles ont su au cours des cycles passés ensemble développer une solidarité et soutien mutuel. Elles fréquentent toutes le marché international de la zone pour y mener leurs activités de  petit commerce.

Madame Niégoudé  (assise à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est âgée de 47 ans, est mariée et mère de 07 enfants dont 04 filles et 03 garçons. Elle s’active dans le petit commerce : sucre, pâte d’arachide, thé vert, …, et s’approvisionne au marché hebdomadaire international de la sous région pour ensuite revendre au détail dans son quartier. 
 
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elle désire acheter une dizaine de seaux  de pâte d’arachide, un sac de sucre et 04 paquets de thé vert.

Avec les bénéfices seront exclusivement utilisés à l’entretien de ses enfants concernant leur scolarité, habillement et à améliorer la dépense quotidienne.
texts.en:
This group was created on December 12, 2011 on the day the 'banc villageois' was inaugurated. The group is composed of women who are from the same district. Over the course of past loan cycles together, they found out how to develop solidarity and mutual support. They all attend the international market in the area to carry out their work in small-scale commerce.

Ms. Niégoudé (sitting at the far right with a hand raised) is the featured borrower of the group. She is 47 years old, married, and the mother of seven children (four girls and three boys). She is active in small-scale commerce: sugar, peanut butter, green tea, …. She gets her supplies at the weekly international market in the sub-region and then sells her goods retail in her district. 

With this new loan, she would like to purchase a dozen buckets of peanut butter, a sack of sugar, and 4 packets of green tea. 

Niégoudé will use the profits exclusively for caring for her children in terms of schooling and clothing and for alleviating day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to purchase peanut butter, sugar, and green tea

loans.name: Haydee

texts.es:
Haydee vive en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco al sur del Perú y pertenece al banco comunal “Imasumac II” de la Asociación Arariwa. Ella tiene 41 años de edad,  es casada y tiene 4 hijos. Ella es una mujer trabajadora que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo de su trabajo,  ella  se dedica a preparar platos típicos de la región como por ejemplo arroz con pollo, arroz verde, tallarin verde, estofado, adobo, chicharon , escabeche y otros. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo carne, arroz, verduras y otras cosas más. 

Agradece el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Haydee lives in the beatiful city of Cusco in the south of Peru and belongs to the communal bank "Imasumac II" from Arariwa Association. She is 41 years old, married and has 4 children. She is a working woman who forges ahead with her family with the effort from her job. She dedicates herself to preparing typical dishes of her region, for example rice and chicken, green rice, green noodles, stews, marinades, crackling, pickles, and others. With this opportunity she requires the loan in order to purchase consumables such as meat, rice, vegetables and others. 

She is grateful for the loan and agrees to make the repayments in accordance with the schedule of payments.

loans.use: to purchase consumables such as meat, rice, vegetables and others.

loans.name: Saly's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe  est créé le 12 Décembre 2011 au jour d’inauguration du banc villageois. Il est composé de  femmes qui sont issues du même quartier. Elles ont su au cours des cycles passés ensemble développer une solidarité et soutien mutuel. Elles fréquentent toutes le marché international de la zone pour y mener leurs activités de  petit commerce.

Madame Saly (assise à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée, âgée de 39  et mère de 05 filles. Elle est vendeuse de produits alimentaires plus particulièrement l’huile de palme qu’elle achète dans la sous région. Elle jouit d’une bonne expérience dans ce domaine pour l’avoir pratiqué depuis plusieurs années.

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle pense acheter six bidons de 20 litres d’huile de palme pour la revente au détail.

Elle compte utiliser les bénéfices dans le renforcement de la dépense quotidienne dans le but d’améliorer la qualité des repas.
texts.en:
This group was created on December 12, 2011 on the day the 'banc villageois' was inaugurated. The group is composed of women who are from the same district. Over the course of past loan cycles together, they found out how to develop solidarity and mutual support. They all attend the international market in the area to carry out their work in small-scale commerce.

Ms. Saly (sitting at the far right with a hand raised) is the featured borrower of the group. She is 39 years old, married, and the mother of five girls. She is a vendor of grocery items, particularly palm oil, which she purchases in the sub-region. She enjoys good experience in this domain for having worked at it for several years. 

With this new loan, she would like to purchase six 20-liter containers of palm oil to sell retail.

Saly plans on using the profit to alleviate day-to-day expenses with the goal of improving the quality of her meals.

loans.use: to purchase palm oil to resell

loans.name: Shaheen

texts.en: Shaheen is a 47 year old, married woman with six children. She is very motivated to provide them with a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing. Shaheen has been in the milk-selling business for many years. She has five calves and two milking cows. She sells milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter, which she makes from the milk. Her business is good enough to provide her with a decent life; she has worked hard to improve her business so she can meet her daily expenses. This is Shaheen's seventh year with the Kashf Foundation. She has been happily running her business through the Foundation's support. Now she is requesting a loan of PKR50,000 to purchase another cow. She hopes to increase her milk production, which ultimately helps her to generate more income.

loans.use: to purchase another cow.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: Doña Mercedes es originaria de la ciudad de León. Es de oficio modista, se dedica a la elaboración ropa el general. Se siente agradecida con KIVA y MiCrédito ya que con el crédito anterior logró incrementar su inventario y satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes. Solicita el crédito para comprar: Telas, Botones, Zippers, Hilos y Cedinas, Elásticos entre otros. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que podrá obtener mejores ingresos y así logrará superarse poco a poco en la vida.
texts.en:
Doña Mercedes is a native of the city of León. She has a modest position and is dedicated to clothing embellishment in general. She is grateful to KIVA and MiCrédito as with the previous loan she accomplished increasing her inventory and satisfying the demand of her customers. She requests the loan in order to purchase fabric, buttons, zippers, needles and thread, and elastics among others. 

She estimates the loan will be of great help to her as she will be able to obtain better income and therefore will better herself little by little throughout her life.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, buttons, zippers, needles, thread, and elastics among others.

loans.name: Jose Ricardo

texts.es:
José, se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos y crianza de cerdos, son actividades que realiza para tener los recursos económicos necesarios con las cuales cubre las necesidades de su familia, sus conocimientos los obtuvo de su papá, actualmente su negocio no le ha representado ninguna dificultad. José es acompañado, vive con su compañera de vida y un hijo.
El capital que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de cerdos y concentrado para alimentarlos, los engordara para luego venderlos a sus clientes teniendo acceso a ingresos extras con los cuales pagara las cuotas de la deuda adquirida y mejorar el estilo de vida de su familia.
Aspira a tener un negocio con más rentabilidad para dar a su familia mejor vestuario, alimentación y salud.
texts.en:
José cultivates basic grains and raises pigs. These business activities enable him to generate needed income so that he can cover his family’s needs. He obtained his knowledge from his father. At the moment, his business does not present any difficulties. José is in a relationship and lives with his companion and their child.

The loan he is requesting will be invested in the purchase of pigs and concentrated feed. José will fatten the animals before selling them to his customers. The extra income will be used to repay his debt and improve his family’s lifestyle.

José aspires to have a more profitable business so that he can do a better job of providing clothing, food, and health care for his family.

loans.use: to buy pigs and concentrated feed.

loans.name: Fatou's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe  est créé le 12 Décembre 2011 au jour d’inauguration du banc villageois. Il est composé de  femmes qui sont issues du même quartier. Elles ont su au cours des cycles passés ensemble développer une solidarité et soutien mutuel. Elles fréquentent toutes le marché international de la zone pour y mener leurs activités de  petit commerce.

Madame Fatou (assise à droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée, âgée de 47 ans. Son activité s’inscrit dans la vente de légumes frais au marché de son quartier où elle tient une table. Elle s’approvisionne soit auprès de maraicher dans la plus part du temps soit auprès de revendeurs.

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle veut acheter 5 sacs de choux, 05 sacs de carotte, 03 sacs d’aubergine et 5 paniers de poissons secs pour la revente.

Elle utilise ses bénéfices dans sa plus grande partie à satisfaire les besoins de la dépense quotidienne et la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
This group was created on December 12, 2011 on the day the 'banc villageois' was inaugurated. The group is composed of women who are from the same district. Over the course of past loan cycles together, they found out how to develop solidarity and mutual support. They all attend the international market in the area to carry out their work in small-scale commerce.

Ms. Fatou (sitting at the right with a hand raised) is the featured borrower of the group. She is 47 years old and married. Her business involves selling fresh vegetables at the district market where she has a table. She gets her supplies either from market gardeners most of the time or from retailers.  

With this new loan, she wants to purchase 5 sacks of cabbages, 5 sacks of carrots, 3 sacks of eggplant, and 5 baskets of dried fish to resell.

Fatou uses her profits for the most part to cover day-to-day needs and her children's schooling costs.

loans.use: to purchase cabbages, carrots, eggplant, and dried fish to resell

loans.name: Fazilat

texts.en: Fazilat is vigorous lady; she has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason, she requested a loan of 35,000 PKR to Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of thread in different colors, packs of laces, zippers and buttons, to create a means of increasing revenues so she may able to generate a healthier source of income.  She is in her sixth loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread in different colors, packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Etleva

texts.en:
Etleva wants to buy a dairy cow and your kindness will help her achieve the goal! She is upset because the cow she had passed away about three months back due to the fact that a nail had passed through food to her stomach, and despite all the attempts from a vet and other people in the village to save her life, Etleva's cow died.

Etleva is a 37-year-old mother of two children aged 13 and 9. So far, she's been focused on agricultural activity, most specifically that of growing types of cherries, pears and chestnuts. In addition to these, she plants and harvests wheat and corn.

The village where Etleva and her family live is a mountain one with a somewhat cold climate and which is known for the large production of chestnuts. Pear is another common fruit tree amongst all; villagers make compost out of it. The mountain terrain supports livestock activity as well; sheep, goats and cows are some of the most common animals in this village.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: William Xavier

texts.es: William Xavier mayor de edad, casado, y con dos hijos menor aún bajo su responsabilidad, originario del municipio de Chinandega ubicado en el occidente del  país. William es propietario de un negocio de mercadería en general,  el cual comercializa productos como: electrodomésticos, utensilios de cocina, ropa nueva, calzado, lencería,  productos plásticos, entre otros productos que le encargan sus clientes; el sale a ofrecer desde muy temprano sus productos de forma ambulante en algunas comarcas, repartos, zonas aledañas de este municipio. El inicio con este negocio por iniciativa propia con deseos de superación hace más de seis años,  William Xavier solicita el crédito para invertirlo en su negocio y de esa manera poder satisfacer con las demandas de sus clientes, de antemano agradece a los inversionistas kiva por la ayuda que les brindan a las personas de bajos recursos y a países pobres como Nicaragua, para sacar adelante sus familias y tener fuentes de trabajo.
texts.en:
William Xavier is a married adult who has two young children under his responsibility. He is originally from the town of Chinandega, which is located in the western part of the country. William is the owner of a general merchandise business in which he sells products such as household appliances, cooking utensils, new clothing, shoes, lingerie, plastic goods, and other items that his customers order from him.

He leaves his home very early so that he can begin offering his products as a street vendor in different areas, suburbs, and surrounding neighborhoods of his town. William started this business on his own and his drive to succeed has enabled him to keep it in operation for more than six years.

William Xavier is requesting a loan so that he can invest in his business and satisfy the demands from his customers. He would like to thank the Kiva lenders in advance for the assistance they provide to people who have limited resources and come poor countries, such as Nicaragua, so that they can work and help their families get ahead.

loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes, cosmetics, and other types of merchandise.

loans.name: Maria Felix

texts.en: Maria and her husband Pedro live in Totolapan with their daughter and two-year-old grandson. Pedro works as a driver, and Maria works in the field. Their youngest daughter and their grandson, Madison, recently moved in with them. Maria appears in the photo with a smiling Madison by her side. Maria knows that the asbestos roof above their house is a health threat and that the dirt floor will only make their grandson's respiratory disease worse. Maria and Pedro have been saving for the last few months to buy materials to replace the roof and install a proper cement floor. Maria is asking for a loan to finish paying for the materials and start working as soon as possible. Since no one in the family has a formal job and steady source of income, access to credit is nearly impossible. The three (Maria, Pedro and their daughter) will work on the construction and a certified technician will supervise the work to make sure that it meets the safety and quality standards. Maria looks forward to helping her daughter raise a healthy and happy boy.

loans.use: to buy materials to replace an asbestos roof and install a floor

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more inventory (red oil, pepper, rice, etc.).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy potatoes and oil, among other things.

loans.name: Mujeres Al Progreso Group

texts.es: El grupo “MUJERES AL PROGRESO” se encuentra conformada por 08 socios quienes se a la agricultura y al comercio minorista. Marizola tiene 40 años es casada con 02 hijos dependientes. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa para niños  polos short buzos. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de uniformes escolares camisas faldas pantalones y chompas para niños. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo brindado. Marizola es la primera  del lado derecho viste casaca ploma.
texts.en: The group “MUJERES AL PROGRESO” is made up of 8 members who work in agriculture and retail. Marizola is 40 years old and married with 2 dependent children. She works selling children's clothing: polos, shorts, sportswear. The loan will be invested in buying school uniforms: shirts, skirts, pants, and sweaters for children. The group is thankful for the Kiva investors for the loans they provide. Marizola is the first one on the right side wearing a jacket.

loans.use: to buy school uniforms: shirts, skirts, pants, and sweaters.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay medical expenses for his wife.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy school supplies such as notebooks and uniforms.

loans.name: Robinah

texts.en: Robinah is married with four children and all of her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a business selling charcoal and has been in this business for some years. She has applied for a loan of 1,700,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. She generates additional income from a pub. She works from home six days out of every week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality, thieves and defaulters. She is aspiring of becoming a wholesaler and also to buy a plot of land and build her own house.  She resides in a rented house and the family has access   to piped water but no access to electricity. Her monthly expense includes school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.en: Mavluda was born in 1970. She is married and has three children. She lives with her family in a house which is located in a village in North Tajikistan. She has worked hard to earn a living for 20 years. Mavluda has been busy selling fruits and vegetables in a local market. She also sells a variety of salads. Mavluda’s husband helps her with managing the business. Mavluda needs a car to manage the business. She buys fruits and vegetables in bulk from other regions and sells them in a local market. She needs a car for transporting goods. She is asking for a loan of 2000 USD to buy a car. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy a car for her business

loans.name: Lesbia Pastora

texts.es:
Lesbia de 48  años de edad, madre soltera con un hijo menor de edad, el cual está estudiando en la universidad. Es originaria de Leon, lugar que está  ubicado en la zona de occidente del país.  En la vida ha sido muy luchadora, trabajadora con ganas de superación personal, para cumplir cada una de sus sueños y metas. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudo estudiar. Hoy en día su sueño es ver  formado  a su hijo en un profesional.
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica una pulpería es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles y en cantidades pequeñas como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, pan, huevos, queso, crema, fósforos, jugos, gaseosas, galletas etc. Ella dedica a su negocio unas doce horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos, el negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos comestibles, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.  Lesbia agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a  personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en: Lesbia, 48 years old, is a single mom with an underage son who is studying at the university. She is a native of Leon, a place located in the western area of the country. In life she has been very hardworking and with a desire to advance, in order to achieve all her dreams and goals. Unfortunately, because of a lack of financial means, she was not able to study. Nowadays her dream is to see her son become professional. Thanks to her efforts and her desire to advance she has a grocery store, a small shop where she sells food items in small amounts such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, cheese, matches, juices, sodas, cookies, etc. She works some twelve hours a day offering her products. She has the business in a room of her house. She will invest the loan in working capital and to stock up her business of buying and selling food items, so that in the near future she can earn a better income. Lesbia is thankful to the Kiva lenders for the help they give to persons of scarce resources and poor countries such as Nicaragua so they can have a worthy job.

loans.use: to stock up her grocery store with food items: rice, beans, milk, bread, eggs, cheese, cream, matches, juices, sodas, cookies, etc.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana vive en la ciudad del Cusco al sur del Perú y pertenece al banco comunal “Imasumac II” de la Asociación Arariwa. Juana es una mujer trabajadora y responsable que saca adelante a su familia y su actviddad económica principal es la venta de pasto y leñas. En esta oportunidad Juana requiere el préstamo para comprar más leña y pasto. 

Juana agradece por apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Juana lives in the city of Cusco in southern Peru and is a member of the Asociación Arariwa’s Imasumac II village bank.
Juana is a hardworking, responsible woman who is supporting her family with her efforts. She makes a living selling fodder and firewood.
Juana needs this loan to buy more fodder and firewood.
She is grateful for the support she’s received and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy fodder and firewood.

loans.name: Silvia Elena

texts.es: Doña Silvia es originaria de la ciudad de León. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica al negocio de pulpería. Se siente agradecida con KIVA y MiCrédito ya que con el crédito anterior logró ampliar su negocio y satisfacer la demanda de su clientela. Solicita el nuevo crédito para comprar: Jugos, Galletas, Cuadernos, Lápices y otros útiles escolares. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que podrá obtener mejores ingresos y así mejorar las condiciones de su familia.
texts.en:
Silvia is originally from the city of Leon.  She works in sales and has her own school/office supply business.  She is grateful to Kiva and MiCrédito since she was able to expand her business using her previous loan and meet the demands of her customers.

She is asking for a new loan so she can buy juice, cookies, notebooks, pencils, and other school supplies.  She believes that the loan will be very helpful to her since it will let her obtain greater profits and improve the quality of life of her family.

loans.use: buy juice, cookies, notebooks, pencils, and other school supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more oil, rice, etc. in order to expand her sales.

loans.name: Noel Eric

texts.fr: Noel est un homme de 38 ans mariée mère de 2 enfants de 6 mois et 2 ans. Il est commerçant et a ouvert une petite alimentation qu'il gère lui même depuis 04 ans. C'est grâce à elle qu'il subvient aux besoins de sa famille. grâce à son accueil chaleureux et ses relations de bon voisinage, il a conquis et fidélisé une clientèle qui s'accroit au fil du temps, et là, il ne parvient plus à la satisfaire totale d'où la nécessité de ce crédit dans son activité en ce moment parce qu'il lui permettra d'augmenter le stock des produits de première nécessité (riz, savon, huiles, détergent et autres...). Ceci augmentera ses ventes et donc sa marge bénéficiaire. Bénéfice qui sera en partie réinvesti dans son activité pour l'agrandir et le reste lui permettra de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Noel is a 38-year old married man and [the father] of two children, six months and two years of age. He is a vendor. He opened a small store he has been managing himself for four years. In this way he supports his family. Offering friendly service and maintaining good relations in the neighborhood, he has been able to build a loyal clientele which keeps growing with time. He is no longer able to meet all demand, and so he needs a loan at this time because this loan will allow him to increase his stock of first necessity goods (rice, soap, sugar, detergent etc). This will increase his sales volume and his revenue margin. Part of his revenue will be reinvested in his business for further growth, with the rest used to provide for family needs.

loans.use: to increase his stock of first necessity goods (rice, soap, sugar, detergent etc).

loans.name: Evaristo

texts.es:
Evaristo es un cliente de Kubo Financiero y esta es su historia.

Evaristo esta casado y su esposa se llama Maria Guadalupe, ellos viven solos pero se consideran un matrimonio muy solido.
El se dedica al alquiler y venta de madera y cimbra, también a la venta de madera nueva y usada. Evaristo trabaja en este negocio desde hace 25 años. Su principal logro es  tener una casa propia y haber mantenido su negocio por más de 25 años. Su meta es mantenerlo estable a futuro. El se  considera una persona responsable, por que paga bien y no le gusta quedar mal.
texts.en:
Evaristo is a client of Kubo Financiero, and this is his story:

Evaristo is married, and his wife is named Maria Guadalupe. They do not live together but consider their marriage very strong. Evaristo works selling and renting timber and formwork. He also sells new and used wood. He has been working in this business for 25 years. His main achievement is having a home and having kept the business for over 25 years. His goal is to maintain a stable future. He considers himself a responsible person that pays well and does not like to look bad.

loans.use: to buy timber and formwork for his business

loans.name: Lucia Guadalupe

texts.es:
Lucia Guadalupe es una clienta de Kubo Financiero y esta es su historia.
Me llamo Lucia Guadalupe tengo 35 años y vivo con mi esposo que se llama Oscar, y mis dos de 12 y 15 años, somos originarios de Huitzilzingo.
Tengo una cooperativa escolar en una escuela primaria, vendemos especificamente comida en la hora del descanso, de lunes a viernes y el negocio lo atiendo yo y una persona que me ayuda.En la primaria tengo 2 años, pero desde hace más de 5 años me dedico a estenegocio. Los logros son que económicamente estoy más estable y mi patrimonio ha crecido, los retos son acabar de mejorar mi casa y es por eso que estoy solicitando el crédito para compra de material de construcción como cemento, tabicon y arena..
texts.en:
Lucia Guadalupe is a client of Kubo Financiero and this is her story:

"My name is Lucia Guadalupe.  I'm 35 years old and live with my husband, Oscar, and my two children, ages 12 and 15.  We're from Huitzilzingo.

"I have a student store in an elementary school.  I manage the business and have one person who helps me.  We sell food from Monday through Friday during the break.  I have worked in elementary school for two years but have had this business for more than five years.  My achievements are that I'm more stable financially and my legacy has grown.

"The challenges I face are finishing the improvements on my house, which is why I'm requesting this loan to buy construction supplies such as cement, cinder blocks, and sand."

loans.use: to buy materials such as cement, cinder blocks, and sand to fix up her home

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria lives with Filiberto, the father of her three children. Gloria works in a beauty parlor in town, and Filiberto works as a farmer growing corn. Their two eldest sons are now teenagers, and they have a baby, Dirasse, who is just one and half years old. Dirasse appears in the photo with her mother. The older kids find it difficult to share a room and a bed with the little one. They also need a space to study and have privacy. Gloria has been saving for the last few months and is now asking for a loan to finish buying the materials she needs to build the bedroom. Gloria and Filiberto are not employed formally, so they have no access to credit through other organizations. Gloria is looking to give their kids the space they need without compromising their privacy. The teenage kids and Filiberto will work on the construction and receive supervision from a certified technician who will make sure the work meets the quality and safety standards. This new addition will make everyone in the family much more comfortable.

loans.use: to buy materials to build a bedroom

loans.name: Juleta

texts.en:
Juleta lives in Geghakert village with her husband and 28-year-old son. The family is engaged in agriculture. Specifically, they keep on the farm two cows, two pigs and two calves. Juleta also cultivates tomatoes, greens and cabbage for family use and also to sell.

Juleta's son owns a tractor and provides rental services to villagers. With the profit that he earned last year, he purchased two cows for their farm. Now to be able to improve her farm, Juleta decided to ask this loan of 3000 USD. She will use the loan to pay for two oxen, tomato seeds and materials for renovation of the greenhouse. This is very important for Juleta and her family to increase their agricultural income and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for two oxen, tomato seeds and materials for renovation of the greenhouse

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for biodigesters/biogas for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the biodigester/biogas for resale

loans.name: Lorena

texts.es: Lorena  tiene la edad de 29  años, está soltera  y vive con dos hijos actualmente. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de abono y dar asistencia a una plantación de café. Ella desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo para que este le permita tener una mayor producción y así tener mayores ingresos económicos. Ella espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productora. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Lorena is 29 years old, is single and lives with her two children. She needs a loan to buy fertilizer and protect her coffee plantation. She wants to provide adequate maintenance for her crops which will permit her to have better production and generate higher economic income. She hopes to provide her family with a higher quality of living and a more stable financial situation in the future. And she wants to continue to grow as a person and a producer. This is her first loan from FUDECOSUR. She has never had a loan from the State Banks. FUDECOSUR is offering her a loan with better conditions and much lower rates of interest.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and fumigants.

loans.name: Ivett Sofia

texts.es: Aumentar sus ventas y utilidades es el propósito de Ivett , pues sueña mas adelante con abrir un punto comercial y remodelar su vivienda ubicada al sur de la Ciudad. Ivett es una mujer casada y madre de una hija de 1 año de edad , que tiene 2 años de ser comerciante, actividad a la que se dedicó una vez contrajo matrimonio y decidió no trabajar para una empresa, con el fin de lograr dedicarle tiempo a su familia y estar atenta  a los quehaceres de su hogar. Hoy comercializa ropa interior y exterior, calzado, perfumes, bolsos y accesorios directamente a su clientela, vendiendo a  crédito y de contado, desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche; Ivett ofrece posibilidades de pago a crédito a su clientela, mientras ella  realiza sus compras de contado  en almacenes mayoristas y a través de guías especializadas de negocios, a las que está inscrita. En la actualidad está aplicando aun credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará mercancías variadas como ropa, calzado y diversos accesorios. Con esta inversión incrementará sus ventas y por consiguiente sus utilidades, haciendo que su credikiva sea exitoso.
texts.en:
Ivett’s goal is to increase her sales and profits. Her dream is to open a shop and remodel her home in the southern part of the city.
Ivett is married and the mother of a one-year-old daughter. She has had her business for two years, having started it once she got married and decided not to work for a company so that she could spend time with her family and take care of tasks around her home.
Today she sells clothing and lingerie, shoes, perfumes, handbags, and accessories directly to her customers, in cash or on credit, between 8 in the morning and 8 at night. Ivett offers her customers the possibility of making purchases on credit, but she buys her products in cash from wholesalers and through specialty guides that she subscribes do.
She is currently applying for a Kiva loan. Her first financing will be through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, and she will use it to buy a variety of goods such as clothing, shoes, and accessories. She will use this investment to increase her sales and thus her profits, making her Kiva loan a success.

loans.use: to buy a variety of goods such as clothing, shoes, and accessories.

loans.name: Jose Leonel

texts.es:
José Leonel de 47 años de edad, casado, con dos hijos menores de edad, los cuales están estudiando en primaria, es originario Leon, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Se caracteriza por ser trabajador, responsable, con ganas de superación personal en sus ratos libre le gusta disfrutar de la compañía de su familia. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económico no pudo cursar una carrera, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar ingeniería en sistema.
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la venta de mercadería como pantalones, faldas, ropa de niño ropa interior, sabanas, uniforme de colegio, perfumes, shampoo, crema, body. EL dedica a su negocio unas doce horas diarias ofreciendo su producto.  El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. José Leonel agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a  personas de escasos recursos en países pobres como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
José Leonel is 47 years old and married with two underage children who are studying in primary school. He is from Leon, which is located in the western area of the country. He is known for being hard-working and responsible and for having the desire to overcome personal obstacles. In his free time he enjoys spending time with his family. Unfortunately, due to a lack of financial resources, he wasn't able to study for a career; he would have liked to have studied systems engineering.

Thanks to his effort and his desire to get ahead, he has a business selling merchandise like pants, skirts, children's clothing, underwear, sheets, school uniforms, perfumes, shampoo and body lotion. He works about twelve hours a day, offering his product. The objective of the loan is to invest in working capital and to stock his business, so that in the near future he may obtain better earnings. José Leonel thanks the Kiva investors for the help they provide people with scarce resources in poor countries like Nicaragua to have a dignified means of work.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and to stock his business buying and selling merchandise like pants, skirts, children's clothing, underwear, sheets, school uniforms, perfumes, shampoo and body lotion

loans.name: Amistad 2 Group

texts.en:
Esmeralda is the group coordinator of her group Amistad (Friendship) 2. Her story is representative of both the members of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican. Her group is based in the Samana peninsula. Here she makes her home in a simple structure with her husband and three children.

Esmeralda is a long time associate of Esperanza and this will be her 8th loan with us. She has repaid the other seven successfully and grown her business of selling shoes with different styles and sizes and for women, men and kids. With this loan she plans to invest by buying many pairs of shoes. With the profits she expects to reinvest in her business and to save for her future planes. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy shoes to resell

loans.name: Zarnigor

texts.en: Zarnigor is 18 years old, single and lives with her parents. She graduated with good marks but her parents are poor people and she did not have an opportunity to continue her education in any university. Now, she is going to organize her own business by sewing national dresses. She took part in a course, ‘To Get Ahead,’ offered by a women's organization. Zarnigor got a lot of useful information from this course. She is asking for a loan of 5000 Somoni to buy a sewing machine, needles, tread and fabric for her new business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine, needles, tread and fabric for a new business

loans.name: Kasenyi United Group

texts.en:
Zakiel is a member of the Kasenyi United Group (Sub Group B). He runs a fishing business in Kasenyi, which is found in the Kasese district. He is the father of three children aged nine, six and four and he also has takes care of two other children. 

He joined the business world in 1986 when he was still a young boy. He helped his father with the fishing business until he grew into a responsible man and started his own business with the purpose of earning a living. He was convinced that the direction he took was a good one since his father was able to look after them using the profits from the fishing business. Zakiel works an average of nine hours per day and uses three hours per day to try market the fish he gets. 

He would like to use the loan to start a retail shop since he is faced with the challenge of stiff competition in the fishing business. He is hopeful that the retail shop will bring him higher profits in a given period than the fishing business. He has wanted to pull out of the fishing business for some time. Zakiel is hard working and, if given the loan, will make sure that he puts it to good use so that he can ably pay it back, earn profits and be in the position to pay tuition for his children and meet their other needs.

loans.use: to buy daily-use household items for his retail shop

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana lives with her husband, son, daughter-in-law and three grandchildren (ages 6, 4 and 2 years old).
Together with her family Svetlana has been engaged in farming. They run a farm which includes two cows and a calf. Near the house where the family lives, Svetlana also cultivates corn, potatoes, tomatoes and greens. 
They sell the gathered harvest in nearby open markets to earn income vital for the family.
Svetlana asks for this loan to expand the farm. The loan of USD $2,500 will be used for purchasing three oxen, potato seeds and fertilizer. This will enable them to increase their agricultural income. They are very grateful to Kiva lenders for support and trust.

loans.use: to pay for three oxen, potato seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Santos Milagro

texts.es:
Santos de 34 años de edad, es una  mujer luchadora quien no tuvo educación apenas aprendió a leer y escribir por medio de educación a adultos, ya que menciona que sus papas no la quisieron poner a estudiar y desde pequeña se dedicó a los quehaceres del hogar, vive junto a su compañero de vida quien trabaja en la frontera. Es madre de dos hijos una hembra de 16 años y un varón de 19 años de edad. Pero con ella solo vive su hija y su nieta. 


Ella vende enchiladas, yuca frita y otros productos de comida típica, negocio en el cual tiene más de 12 años de dedicarse, aprendió de pequeña a hacer los distintos productos típicos. El negocio lo tiene en su casa y le ayuda su hija ya que sus esposo trabaja y las ventas las realiza por las tardes 3 veces por semana. 


El préstamo será utilizado en la compra de más mercadería, como: yuca, maíz, aceite, frijoles, pan, sazonadores, etc.  ya que se le aproxima un evento de un torneo de futbol en su comunidad y por lo cual estaría toda la semana en dicho evento y por lo cual carece de capital para la compra de mercadería 

A futuro planea seguir trabajando de la misma manera y que su negocio vaya mejorando día con día y poder salir siempre adelante luchando como siempre  y poner un puesto fijo en un lugar de mayor comercio para mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Santos is 34 years old.  She is a hardworking woman who did not attend school, but learned to read and write as an adult.  Her parents did not want her to attend school, and since she was young, she took care of the household chores.  She lives together with her life partner who works at the border.  She is the mother of two children, a 16 year old daughter and a 19 year old son.  Only her daughter and her granddaughter live with her.  

She sells enchiladas, fried yucca, and other food items.  She has had this business for more than 12 years.  She learned to make different traditional foods when she was young.  She works from her house and her daughter helps, since her husband works.  She makes sales in the afternoons three times a week.

She will use this loan to purchase more merchandise such as yucca, corn, oil, beans, bread, and seasonings, since a soccer tournament is coming up in her community.  She will be there all week, and she is lacking capital to purchase ingredients.  

In the future, she plans to continue working in the same way.  She wants to improve her business day by day and be able to work hard to move forward like she has always done.  She would like to have a fixed location in a location with more commerce to increase her profits.

loans.use: to purchase yucca, corn, oil, beans, bread, and seasonings.

loans.name: Fernanda De Paula

texts.en:
Fernanda, 32, has two children, is married, and works to help her husband. 
She dreamed of opening her own business in the field of soap, and she supported this desire by having taken a course to specialize in the manufacture of handmade products. 
Fernanda is very dedicated and committed to doing, as well as being very capricious, which is great for this area of work. 
She needs money to buy raw materials to produce perfumes and soaps. 
In addition to realizing her dream, it will contribute to the family income.

loans.use: To buy raw materials to produce perfumes and soaps

loans.name: Marjana

texts.en:
Marjana operates a grocery store in Korça, the city of her residence. The loan she is requesting would be used to buy a refrigerator and add counters to the store.  
She is married and has two children. While she runs the store, her husband works in the drainage boarding of the city. 

For several years, the art and music remained a hereditary tradition amongst all classes, with the serenade still going strong.  Every year, there is a festival of the serenade that is organized by the municipality; hundreds of people visit the city to watch this festive activity.  Another organized festival is that of Santa Children who parade in the streets of the city and the main boulevard between Christmas and New Year's.

loans.use: to add to her grocery store a refrigerator and counters

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is widowed with five children and one of her children goes to school. She also takes care of her grandchildren. She has a business selling bags of charcoal and has been in this business for 10 years.  

She has applied for a loan of 2,000,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. She doesn’t have any other income-generating activities. She works from the market five days out of every week and sells on wholesale basis. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. She aspires to own a delivery van to make transportation easier and also to help with building rental houses. 

She resides in the family house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy shoes wholesale.

loans.name: Señor Cautivo De Ayabaca Group

texts.es: Edita de 62 años de edad es separada con tres hijos independientes. Ella forma parte del Grupo “Señor Cautivo de Ayabaca” que está constituido por 07 socios responsable. Edita se dedica a la venta de tamales lleva más de tres años en su negocio, producto de su gran esfuerzo pudo salir adelante. A sí mismo vende jugo de naranja por las mañanas lo que le permite tener un ingreso extra a su hogar. Se siente feliz por lograr su meta de tener su negocio propio. Es por ello que solicitó el crédito para la compra de maíz, carne, huevos y de esta manera preparar sus tamales. El grupo “Señor Cautivo de Ayabaca” agradece a los inversionistas Kiva que hicieron posible este crédito. Edita es la segunda del lado derecho, viste blusa blanca.
texts.en: Edita is 62 years old and separated. She has three children, who are independent. Edita is part of the "Señor Cautivo de Ayabaca" loan group, which has seven responsible members. Edita has been making a living selling "tamales" (a typical corn dish) for three years. Her business is the result of her great effort to get ahead. Edita also sells orange juice in the morning, giving her an extra income for her household. Edita is happy to have achieved her goal of having her own business. Edita is now applying for a loan in order to buy corn, meat and eggs to prepare her tamales. The "Señor Cautivo de Ayabaca" group is grateful to Kiva investors who are making this loan possible. In the photo, Edita is the second on the right and wearing a white shirt.

loans.use: to buy corn, meat and eggs so as to prepare her "tamales".

loans.name: Flory

texts.es: Flory, una persona  emprendedora , tiene 49 años de edad, es casada  y vive con su esposo  y un  hijo  actualmente, ella  solicito un préstamo con el anhelo de  comprar insumos como abonos, y fumigantes, ella desea dar asistencia a los cultivos de café, con la finalidad de mantenerlas en buenas condiciones durante su desarrollo, para obtener un producto de buena calidad , la única delimitación que tiene es la falta de dinero  para continuar creciendo, ya que de esta actividad económica dependen para poder salir adelante, por lo que ella  hace una solicitud  de  crédito , y es el primer  préstamo que ha  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no registra otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja……
texts.en: Flory is an enterprising person. She is 49 years old, married and lives with her husband and one son. Flory has applied for a loan in order to buy supplies such as manure and fertiliser. She wants to help her coffee crops to keep them in good conditions as they grow and thus have a good quality product. The only restriction that stops Flory from growing is a lack of money. Flory depends on this work financially in order to get ahead. As a result she is applying for a loan, her first from "FUDECOSUR". Flory has no other loans with state banks but "FUDECOSUR" has offered this loan under better conditions and with lower interest rates.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as manure and fertilisers.

loans.name: Armine

texts.en:
Armine lives in Tsaghkalanj village of the Armavir region with her husband and 22-year-old daughter. Armine is an agronomist with many years of experience of running a farm. She is mainly involved in land cultivation and also keeps 10 chickens. Specifically Armine cultivates haricots, potatoes, cucumbers and greens. Her husband sells the gathered harvest in nearby markets and that's the only source of the family's income.
Armine has now applied for this loan to ask Kiva lenders to help her with the farm. She also owns a greenhouse which is too old and needs to be renovated. The loan of USD $1,000 will be used to purchase a polyethylene cover for her greenhouse and fertilizer for cultivation of the land. This is very important for Armine to continue her farming business and she hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for a polyethylene cover for her greenhouse and fertilizer for cultivation of the land

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more goods to attract more customers.

loans.name: Zarrina

texts.en: Zarrina was born in the year 1978. She is married and has three children.  Her husband is a farmer. She has her own business. She began her business with selling children’s clothes six years ago. Zarrina began her business with the support of her husband. Zarrina sells her goods in a local market. Every season she  renews her goods. She must buy children’s clothes for the new spring season but she does not have the money. She is asking for a loan of 6,000 Somoni to buy children’s clothes for the new season. From the profit she is going to improve her living conditions. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy children’s clothes for the new season

loans.name: Lilik

texts.en:
Lilik lives in Haytagh village in the Armavir region. She lives there with her husband and their only son serves in the army.

Together with her husband Lilik runs a farm where they cultivate haricot, potatoes and greens. Near the house where they live Lilik also owns a small orchard where she grows peach and cherry trees.

Now, by applying for this loan Lilik would like to improve her farm. The loan of USD 1800 will be used to purchase potato seeds, fertilizer and a polyethylene cover for the greenhouse. This will be a huge support for this hardworking woman and her husband to continue their farming business.

loans.use: to pay for potato seeds, fertilizer and a polyethylene cover for the greenhouse

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn, gas and firewood to start up her business again.

loans.name: Claudia Maria

texts.es: Doña Claudia es originaria de la ciudad de Managua, casada y madre de cuatro hijos, tres de ellos ya independientes. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de mercadería variada. Se siente agradecida con KIVA y MiCrédito ya que el crédito le ayudo a obtener mayores ganancias. Solicita el crédito para comprar: Cosméticos, Ropa, Cremas, Perfumes etc. estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda para incrementar su inventario y satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Claudia is native to the city of Managua. She is married and the mother of four children, three of which are independent. She is a businesswoman who makes a living through the sale of a variety of merchandise. 

She is thankful to Kiva and MiCrédito since the loan has helped her to obtain better profits. She is requesting the loan to purchase cosmetics, clothing, creams, perfumes, etc. She estimates that the loan will be very helpful to her by increasing her inventory to meet the demand of her customers.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics, clothing, creams, perfumes, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make repairs/additions to her family's home

loans.name: Clyde

texts.es:
Clyde vive en la ciudad de La Paz. Trabaja como soldador y plomero,  nos solicito el crédito para poder reactivar un negocio de restaurant que anteriormente tenia (chicharroneria) en la zona de la isla y de esta manera tener mayor ingresos economico.

El sueño de Clyde es dar buenos estudios a sus hijos y que salgan profesionales. Que su negocio sea de beneficio.
texts.en:
Clyde lives in the city of La Paz. He works as a welder and plumber. Clyde is requesting a loan so that he can reopen a restaurant business he previously had (selling fried pork skins) in the District of La Isla. This would enable him to generate more income.

Clyde dreams of providing a good education for his children so that they can become professionals. Therefore, his business would be beneficial.

loans.use: to buy pork and chicken for his pork & chicken rind business

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit is 48-years-old and she lives with her two sons in the village Gugark in the Lori region. Unfortunately, Anahit’s husband died in an accident several years ago and all the hardships, which life prepared this family for despite their loss they managed to overcome with patience and dignity. Now Anahit’s elder son regularly goes to the Russian Federation and does different construction work and transfers the money to his family members. Her younger son works at the bread factory as a baker. Anahit has vocational education with a nurse's specialty and for 10 years she worked at the local polyclinics.  After losing that job she began working as a tailor at the garment factory.   She still works there. The thing that Anahit wants to improve are the living conditions for her sons and she decided to establish a farm, which her sons are ready to support.

She needs a loan of 250,000 Armenian drams for the purchase of a cow, which will allow her to sell milk wholesale at the city market and to enlarge her family's income a little bit.

loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: Karine

texts.en:
Karine is from Griboyedov village in the Ejmiatsin region of Armenia. She lives there with her mother-in-law, husband, and two children, ages 8 and 11.

Karine runs a farm. She owns greenhouse where she cultivates wheat, potato, tomato, and some greens. Her husband sells the gathered agricultural products in nearby communities, so the family gets income for living.

Karine has applied for this loan of 1,000 USD to make some improvements to her farm. She will use the loan to purchase tomato seeds, fertilizer, and polyethylene cover for her greenhouse. The loan will be a big help to this family and they hope for your support.

As this is Karine's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products in the past because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to pay for tomato seeds, fertilizer, and polyethylene cover for her greenhouse.

loans.name: Lindita

texts.en:
Lindita, an Egyptian Albanian, has been photographed in her front yard washing her family’s clothes by hand. This was common amongst all Albanian females, and how they washed clothes up until the collapse of the communist regime. It was some kind of tradition or something, that this activity would take part on Saturdays. In every house yard, front and back, one would see clothes hanging outside to dry. The white clothes, they would boil in water with organic soap made of olive oil, and on a fire with logs. Women would compete with one another on who had the most white clothes, or comment on the whitest clothes in the village, or even in towns and cities. Funny :_))

Lindita recycles scrap plastic and glass for cash, and she sells them to the factories in her city. Her husband had an accident sometime back and has damaged his spinal cord. Lindita needs your kindness and financial help; she wants to build a little toilet and a kitchen and she can’t do that without you.

loans.use: to build a toilet and a kitchen.

loans.name: Gevorg

texts.en:
Gevorg is 31 years old and lives in the village of Khashtarak in the Tavush region of Armenia. He lives with his parents, wife, and 5-year-old daughter. Gevorg’s father is a tractor operator and Gevorg does different construction jobs, but without farming they could not earn enough for their family's living. Gevorg and his father are particularly engaged in breeding pigs; he currently has six piglets on his farm. They sell pork and eggs from their farm, for which Gevorg has his regular customers. From their plot of land they also gather hay and sell it to the villagers.

Gevorg is requesting a loan of 450,000 Armenian drams in order to enlarge his farm with five more piglets and buy some animal fodder as well.

loans.use: to enlarge his farm with five more piglets and buy some animal fodder.

loans.name: Paytsar

texts.en:
Paytsar lives in Haytagh village with her parents-in-law, husband and two sons, ages 9 and 5-years-old. 

Paytsar and her family run a farm. They are mainly involved in land cultivation and they also keep some chickens. 

Her husband also provides a transportation service using his own truck. Now, Paytsar asks for this loan of USD 2,000 to make some improvements on her farm to be prepared for the new spring cultivation season. Specifically, she will use the loan to pay for potato seeds, fertilizer and materials for improving the greenhouse. 

The lenders will greatly assist this family with the loan so the family hopes for the lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for potato seeds, fertilizer and materials for improving her greenhouse

loans.name: Vianush

texts.en:
Vianush is married and lives with her husband, son, daughter-in-law, and grandchild in Haytagh village. She is an agronomist who has been involved in land cultivation for many years. Specifically she cultivates potatoes and greens and sells them to local wholesalers. She is very enthusiastic about running her farm in a sustainable way ensuring a good income for her family.

Vianush requested a loan to purchase potato seeds and materials for fixing her greenhouse. This loan will greatly assist her to improve her farm and continue her agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds and materials for fixing the greenhouse

loans.name: G/s La Villa Del Señor Group

texts.es:
El g.s la villa del señor está conformado por tres integrantes dos mujeres y un hombre, madres y padres responsables con cinco hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Son originarios de Carazo, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte de la región. Se caracteriza por ser trabajadores, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. En sus ratos libre le gusta disfrutar de la compañia de sus hijos. Lamentablemente no pudieron 
cursar una carrera y se vieron obligados a trabajar desde temprana edad, para ayudar con los gastos del hogar.

Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene la coordinadora es Grethel y tiene por actividad económica la venta de mercadería en general como pantalones, camisas, chinelas, sandalias, cosméticos, perfumes, body. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 10 horas diarias ofreciendo su producto,  ella desempeña su actividad de forma ambulante y tiene clientes fijos y eventuales. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra  mercadería, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. El g.s vina del señor agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The solidarity group La Villa del Señor is made up of three members, two women and one man, responsible mothers and fathers responsible for five children. They are native to Carazo, a place that is located in the northern zone of the region. They are characterized by being hard-working and responsible, with the desire for personal improvement. In their free time they like to enjoy the company of their children. Unfortunately, they were not able to complete their studies and they saw themselves obligated to work from a young age to help with the home expenses.

Thanks to their efforts and desire to come out ahead, they have the coordinator Grethel. Her economic activity is the sale of general merchandise such as pants, shirts, slippers, sandals, cosmetics, perfumes, and body spray. She works at her business some 10 hours a day offering her products. She performs her activity on foot and has regular and possible customers. The objective of the loan is to invest in work capital and supply her business by purchasing merchandise so that in the not very far future she will be able to obtain a better income. The solidarity group Viña del Señor is thankful for the help that the Kiva lenders provide to people of scarce resources and poor countries like Nicaragua a dignified means of work.

loans.use: to invest in work capital and supply his business purchasing and selling merchandise such as pants, shirts, slippers, sandals, cosmetics, perfumes, and body sprays.

loans.name: Elmira

texts.en:
Elmira, 45 years old, lives in the village of Sevkar in Tavush region with her husband, two daughters and her in-laws. A former accountant, upon marriage she became a housewife and started to help her family in farming and agricultural activities. 

Their livestock consists of four cows, four heifers, four calves, four piglets, two horses, two rabbits and 20 chickens. They also cultivate cereals and raise  apple, pear, persimmon, fig, mulberry and cornel trees. As a result of hard work,  they manage to sell many farm products such as meat, dairy products, eggs, fruits and some vegetables (garlic, onion, greens, carrot and etc.).
 
Elmira is requesting a loan of 450.000 Armenian drams in order to buy fodder for her farm animals since the pastures will not be rich with grass until April.

loans.use: to buy fodder for her farm animals

loans.name: Songa Mbele Group

texts.en:
Zainabu is in her mid 30s. She is currently running a kiosk where she sells food items, including breakfast with bites like donuts and chapati. She also sells soft drinks and beer in the same room. 

She is married and has three children; all of them live at home and are in school.  Zainabu prefers to run her business in Dar es Salaam due to the high business inflows compared to other cities in Tanzania. The city is full of adventures and has customers of all types, and any business is profitable as long as you focus on your trade tips.  She starts working from 6 a.m. to 10 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

Zainabu is requesting a 14th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania to buy business chairs, soft drinks and food raw ingredients like baking flour and cooking oil. With her previous loans, she bought a business TV and radio to attract people to her business. She started building brick rooms for her business.  

She has paid back all of her previous loans successfully. Zainabu used her profit to cover home and school expenses. She dreams that one day she will be able to own a big retail shop. 

She will share this loan with her loan group “Songa Mbele," which consists of four members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy business chairs, soft drinks and food raw ingredients like baking flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Kilombero Group

texts.en:
Brown, who is in his early-40s, is single with two children who are still in school.  He has been running a general store for eight years now.  He works from 6 am to 10 pm daily, and is able to make a good monthly profit.  

This will be Brown’s tenth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to buy out-of-stock items for his store, and has paid back all his loans successfully. He is doing great. 

He appreciates the loan. He used the profit to pay school fees, bought land, built a house, bought a TV set and a radio and mattresses, and covered household expenses. He is doing great and is happy. 

He will use this loan to restock the sold out items. 

He dreams of building another house.

Brown will share this loan with his loan group, "Kilombero", which has two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock sold out items

loans.name: Warumi Group

texts.en:
Pasisi, who is in her early 40s, is married and has four children who are still at school. She has been selling milk and fats from milk since 2002.  She works from 6 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Pasisi's 12th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy and sell milk, and also bought milk to shake and make fats, which she also sold. She has paid back all her loans successfully. She used the profit to pay for school fees, bought a TV set, radio, and fridge, built her own house and covered household expenses. She will use this loan to buy milk to resell. She dreams of owning a wholesale business.

Pasisi will share this loan with her loan group "Warumi," which has three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy milk to resell.

loans.name: Msakuzi .b Group

texts.en:
Calista, who is in her mid-40s, is married with two children who are still going to school.  She has been running a pharmacy since 2002.  She works from 8 am to 11 pm daily, and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Calista’s fifth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.   She used the previous loans to buy medicines, and has paid back all her loans successfully. 

She is happy with the loan, and appreciates everyone who has supported their group.  She used the profit to pay for school fees, and covered household expenses. 

She will use this loan to buy fast moving types of medicines.  Her dream is to open another pharmacy.

Calista will share this loan with her loan group, Msakuzi, which has five members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy fast moving types of medicines.

loans.name: Msakuzi .a Group

texts.en:
Fransisca, who is in her mid-40s, is married with three children who are still at school; she has been running a business of selling utensils since 2008.  She works from 7:00am to 6:00pm daily, and is able to make a very good monthly profit.

This will be Fransisca’s tenth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  

She used the previous loans to increase her stock of different types of utensils.  She has paid back all her loans successfully.  Fransisca used the profit to pay school fees, and helped her husband with household expenses. She is doing great, and appreciates the loan. 

She will use this loan to buy fast moving types of utensils. She dreams of increasing her business.

Fransisca will share this loan with her loan group, "Msakuzi .a Group", which has four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy fast moving types of utensils.

loans.name: Beijing Group

texts.en:
Adella is in her early 40s and a single mother of one minor son under her care. For sixteen years now, Adella has been managing her life by running a food stall business (mamalishe).  She is known to her business place for being an enterprising, hardworking woman who has a desire for personal success. Adella started her business because she needed a source of income and did not have a permanent job due to her level of education. She starts her business early, and 6 am, and works until 4 pm every day. She is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

This is her ninth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. Adella used her previous loans to buy cooking supplies like charcoal, rice, maize and baking flour. She bought new working equipment for her food business, like chairs and plates. She has paid back all of her previous loans successfully. With her business profit, Adella bought a fridge, bed, TV and cooling fan, covered school fees, and home expenses and saved for her life.  She thanks Tujijenge for its convenient products.  She will use this loan to repair her cooking place and cover its open area with iron sheets to protect her clients from rain and sun. She dreams of shaping her boy's life with good education and wants to build a house.
